3EIc7WAoiojTFdy3TGOMfQ.review_text: Rogue rocks, especially when Kay is in the hoouuuuse!!!  Checked it out for the first time this evening and loved it.    Kay recommended their version of Pilsner Urquell and it was deeelish!!  Next time I'll stick around for some vittles, as they smelled yummy.

FLwY5zLEIgmBr0H-n4eyoA.review_text: Walked into the pub at 6pm to a pretty full bar with lots of reasonably sloshed people... usually a good sign that the beer in a brewery works...  Nice pub with nice beers. The Rouge Pale ale is really quite a nice beer. Only ate finger foods but they all seemed to taste like food (the cheese platter was golden) Place to sit, place to eat and drink... things work... perfectly placed in north beach just near washington square you can grab a nice coffee around the corner and then sneak around to the rouge and steal a pint... gold

HYQoxBC1y1DGPq6pGP09Tw.review_text: I didn't eat anything all day, while I was working. So I got off at 3pm and went straight here for a quick bite and a brew. Just one of two micro-breweries/restaurants in North Beach, this place serves 20 of their locally-owned micro-brewery beers on tap. To see the selection of available beers, the bartender was very cool in allowing me to check out the cool knobs for each beers. Dealing with a stressful work day, fatigueness and with an empty stomach, I started out with a Racer-5 IPA beer. With one huge gulp of one of their own in a pint glass, I was instantly "in the groove". And yes, my bartender noticed a "red glow and pink cheeks" on my face. 1st beer: yelp.com/biz_photos/plIG… From the food menu, I had the Chicken Strips with fries. For $10.00, I get three pieces of chicken strips battered to golden brown and some fast food fries. Nothing too fancy about the food, but the food was good enough to hold me over until dinner. My meal: yelp.com/biz_photos/plIG… After my snack, my second brew was the Morimoto Soba Ale. Named after obviously after the famous Iron Chef, the brew had a very unique herbal Green tea  aftertaste. 2nd beer: yelp.com/biz_photos/plIG… This place is not a bad place to hang out when you're in North Beach or taking a break from shopping in Chinatown, which is only three blocks away. You can also purchased many of their beers, including the brews I had, at many gourmet markets throughout the Bay Area.

BQ73YHpyADiz-Wf1OQ0EPg.review_text: I love Rogue.  I've been here on a few occasions to grab a drink w/ friends, a lowkey (but fun!) birthday celebration, and for trivia night.  They have a great variety of beer on tap, friendly bartenders, and a pretty decent food menu/selection.  It doesn't strike me as a place where people get crazy and rowdy even though I've been there on weekend nights before.  A great place to grab a couple beers w/ friends and/or to start off the night.  I definitely plan on frequenting Rogue a lot more.

FgGiQc9zpM_va5JZMvJtMQ.review_text: Despite what my check-in history says, I've been here many, many a beer-o'clocks.   In my experience, it's a cinch to get a table. During slow hours, take your pick, and during peak hours, it just takes a peek and miniature exploration to find something. (Nice outdoor area, great bar, lots of interior dining space).   The waiters are usually attentive and find you once you've sat down. Most importantly, they are always eager to describe both the house and the guest beers; I always feel comfortable asking questions. (You can never go wrong with the Oregasmic Ale or the Imperial IPA). Motto mention that both beer menus are extensive and varied; you can always find something to tickle your fancy.   The food is your basic, satisfying, heavy comfort food. You can find healthy menu items, but if you go to a pub looking for a healthy meal, you'll just have to close your eyes and pretend that your beer-battered onion rings totally count as a vegetable. (Their onion rings are delicious) Their black bean burger is very yummy; it's usually what I get. However they offer other dishes like sandwiches, mac and cheese, sausages, chili, large salads, Irish "nachos," and other culinary stomach assaults.   Been here countless times, would go back countless times, great spot!

JnN7fWESKk3MXR2zfD_XKw.review_text: Three stars because they have a very large selection of both Rogue and non-Rogue draft beers.  We stopped in only to sample the beer, not for the food.  Of the 4 beers I ordered in my sampler, they were out of one. The beer seemed very lukewarm and not the cold refreshing taste we wanted.  The service was lukewarm as well.  The oatmeal stoudt was worth a taste, but I'm not a fan.  If you are only picking one brewpub, I recommend trying a different one.  However, if Rogue beer is your fav, then go for it.

Yi5JKaD1VY4Edeww92PZWA.review_text: Rogue is my favorite neighborhood bar in the North Beach area! Not only is it a super convenient location, I love sitting outside and people watching. Their beer is great and their staff is AWESOME. They also have trivia on Thursdays which is a lot of fun. Oh, and they make amazing bloody marys. A lot of my happiest memories from the last year have happened at Rogue, so I'm definitely biased when I say this place is the best.

MfPimAFtij9KSvJLSisGlg.review_text: The bartender mixed hazelnut and the chocolate stout. Very good  Cool neighborhood and great staff

4IjzfbO7XKFNWWVufHNhww.review_text: Rogue has some nice little tables outside that invite you to sit and drink and soak up the sun if you're lucky. Catherine O. and I decided that after a long evening of house hunting nothing sounded better than a cold beer and a little thing we like to call the Kobe beef burger.   We took a seat outside with the other chaps and everyone seemed very friendly. Like "pass the salt to our table will 'ya" friendly. I think they had all been there longer than us. The Rogue beer will do that to you. Not only is it tasty, but the waitress will help you pick the one you want and bring you as many as you want.   The burger was ok. I think I was expecting "wham, bam, thank you kobe" and I got less than I was hoping for. The servings however are huge and splitting a burger was just perfect for the two of us. I think my next visit will be a drinking only trip.

CgKb22edkZoIqbOrDFnwtQ.review_text: Outdoor seating in the back. Lots of beer on tap, and service is quick and friendly. This is perfect for groups to mingle. Laid back, come as you are vibe.

pQqM6aKaHf6AstBRzP7oRg.review_text: If I owned Rogue, I would fire all the servers and bar tenders that work there.  The beer was good, the food was average, but my buddy and I were amazed how awful the service was.  While waiting for our food, we witnessed 3 groups of people who were frustrated enough to leave before the slap dick waiter could even bring them menus.    It's not like they're too busy either, there were about 5 other occupied tables.  The bartender was a dooche too, and the overall atmosphere was not too welcoming.  They were blasting the Giants post game show so loud I had to yell for my friend to hear me.  It's too bad because I always wanted to like this place, being a North Beach resident.  With the job market as rough as it is today, I'm surprised the Rogue employees could care so little about getting paid.  Get it together Rogue, all the Yelp reviews reference your shitty service!

blbQ4tvXCDhOYSrSjJz23g.review_text: Nice big space, very woody and friendly -- but ultimately kinda a let down.  Really not not that much in the way of funk on tap -- at least when I dropped by midday on a weekday. Maybe that was the issue.  Still, worth a stop if you on in the corridor and jones-ing for a quality craft.

L6dpoRtzjfw__wasCXReYA.review_text: This place NEEDS to improve on its food quality. BADLY. If you're going to pay $15 for a Kobe burger ask for it rare and get it well done (with the cheese looking like its been sitting under the lamp) No Bueno. And it's not like the food is bad some of the time, it's bad all of the time. No hit or miss there. Rogue then needs to start improving on the friendliness of their staff. If you hate your job, fine. But it shouldn't be my problem. Service = courtesy. What Rogue does have going on for itself and probably the only reason you should consider patronizing this less than deserving of your hard-earned dollars establishment is the beer AND the amazing patio. If you do plan on spending a sunny afternoon there, my advice to you: pack a sandwich.

WW2rFfCCW_rDVp3QOxIipg.review_text: The pub quiz here was a lot of fun.  The beer is delicious and diverse, the crowd is not too serious,  and the food is totally fine.    I would probably come here on a non Thursday night, but only to drink.  The food isn't that tempting.

_TBi1YmtfeLjJuG2EV26jA.review_text: I haven't tried eating here, so reserve my review just for the "bar" aspect of this place. And it's pretty awesome.  The decor and furniture is comfortable, the place is pretty open to allow for groups to stand around and talk, and the beer selection is great.  You're in the heart of north beach, so I would recommend going to any number of other eateries nearby for food, then come here to relax with friends and a few beers.

ixZkO8n3pRCdt166dTvoaw.review_text: I give this place a 5-star cause it has finally gotten me to drink beer - a feat I have failed over and over again since my underage drinking days as I tried to fit in mimicking others enjoying a cold brew beer/ale or whatever beer snobs call it.  Well, I guess I only drink this one beer they serve there - it's their Orange Honey Wheat beer.  Now I look for it at every brewery & I finally fit it!  Too bad that I care less now that I'm older!

x2iNSImBeCRc6KRtrxXv-g.review_text: I'm a fan of the Rogue in Portland and had high hopes that my out of town visitors would and I would enjoy quenching our thirst on a Tuesday night this past week.  Sadly, this was not the case.  We seated ourselves and went unacknowledged for 5 minutes.  We gave them the benefit of the doubt and waited nearly another 5 minutes before up and leaving, the first time I ever did that a restaurant let alone a bar.  Very disappointed with the lack of service and even more disappointed that I couldn't have a drink of their fine brews.  :(  I won't be returning to this location, but I'd still recommend Portland's.

75co4zpsIZXVOMQdgoE6cw.review_text: Hit Rogue with a pub crawl on a Thursday after work. Pretty dead scene at the dinner hour when we got there. It heated up later at the bar. Burger was pretty good - everyone seemed pleased with bar food quality that was served. Angus burger was popular and wolfed down by the boys. The beers are tasty, lots on draft from Rogue (Mmm Dead Guy Ale!)  plus you can do flights if you want to same a handful. Bathroom was in need of a scrub. Overall, good place to stop for a pint when cruising through North Beach.

sT4F9_XFpQRPSeBd-_AneA.review_text: I used to go here all the time for Trivia Night, which was a lot of fun.  Great beer, seeing as it's an actual ale house that brews its own brews... heehee... and the waiters/waitresses are pretty cool.  Only part that sucks about this place is its location.  It's in North Beach (awful in terms of parking and shady-ness, but fabulous in terms of eateries and clubs), so if you're meeting up with people for a few beers before a night out, get there SUPER early to find parking.

SB99H6_FKCiTOvqYyYqueg.review_text: I'm not a beer drinker, but we did have fun here, the beer i tried was the Hazelnut nectar, something, sorry I don't remember, it was served cold in a substantial Rouge mug, the place has a great ambiance, it was decorated for Halloween, & that just added to the great vibe.  Everyone around us, seemed to be having a good time,  we did not eat here, but the sliders the table behind me ordered smelled great!

oBgYDUYPl2yI_fD-cB_nIA.review_text: I want to like Rogue. I really do. Unfortunately, there are too many amazing places in SF for me to put up with a mediocre joint like this.  We met here for my friend's birthday dinner because she was more interested in drinking her meal than anything else. We got a table reserved, which I guess is not a regular thing so that was cool but our evening was all downhill from there.  Rogue, one easy improvement: print out your beer menu! At least give a copy to the patrons in the back room, or put up a second chalk board. It was SO awkward to walk over and squint at the chalk board behind the bar every time we wanted a new kind of beer.  I ordered the burger, which I was told comes Medium Rare. I said that was perfect - only it came out VERY well done. It's such a shame to see Kobe-style beef ruined like that, nevermind my own preferences. I told our waitress (when she finally came back) that I would eat it anyways but that she should let the kitchen know, and her response was: "Oh. Ok."  Drinks: 5 stars Food: 0 stars Value: 1 star Service: 2 stars Ambience: 3 stars

1COrnp000xLM8B2CkOFu6w.review_text: We walked up to North Beach from the Wharf and was surprised to find a Rogue Ale brew pub in CA.  I love Rogue beer and knew they were from Oregon, so I was surprised to see a pub in CA.  We spent several hours sampling many of Rogues tasty ales and a couple non Rogue beers.  I finished off the night with a shot of Rogue Whisky.  The server was exceptional and we all had a great time.

LIEQubFyKBjLwriPRPv9fg.review_text: Updating my review, because, I REALLY want this place to succeed because  it has such HUGE potential. I went to lunch there today with a friend, and, this time, I can't say the service was bad. However, the bartender was also our waiter, and, there were NO other customers there, so I guess they had the advantage there. (If the bartender reads this he'll know WHO did the review since we WERE the lunch crowd) The beer, as usual was good. The Kobe burger was good, as usual too, but, the fries were undercooked and cafeteria-like. Like I asked before, and I say it again, WHERE IS MGMT? The bartender was great, which is a change from other experiences, but the place was EMPTY!    Read these reviews MGMT! This place has HUGE potential with good food, beer, location, and not to mention, a beer garden out back. Ok, enough time spent on this place. The MGMT should spend as much effort running this place as I've spent reviewing it! In fairness, I guess I have to bump it up a star, but, this place should be busier and the bad reviews just keep coming in.

nbOYS_LPTy_d1UtC_B9fAw.review_text: Guys! C'mon,  Rogue is a pub. They specialize in beer, not so much in the food dept. Being a proud member of a bar plaque, (which means that I am a borderline alkie), I can attest to the fact that the food menu is hit & miss.  But again, most bars in the city are.  Rogue has gone through some changes over the years. I remember when they hid the hard liquor because they wanted to push the beer.  I also remember when we "beer connosoors" (i know the spelling is wrong) would laugh at beers like Budweiser and Miller.  !!!!!!!! NOW THEY HAVE THEM ON TAP !!!!!!!!!   bad, rogue. BAD.  But in the end, Rogue is still a fav. There is a lot of love there. If any of you guys become a regular, you'll know what I'm talking about.  as one hippie told me... "it's all about the beer, man".  You are so right, mr. smelly hippie. You are soooo right.

FV8EUrM1yFeQm3pTnzrweA.review_text: This is our favorite pub in the city. We always walk over to it and spend a few hours drinking and eating before we get back on BART.   The staff is always super friendly and we have gotten some good deals on our tab more than once.

Lr-B-r-KF80yFy-2u336bw.review_text: This was our last stop on our North Beach Crawl. I like Rogue they carry Hazelnut Brown Ale which is one of my favorite Rogue Brews.Which I had a few of. But I like to sit on their outside tables and gaze at Washington Square Park and Coit Tower. Its also a great spot to people watch.

PcPminF0bIUsKjUh9e4DMQ.review_text: UPDATE:  10/25/07   Ate here again.  Kobe cheeseburger, medium rare, and Chocolate Stout.  Just as good as I remembered.    Only advice I would give is check their schedule.  Don't come on a Trivia Night unless you get here early.  It was sooooo crowded and we had to wait to get a seat at the bar just to get our burgers.    It was worth the wait, but bring good company to keep your mind off of how you are craving those burgers.  **************************************************­*****************  Kobe beef burgers & chocolate stout! Could life get any better? A older joint at the bottom of Union Street hill - North Beach. Feels comfortable, casual and totally relaxed. You could lose many hours in here with friends and not even know where they went. The service is ok, the staff friendly  . . . . but the real draw here is the meat & beer . . . . cooked to perfection!    Don't miss this place if you are low on iron!  You'll be able to donate blood for days with no fear of falling off the chart!

ZL8RHo7oPAAD75MfJzrVIw.review_text: The beer selection deserves 5 stars, but the food and service rate about a 2 at best. It's not horrible, but really not great, and not cheap either.  To boot, the crowd is frequently/usually very douchebag-heavy...obnoxious drunk assholes with their sloppy drunk girlfriends in tow. Amateur night, yo.  Again, the beer selection is great, but there are plenty of great beer bars in SF and Oakland. I'll go to Rogue once or twice a year when I have to be in North Beach, but I'd generally rather just take my money to Toronado or Beer Revolution for a much better experience.

ngx5LiOu-CNBudjlYs_GMA.review_text: Awesome place to come for some drinks. I've sat at the bar for hours before watching football. The bartenders and customers are always great. Unfortunately I am allergic to beer, so the ciders (specifically huckleberry cider from two rivers) make a great substitute as well as the spirits, of which most come from rogue farms which is awesome.

Zk0RGkhWxcSlbsRzpu3DmA.review_text: After seeing the Kobe beef burgers on the menu I made the assumption that the regular hamburgers must be pretty good. When our food arrived, I was unpleaseantly suprised to see what appeared to be a sad soggy pilsbury chocolate cookie sitting on a bed of iceberg leuttice and yellow mayonaise.  The bun was bone dry and and seasoned with what could only have been cornmeal. The beer was better and the staff was friendly, but perhaps just a little bit too wrapped up in shark week coverage as my glass stayed empty for 10 minutes or so and I had to ask twice for water. I may go back to try the Kobe beef burger but intuition tells me that they'll serve it on the same tired bun.

ILz8ApVEgTqbv5LnC6PyuA.review_text: Really good selection of Rogue beers among other guest beers. Tried the Oak Stout from the Cask and it was delicious. Then I tried it again and followed it up with a Dead Guy. My only complaint is that you have to throw down at least $25 to actually catch a buzz, but thats par for most North Beach bars (except for the few "hidden" gems). The take home Growlers are very convenient, yet again, not cheap...

fvtKAImpVmginXpilSeEow.review_text: My friends and I stopped by here after a long day of exploring the city and Alcatraz.  We actually walked here from Ghirardelli Square and it wasn't too bad of a walk.  Anyway, we love the Issaquah Brew House (Rogue) in Washington so it was only natural that we needed to try out the Rogue in San Francisco.  I do like this one better than the one in WA, but the beers are just as expensive.  I wish they were serving more local guest beers on tap.  This Rogue has more of a downtown "regulars" kind of feel as opposed to the Issaquah location which is always full of lots of suburb families.  It wasn't extremely packed, but the service was pretty slow at the bar.

zpXqbJQ2CT4PsUBTy30DbQ.review_text: 5 stars! GREAT beer selection. They even have Lindeman's Framboise! My favorite.  There are always a lot of guys there, so I definitely recommend this place for all the single ladies that want to do happy hour :)  I've never had the food here, but it looks like they only have traditional bar food like burgers and things like that.

AubdZjrTVXkyN8uPoUw87A.review_text: BAD Kobe beef burger, BAD Kobe beef Chili Dog. I feel bad for Kobe beef for them using the name Kobe beef in their menu.  They are not using  "really" Kobe beef.  May be domestic Kobe style beef if any...    Kobe beef is one of a Wagyu "brand". There is about 139 Wagyu variety across Japan (concentrated in southern Japan). Wagyu means Japanese beef. Wa=Japan and Gyu=beef Definition of Wagyu is : A cow those of which born and raised in Japan. Wagyu have to come from Wagyu cow with 100% Wagyu parents and have to be grown in Japan.  I do not like their beer.  Sorry RAPH

0H2ggT37lK8hsbH8aGR1Ug.review_text: 8/30/14: This was the middlelish stop of our epic beer tour which started at Lagunitas and would go on to include Russian River, here, Mikkeller, Cellarmaker, here, Monk's Kettle, and finally Speakeasy, all over 2 days!  I've been enjoying Rogue beers for quite a while--I like them because they dare to be different.  Not all flavors are good, in fact some are straight up nasty like one of the original variations in those pink bottles, whatever that was called.  But some are out of this world, like their Double Chocolate Stout.  1. 4 beer flight: Good way to sample their beers, which will be hit and miss.  Variation in taste is huge, and many of theirs are love-it-or-hate-it types.  But I am sure there will be at least one that you will LOVE.  2. Kobe Tacos $11.95: Very good.  What can you say?--beef is well seasoned and very savory.  Probably best taco stuffing I've ever tasted.  Did being Kobe/Wagyu make a difference?  Probably not since the whole deal with those is the crazy marbling and tenderness, both of which would be rendered away cooking it this way.  But no matter what they used it was VERY good.  8/10.  3. Rogue Chocolate Stout Hot Fudge Sundae $6.95:  Best sundae ever?  Quite possibly.  Check out the pics I included---look at the layers of textures and gooey craziness!  Beautiful complication of basic dessert.  9/10.  As a bonus, this place wasn't stupid crowded like the others we had hit up.  Very nice environment to sit down and enjoy world-class beer, and eat some special yummy stuffs.  Just perfect.  5/5.  #pub #bar #beer #taco #dessert #brewery

DFENl5W4GgwGshWSgP3vbA.review_text: I've been 3x, all for lunch, and have been disappointed every single time.  The first time I ordered a kobe cheeseburger and they overcooked it.  My husband had the same thing and it was great.  The next time I went I gave it another shot, b/c of his burger and again, not impressed.  Finally I decided to give it one more try and got the french dip.  The was by far worse than the other 2x I went.  The beef was grizzly and kinda thick and the bread was crappy.  Loved the tator tots that were served w/ my mom's lunch.

QHxOyICyzj7AASeAxH1viA.review_text: now i'm a huge beer nut and i love dead guy ale... and rogue as a brewery but as a restaurant i have never received such HORRIBLE service. the first time i dined at this establishment the food i received was cold and the waitress rolled her eyes at me when i sent it back after waiting an hour for it to show up and the service got worse from there. the second time i went back for beer because i swore i would never eat there again. when the waitress brought us our beers i proceeded to pull her extremely long hair out of my beer.... in front of her.... and i quote "oh is that mine hehehe" and she WALKED AWAY without even offering to replace it with a fresh arrogant bastard! so as i said before rogue beer is amazing and i love it but there service is terrible! oh and if you want to eat on a monday feel free not to show up its bar quiz night

_Ti5EP_Ms7Ncus5d4jpK8A.review_text: great selection of not only the rogue brews, but many other breweries were represented taking the guest roles. The decor of the room was not that entertaining, and it just didnt seem like that inviting of a place.  i will come back here. still not sure if i will actually try the food, but ill have another pint.  i loved the barleywine and the imperial pilsner.

VUAZE0zTUPG5rMJnTJcefQ.review_text: Why do I always end up in places that specialize in beer when I don't drink it myself? Oh, that's right b/c all my friends are beer loving fools! (I mean that as a compliment)  Hubster and TB were familiar with the beer of Rogue and so were pleased with their selections, Miss V got a hazelnut thing that no one else seemed to like at all. She did though.  Burgers (Kobe and non Kobe), a ruben and a taco salad were ordered by the crowd.  Bacon adorned mine and the whole thing was pretty good (even though it wasn't Kobe), I especially liked the yummy pickle spear that came with it. My biggest disappointment was the fries that were delivered to me were lukewarm. and not salted. I had like 2 and then just stopped eating them. You need good fries to go with a good burger, these were not good.  Miss V said her ruben was "skinny" but she seemed to enjoy it. I didn't ask her opinion of the above mentioned luke fries. Same goes for Hubster and TB who had burgers and fries.  The highlight of the meal was the drunk and affectionate couple at the table next to us who went through about 3 orders of wings and numerous beers, in between which, the guy fondled his gals sizable bra less boobs and adjusted her g string. Classy.

1DAzZPdaN78njTKhbC1JFg.review_text: One of the first bars I found after moving to SF and also one of the best!! An absolutely fantastic selection of draft beers in a pretty nice location. More emphasis on craft brews than imports (go to La Trappe for the Belgians). Friendly bartenders and reasonable prices -- so glad this place is in the neighborhood!!

60TZxjzbi9tYaWxPQ4nKSw.review_text: It's a cool bar overall because they have their own brews. The food is ok. It's bar food, so you can't expect too much. Great beer selections on tap. Super casual spot.

-5MkKTWc0FcEBs8grw6t3A.review_text: This place is amazing! Awesome beer, good service, and great location! If I lived in SF I would be a regular. You have to come check it out!

19MQQFLbpI5z6PYhHrG2mg.review_text: I love the beer here! They have so many good beers here it is so overwhelming when you walk in. I just never know where to start. I love the patio area. Sure its not all pomp and frills but its about the beer.

_don8EWxNsvRdjDJqWbw0w.review_text: Very nice service!!! Server was really helpful and awesome. Food was ok, drinks were great!

Zpdh9rHGEHkwJwrsTbHnyA.review_text: Rogue Pub Haiku   Wasn't too busy  Nice, laidback crowd - just our pace Their raspberry beer  Is so delicious  TV Dinners on menu? Pear cider's great, too   Rogue Pub satisfied  My beer-brewin'/lovin' friends This is a chill place

ODSH1it5oAUPu2clIgOvyg.review_text: Came here on a wednesday afternoon. If you aren't specifically looking for it, you could easily miss it, as it blends in pretty well with it's surroundings. I've been to the one in Eugene, Oregon and wanted to see if there was much of a difference between the two. It turns out there's a huge difference. Not sure if it's just how the building is or they purposely made it look like that, but it has a very old dive bar feel to it. The one in Oregon was almost the polar opposite, everything was new and felt geared towards families. The beer options were much better here. There were plenty of seating, but for some reason, everyone hovered to the bar today. Service was a bit slow

tLHOUMtntejdMzZowQN97g.review_text: I was here on Thanksgiving around dinner time to stop and have a beer or two or 3.   My love and I are into craft beers. Our date night's always include a beer spot and food of course.  I don't really know how busy this place gets since I've only been here on thanksgiving but I realize that I enjoy places that are not so busy so I enjoyed the atmosphere.  I ordered the mocha porter - good! Love ordered an imperial IPA of some sort - good! Then we had a chocolate stout, GREAT! Omg I wish I had some ice cream with that. It was so good I was basically chugging it. Haha! (All rogue beers)  They have a lot of beers on tap. Pretty much half rogue beers and half other beers from different micro brews. Great place in a great area of the city to visit.  The service was great. Employees were honest. Apparently rogue treats their employees horribly so most employees aren't supporters of the brand but they will for sure lead you in the right direction of what is good. I'll come back here.

eTZhMslm9hfeXS-Rq8uGiA.review_text: A friend brought me here on a tour of SF and we had a beer flight on a lazy Friday afternoon.  For $7.50, it's a deal that can't be beat.

NCcaug9hUY4CdX9fN3kABQ.review_text: This is great place to start out the night on a weekend or hang out during the week.  It's pretty chill early on and Mon-Thu, but can get packed by the end of a weekend night, and fall victim to slower service and one of my biggest pet peeves about a bar - a bathroom line, even for dudes! I love getting the sampler to start things off.  I've been working my way through sampling all their beers, and it could happen (in a couple more years). They have a wicked big selection of awesome beers.  I don't know if I've ever tried one I haven't liked.  I'll take the other reviewers word for the food not being that great.  That's why I don't eat at bars.  Bars are for drinking.  Especially a bar with an awesome beer selection like this one.

hs49qaQtTkiiUk1GWvNDkw.review_text: Hate this place.    When it opened I was stoked on the outside beer garden and went a number of times overlooking the soggy fries and overwhelming detergent-y flavor which permeated just about everything.    Then things got pretty bad, some kitchen drainage problems I won't elaborate on but which leaked out in to their patio - ick so we stopped going. Since I live around the corner I walk by at least once a day.  The entire strip of side walk around their business always stinks of urine and vomit which I'm assuming they are just allowing to marinate the poor scraggly unkempt tree adjacent their beergarden.  Trash is always overflowing onto the sidewalk and pouring down their handicap ramp.  In short it's nasty and since it's in Northbeach I'll go ahead and add, Nasty-simo!  I've approached their employees about it a number of times and have been rudely treated. No surprise since they are infamous for their horrible service. This is why we are right in not allowing chains, who are economically untouched by local boycott due to their size, into the neighborhood.

DqZL39PwB52IOHLQHP6yxw.review_text: Good beer selection Place can be crowded Overall a good place to hang

8Wt4_xi5WOWdEp706ZBuoA.review_text: I love Rogue beers and that's what keeps me coming back here.  They have a lot of their own beers on tap and some guest brews too. The pints are on the expensive side, especially for house brews ($6+) The food is just OK - typical bar food, lots to choose from if you're a meat eater.

Y7M5baxByxUs8qBcrOyoqA.review_text: Beer is delicious. But horrible service - didn't see our server EVER; she was friendly so not her fault but they should hire more servers.  Also I found a hair in our already not delicious Irish nachos that was fried along with the dish. They took it off the check which was great, but would prefer to not have it there in the first place.

WpCW366f95XBYzXxq0SmZQ.review_text: This place was super cool. I just wish I had known it was trivia night and I would've gone all out.   I love Rogue beers. They are _legit_. Plus, they have a huge selection that aren' typically offered in bars.   I had the XS Dead Guy Ale, and hooo-eeee, that stuff is strong. And super delicious.  My only gripe was that we waited for 10 minutes for service and then gave up and went inside.   The have a sweet back outdoor patio with lights and flags and just full of awesome. I really dig this place, will definitely go back.   The good: awesome selection of los beers. The bad: service was ehhh, but it was a really busy night, willing to give it another shot.

SyPAggj658DY2h_FZdslgg.review_text: Beer is great, usually never too crowded but the mixed drinks??!?? Woof. Pretty sure my 93 year old grandmother could mix a better Moscow Mule. Our team snagged a table on a Friday night which was great but decided to move on after little/no service.  Might not be a bad idea to have a waitress walking around taking drink orders instead of having to walk up to the bar each time? Mo Money, Mo Problems.

u9VUkq_h4LpvfPNWFxQKrw.review_text: Super fun on trivia night (Thursdays normally, but currently Wednesdays with football season)! Their burgers are yummy and they have a good selection of beer. They could definitely fit more people in the place, but its a good spot after work to get drinks and possibly food. I wouldn't necessarily come here just for the food, but the vibe is great.

fUSsb6zgdAWAAYxvTapr2g.review_text: Very mixed feelings about this one. I wish I could give two separate ratings - one for Rogue as a drinking establishment and one as a restaurant.  Side Note: slowly but surely, my plan to review every establishment with the name Public House is happening (yes, I realize this is many since "public house" is just a name for a bar)!   I stopped by Rogue Ales Public House for some Sunday evening drinks and dinner. We sat outside in their enclosed patio, which was not very busy, but not empty. I've found it a bit hard to find places with good outdoor seating in the city, so their patio is a nice little oasis from bustling North Beach. It has cute little lights and a serve-yourself water cooler, which I actually thought was nice as I tend to guzzle water and hate to wait for refills.   I am not so familiar with Rogue's extensive beer list, all of which I believe are brewed by them at their Oregon-based brewery. Our server informed us that they were mostly out of their light beers, so I started with their cider. It was tasty, but in my opinion most ciders all taste the pretty much the same. I also tried the Buckman Ginger Pale, which was really amazing! Not overpoweringly ginger-flavored or dark. I will have a hard time getting another beer when returning here, but their list is so impressive I will have to force myself!  Unfortunately, I also had dinner here. I ordered the Kurobuta ham sandwich, which was described as a quarter pound of "cuban-style" ham with a honey dijon glaze. What I received was what looked like what I may have eaten for lunch in 2nd grade. It was pretty sad looking. Not much ham and yellow mustard on white bread...didn't taste bad but very unimpressive and nothing I would ever pay for again. I could make a better sandwich! It was supposed to come with pickles but I guess the kitchen forgot to put them on. However my server, who was awesome, noticed before I did and brought me some. It didn't help the sandwich much, but I did get a free drink for their mistake! The great service could almost make me overlook the underwhelming food. Almost.  I did also have the chance to try the fish and chips, which was made with Mahi...yum. It was much, much better than the sandwich, making me think that maybe I just mis-ordered. However I can only review what I did order! The fries, which came with the sandwich and the fish and chips (duh) were actually very good.  Despite the disappointing food, I will be returning to Rogue Ale Public House...just not to eat. 2 stars as a restaurant. 4 stars as a bar.

GPkB4yPO9wefLzUT8tlFhw.review_text: I am a big fan of Rogue Ales, so when I walked past this place I was very excited. Looking at their menu, I was even more excited to see most dishes were cooked with beer in them!  The beer its self was fine, but the dishes... ehhh. They were just OK.  My "kobe" burger with beer sauce was decent. My fries were sub par. The hummus plate (made with beer) was ok. And my girlfriends kobe taco salad, didn't have any dressings or seasonings. Pretty plain.   I'm giving this 2 stars, despite having great beer, I came here to eat and was disappointed.

xHI0MUS26PbAs92LYWKvTA.review_text: The atmosphere here was not as commercial as I thought it would be, which is good.  They did a great job of making this place feel like a neighborhood pub.  It is good that they have a back patio even if it does not have much atmosphere.  They have a great selection of beer, both brewed by Rogue and by other micro breweries.  I tried the Rogue IPA and it was excellent.  I had to try the kobe beef bacon burger with bleu cheese.  The onion bun was good, it had nice thick slices of bacon, and the kobe beef had pretty good flavor.  The problem was that I ordered it medium rare.  I explicitly said I wanted it pink on the inside.  It came out over cooked and they did not grill the onions.  This is a sixteen dollar burger.  They need to get it right.

ixYLMqLBLo4tfcuQ-ewk9g.review_text: No-nonsense bar/pub with great beers.  I recommend the Hazelnut Brown Ale.  They have trivia night on Thursdays and a beer garden.  I haven't been to either, but plan on going when I get a chance.

hq1X6tIBTNQufilIhrZK7g.review_text: I'm slamming this place because they ripped me off on my jukebox music.  So, I picked $5 worth of music from the jukebox, and they blasted their own stereo system over the jukebox system so I couldn't even hear my f-ing music.  Plus, their beer (and food especially) is nothing to write home about.

xJXl0RJ6RlwcfANp7KywaA.review_text: Clearly I'm the minority, and it may be because I remember this place when it had good food, good staff, and lots of beers on tap that were actually available.  40 beers on tap? Sure, but ask for 10, and you find 6 are out.  I used to drop a couple hundred a month in this place back when they had the Honey Cream.  Then they stopped carrying a few of the beers.  The perpetual "Oh we're out of that" expanded to more and more beers. Then the menu change, staff changed, etc.  Went from one of my favorite spots to drink to me needing to stab someone to try to get a menu.  Food is pretty bad recently as well.  Trivia night is fun, but the bar tenders don't like making good on the free pints the trivia guy gives out, so make sure you use it immediately upon receipt.  Reviewing it because I stop in about every 4 months with the hopes that it has gotten better. Instead, I just keep reminding  myself why I don't spend 2 nights a week there anymore.  See you guys in September if you are still in business.

lFDWeQey1zN7G1sHD2TP-Q.review_text: Went here about 8 years ago on a weeknight, the place was packed, I had a lot of different beers and a great time. Went here for the second time ever this past Saturday afternoon and it was not so packed upon arrival, but by the time we left at 3pm it was full up already.  I wanted a Hazelnut Brown, but unfortunately they were out.  I had a Chamomellow and my husband had the Smoke Ale.  Both were true to their names and no mistake about it.  We shared a plate of fries which were just ok.  They tasted like they maybe had been fried in the same oil as whatever else they serve fried?   We had a seat by the window so there was great people watching out front.  Didn't realize that they had a beer garden until we were about to leave- it looked really nice out there, but it was empty and I got the feeling you could easily be forgotten by the staff if you sat out there.   Our waitress was great.  Efficient and cheerful.   We'll be back someday, but I'm in no rush.

2Seg8WuIVQZ3w515O__A-w.review_text: Beer was good, food was mediocre, service was horrible. They are seriously understaffed and we had long waits for everything.

dJ4QbSN1qswfxn-FB4dE_A.review_text: Excellent service.  Excellent beer.  Reasonable price.  Great place when you are in San Francisco as there are not a lot of options for beer drinkers here (I thought it would be more like Portland).  Almost knocked off a star for not having the correct glass wear, but feeling generous.  Can't believe someone knocked this place for having sports on TV?!  Katie and Bryce thank you!

IN7wjbPoNLonRmf3NXCksA.review_text: Good beer, Good food.  Wait staff forgot half our order though.

ZCtJdzlP71QNIdDoKhg63g.review_text: The food was worse than the beer and the service was worse than the food. How the staff manages to create such an awful experience for the patrons in such an otherwise beautiful neighborhood is almost impressive.  My boyfriend and I went on a recommendation from a friend, having never been blown away by their bottled beer, we had mid range expectations, but we were told the food was great. they lied.  we walked in, and were ignored by the bartender who was spending his time laughing and high fiving with the other staff members. there were three other customers in the place, and yet they still somehow did not have time to pay attention to us. after having to awkwardly interrupt his conversation to ask for a hostess to seat us  (as the sign instructed) we were told "order at the bar and sit down".  we then were ignored for another ten minutes before the bartender asked "oh, did you want a menu?"  after ordering we sat outside on their rather cute front patio dining area. just after our appetizer was brought, two of the staff members proceeded to sit at the table next to us and begin smoking and howling about something. we had to move four tables away. by the time our food arrived (which was really not very good by the way) we had finished our first round. the waiter stared at our empty glasses and turned around and went back inside without offering to refill them. he never came back out. not to bus, not to ask if we needed anything, not to give us our check. when my boyfriend went back inside to get another beer, he was again ignored at the bar.  midway through our sub-par meal, a kid with a dog walks by and his dog proceeds to poop right next to our table. not that this is the dog or the owners fault (we have a dog too, it happens) one of the rogue staffers (who is STILL smoking upwind from my table) gives me a look and tells me to "lighten up, hes a dog". I'M AWARE ITS A DOG YOU ASSHOLE! you know what? when a dog shits at my table im going to make a face. shit and food will never be an attractive paring. im also not finishing my meal because there's no coming back from that. we left grumbling and swearing off rogue beer.  we caught muni and went to City Beer Store (shout out!) and had a lovely time.   the moral of the story, kids: don't ever go to the rogue brew pub, go to city beer store instead.

ajNM87Z8Zavuqezpd08c8A.review_text: This is one of the few places in North Beach i will actually go to. They have a great beer selection(Mostly Rouge beer, but they do have guest beer also) I love the outside seating. They offer curbside seating in front and a patio seating in the back. Both are great in that rare occasion when the sun is out in sf. They also have Tots on the menu and that is always a good thing.

L973P-QsOHEyT7T8HOJw4Q.review_text: Good small bar in the city with an outstanding selection of Rouge beers. Had a great time with some family out of town. Service was lacking and unorganized.

IdnbvI-jYalwwSdLldiw0w.review_text: Spent a beautiful Sunday afternoon sitting outside, enjoying some beer, bar food, and funny conversations with friends. We were lucky to find 2 empty tables when we got there around 3 or 4pm, but there were no chairs, so we just went in and got 'em ourselves. Another customer suggested this (from experience, I assume/hope) and no one seemed to care so I guess it's okay to do that?  Anyhoo, we weren't sure if there was an outside server so we ordered our drinks at the bar and brought them out ourselves (I enjoyed my juniper pale ale, but I had a sip of my sister's moscow mule [I don't think it was called exactly this, but it was something mule with ginger beer] and it was absolutely delicious). Then a server came and we ordered food - fries, tator tots, black bean dip, wings, and popcorn shrimp. What's an afternoon of drinking without fried food, after all? Everything was really good and wasn't greasy at all. I didn't feel gross or (too) guilty after eating it like I do at other places. I would definitely recommend the tots, dip, and shrimp.  This is a great place/way to spend a sunny afternoon. Excellent people-watching location too :)

6H58irvWxvFugsDNdcvSEg.review_text: Sucks, sucks, sucks... The only good thing about this place is that it has a back patio with picnic tables for when its nice out. The food is TERRIBLE, the beer I had was warm and the glass tasted like soap. The service was non-existent. I live in the area and trust me there is no reason to subject yourself to this place. Turn your head there are 1,000 other places that you will like better.

LCe-dOSAcfjz-iQGvTvd5g.review_text: I love this place! nothing special aside from the huge local craft beer selection!  very casual and laid back.

tE3bVYCIqcJaTMeV8N5Bvw.review_text: Everytime I go to Rogue I have a great time.  This is a beer lovers paradise.  Good drinks, great people and on game day they turn the back room into a sports theater.  Classic neighborhood feel and friendly staff.  When the Giants are away, make Rogue your home.  If you're lucky, Billy will be behind the bar serving drinks and good times.   (Try the sweet tea)

5j0QmE-ktdY2wfEYX2YStA.review_text: ive lived in Northbeach for 8 months and have never really been compelled to go in this bar before. Its just not that inviting from the outside. However, this Monday just gone a friend said we should meet there. I thought it was fine. The service was pretty good, the guy always noticed when my glass awas nearly empty. I didnt eat here but my friend had the chili and said it was ok ! .... so i think this isnt probably somewhere you would take someone to impress them but its fine for a monday night !

OrYocPE34VwUlvipvGOGGA.review_text: Tried to come here for dinner and trivia. Came here over an hour early so we could get a seat to eat. The place was full except there were 3 large tables that were "reserved." So we asked if Rogue takes reservations. They do not, and a waitress was doing this for some of her favorite customers. I think that is unfair and they certainly lost my business.   People could have been eating and drinking during that time those tables were held so who knows how much business they lost then.

eXt9426w2kE65rUMhKb4Cg.review_text: Not only do they have their own film festival. Not only do they have a secluded outdoor patio. Not only do they have great prices on microbrews. Not only do they have damn good food (french dip... mmm) Not only do they have great servers (including managers) ok... that's about all I can think of.  But enough said.

jZZug8mOYBV0tMYK7YD6hg.review_text: I came here with my brother and cousins to watch some college football games while visiting the city. One thing that I was definitely not a fan of is that there is only one unisex bathroom and it didn't smell too hit. I can't say that our service was the best either (my brother ordered a beer that never came). Regardless of that, the beer selection was great and we shared a bean dip appetizer that was pretty tasty. It seemed like the tortilla chips were made in house or locally because they tasted really fresh. I got the sampler and loved the hazelnut ale. With some small changes in service and facilities I think that this could be a much more enjoyable experience.

YDFuv_jYUjjyREO3--lUWg.review_text: You kicked us out of two tables, claiming the tables were reserved without warning, and then were rude about it. Don't know if I want to come back

pDfL8xt8F8ls0-kQIG_ADg.review_text: Came in for a Monday happy hour. Good casual mixed crowd; tourists, people after work that live in the neighborhood and people just out and about. Not too crowded, not too loud. Enough tables and seating areas to make it good for groups or a break up location. Saw some guy get dumped. Anyways, there outdoor beer garden looked chill.   * Favorite thing here - Beer selection. Possibly the best beer selection in the city not named Toronado. Definitely best beer selection in North Beach. (yelp.com/biz_photos/plIG…) - Alaskan raspberry wheat - Crispy, clean, tart notes. - Ace joker cider - No complaints - Triple vermillion - Complex with many tastes. Definitely a sipper. (yelp.com/biz_photos/plIG…) * Least favorite - Underwhelming food that sounds better than it tastes. Since, Rogue is Oregon based, they feature many items from the Beaver state.   - American Kobe beef haute dog ($10). Came with Oregon blue cheese and caramelized onions. I like blue cheese but this was way overpowering. The dog which was from Snake River Farms in the Pac-North didn't taste anything special. - Blue balls ($6.5) Kobe beef meatballs filled with bleu cheese.  Way to salty! Just like regular blue balls, these are a no go. (yelp.com/biz_photos/plIG…) Pretty solid and worthwhile for a North Beach pub crawl. Come and stay for the beer. Go somewhere else for the food. 3.5

nWh05uXTfV-L7s3iZon4Fg.review_text: I love this bar in SF! What a great selection if beer and Rouge is one of the best American breweries in my opinion. I really like how you can order a beef and walk outside and sit outside on a table. I really like how the tables and chairs are not roped or fenced off from the sidewalk. It's right on the sidewalk and you really feel like your drinking on a park bench next to a fanatic bar. There are even head lamps above. I really enjoy it and have been here close to 6 times and loved it each time.   The beer selection if out of this world. I'm a huge IPAD and heavy gravity beer fan and there are plenty. I had a stout from Rouge which packed quite a punch! I believe the Apv as in ten's!!  By often have guest taps too.   Overalls great place to grab a beer and meet some friends. A non trendy crowd which makes it very laid back. Check this pace out when you are in North Beach!

ut0JV6-7t9NVP4lJqz36_A.review_text: super yummy beer. Bartenders have nice beards. Just got new flat screen TV's in time for the world series!

GRgtQpxYBbBBKyjBAdzB2g.review_text: I read some review giving very high rates to the beers. I did a tasting (you can pick 4 beers for 8$), but honestly I was pretty disappointed. The Brutal IPA was just too much, while other beers, like the porter and the beard beer, were not very flavorful. Also, 7$ for a pint is really really high. You can find (much) better for cheaper

ySnJRrXNpbHuGYsm5mEAVA.review_text: Their service sucks. There's one guy there who's cool, otherwise (especially after last night) they really disappoint me. Best time to go is mid-day, weekend, for the beer garden. Food is typical bar food with loads of grease. Bathrooms are usually pretty dirty. Inside is large, good for large groups, but with horrible lighting. Overall, def not my fav.

kb2JbvbD2sYnrXbOaOlPNQ.review_text: In short, don't ever order the food! Go (anywhere else) nearby first - even the touristy places on Columbus will have better grub! I hope Rogue HQ sees that their brand is being tarnished and fixes this.   Backstory: I stopped in to meet friends on the outdoor patio, grab a drink and order some food. Rogue was critically understaffed - one waitress for the entire (inside and outside) place, and the bar inside was overflowing with unwashed glasses and plates. The waitress was pleasant but I had to track her down and even then it took a while to get an order in.   I ordered a burger (and a beer). The beer was fine but the burger, as well as my three friends' food took 40 min to arrive and was dead cold and dried out when it did. Easily THE WORST BURGER I've eaten in San Francisco, due to overcooking -& sitting forever in the kitchen. My friends' meals were similarly forgettable.

RzedkTYA2nb4hAKnvEKWaQ.review_text: I've been here many times before and was always happy. A great selection of beers on draft, baseball on the television, what more could one ask for?  I especially enjoy the taster paddles that let you sample a couple beers at a time.

VK-ds3dGSSBoavkFde3e2Q.review_text: 2 things that make this place stand out from all the other bars in the area:  1.  They serve Frambois, or Chamboise, some sort of raspberry flavored beer drink that I adore.  My BF knows to order it for me whenever we're somewhere that serves it, but so far, this is the first place I've been to that serves it in SF.    2.  Outdoor patio with plenty of tables and food service.  Perfect for sitting outside on a sunny Sunday in SF, with some good friends, hanging out with some drinks and food.  The burgers we had were good, and the drinks were great.    Could not ask for more on a nice Sunday afternoon.

1CRVh8dOm8ackFL7w_vPjg.review_text: I love Rogue beer so when I was in San Francisco I had to check this place out. I walked in wearing a L.A. Dodger hat and I saw all the Giant memorabilia on the wall. The bartender gave me a hard time about the hat but it was all in good fun. I came for some beers and they where great. They have just about every rogue beer you want, no double dead guy when I came which was a shame. They also sell bottles if you want to take some home. I had a sample which is four 4oz. tasters for $6 which is the same as buying a pint of one beer. Cool place to get a beer.

EKaQcvJ4Y9Rjeu9w8VNJNQ.review_text: Hands down best beers on tap in San Francisco.  If you have ever been to any local beer festivals/competitions a pint of Rogue Ale is usually sitting on the pedestal ranked #1.  The food is great, expect much more elaborate menu than simple bar food ~ fantastic compliment to their broad selection of beer .  Also, do you ever feel guilty for posting up on a bar stool on a beautiful sunny day?....Well, me too; which is why I truly appreciate the 900 square foot outdoor patio complete with tables, shade (if you're sensitive to the glorious sun).  The staff is friendly, and knowledgeable.  Give them your outlook on life, and mood; they'll slide over the perfect fixture in the form of a cold pint glass.  See you all there soon.  ~ Holla

FI0dcCAuFmW0lutdKO2UwA.review_text: Ownership:  you have a rogue bartender.  Sunday night, May 25th.  This bearded roly poly is more concerned with smoking cigarettes than serving customers. The bar was fairly packed yet he's just sitting out side very leisurely smoking cigarettes several times on a very busy night?  Really?  Standing by the bar trying to get service but there's no bartender!  Laughable.  I also heard this same bartender threaten to "GET VIOLENT" (his exact words) with a customer if he didn't immediately finish his drink.  Who says that?   In fact he was extremely confrontational with many of the customers that night, which came as a bit of a shock.  I get it, you want to go home, you're angry because you're ugly, whatever, but there's a right way and a wrong way to do things.  Rogue, you can do better than have a surly a-hole behind your bar who alienates costumers with displays of disdain and outright hostility.  Clearly this guy can use some anger management.  For whatever it's worth; I won't be spending a nickel in your establishment when this guy is working, nor will any of my friends, and we live in the neighborhood.  This guy is killing your brand.

dUOxmUu0u-DEvZXoYAiodQ.review_text: Good beer selection, greasy food...pretty normal pub fare.  Thurs night pub quiz is the highlight...good fun.

mFsgzbMr11tQvm58yfuE4w.review_text: I think this place has a great outdoor seating patio, which is hard to find here in San Francisco.  It also has a good selection of North West Micro brews, which is also hard to find in California.  That said the food, is really bad, and the service is so-so.  I am giving the place 3 stars overall.  High marks for the outdoor seating and beer selection low marks for the rest.  It is not a place that I would avoid, but it has a lot of potential if it improved some of its other areas.

9B2b-oSQbSryBYvkxX5pIQ.review_text: This is a fun, chill pub/bar to stop by for a nice cold beer or to catch a game on TV if you're in the North Beach area. All the times I've came in was during the day on the weekends and its never crowded--always open seats at the bar or tables and you won't feel judged for ordering shots in the middle of the day.  I love the variety of beers on tap that they offer from their own handcrafted ales, porters, IPAs, etc. and even the other featured breweries. I had a glass of a seasonal pumpkin ale which was really yummy and refreshing. My bf tried their oatmeal stout on nitro, which was very creamy and smooth. I've never ordered anything to eat as I always come here after grabbing lunch somewhere else. This time we just had an order of fries as something to munch on.  Their staff is very knowledgeable about the beers on tap and always willing to give any suggestions or even sampling any to taste. They also offer beer flights if you're interested in trying a few.

Uf2aufwMXKze-kCqYQnsMA.review_text: The beer is really good and the food is even better! Also very cozy atmosphere at the place and friendly people. I am definitely going there again on Friday.  You should try their dark beers,  very tasty stuff...

DCgsCzczEWG4lTNpHVsQhA.review_text: This week I had a colleague coming to town for business and I wanted to take him out in North Beach with some of our coworkers.  He is a beer fanatic and likes Rogue Ales.  So we put Rogue on our list of places to visit on Wednesday night.  We decided to hit it last and checked the hours of operation on the website noting that they close at midnight.  We arrived to the pub at 10:45 and sat at a table for nearly 10 minutes.  The place was nearly empty.  Finally somebody from our party walked up to the bar and the bartender took off.  After a few minutes he came to our table and informed us that last call was 15 minutes ago and they were closing for an employee meeting.  Really?  An employee meeting at 10:45PM on a Wednesday?  We protested, just one please?  Nope, we had to go, even though the pub still had several patrons finishing their beer.  No apologies, no offer to take some of their bottled beer or merchandise to go.  We walked six blocks from Vesuvio to try the Voodoo Doughnut Maple Bacon Porter, and left with nada and a bad opinion of the jerks at Rogue.  My buddy from out of town says he won't be drinking Rogue any more.  The other three of us won't either.  There are just so many terrific brewers around.  If one thinks too much of themselves, don't drink it.  Go somewhere else.  I know I will.  Bottom line:  don't try to visit Rogue Ales Public House on a week night -- their posted hours of operation are not reliable, and the bartender is snotty.

XJhmTEAJuYRgIP4b9wMcTw.review_text: Are you a Barley or a Hops?  That's what you have to decide when you choose which restroom to go to.  And apparently even though hops is a type of flower, that doesn't mean it's the women's restroom.  It's good to get this clear in your head BEFORE you get drunk.  They have a lot of beers, but they all mostly suck (at least all the ones I tried) and are overpriced.  It's also quite cold, I mean, physically, a strange draft flows through the whole place when the back door is opened...  But lots of space for large groups.  Depends, I guess, on what you are looking for.

Lwxkbr8vENIummUcnRcPDA.review_text: as a place to go boozing during the day, 4 stars.  rogue has some really good beers, and it's a down home space with big windows and a back patio.     as a place to get food, 1 star.  the one time we ordered food, our service was good but the dishes (with the exception of my friend's burger) were totally bland, small portioned, and way overpriced.   next time I'll sneak in a slice from golden boy.

QZ11FSqn_YxGc7AtwuhMSg.review_text: I went here this weekend because I enjoy their beers and wanted to check it out.  I took bart and walked to the brewery which wasn't too bad of a walk and stopped inside.  I ordered their hefenwizen which was pretty good.  The bartender was friendly to us.  We were sitting at the bar.  It wasn't even that crowded.  The beers were a bit pricey I thought around $6 each.  They were really good though.

Nj_cqtTCkfe3ibPNKx44LQ.review_text: This place is an awesome bar to start at. They have an extensive beer list with majority of them being specialty beers from the Rogue brewery. We each got a sampler of 4 tasters and it totaled 8 bucks each. 16 ounce beers are 7 dollars and it just seemed a little pricey for a Sunday football day but that can just me being a little picky. The food though is stupidly expensive for the plates that I saw coming out but it is a fun atmosphere and I would totally go here again.

8OG2JNaMcBWkc-sSwWotHA.review_text: i went to rogue a couple of weeks ago before a show at bimbo's. it was recommended that we get a kobe beef  burger and hazelnut beer. the kobe burger is 1/2 lb of m-m-m meat-goodness. i had it with the "award winning" white cheddar cheese. i think i could have done without the cheese. you have to get the beef cooked medium rare to really enjoy the quality of the beef. for some reason, my guy friend got twice as many fries as i did. even though i ate all of mine and some of his. strange.  the hazelnut beer is quite delightful. with just the right sweetness. it made me think of a lighter, sweeter guinness with a hint of hazelnut. we had two pints each and had to jam for the show. apparently, the bottled stuff they sell in stores doesn't do it justice. if you like that stuff, you've got to go to rogue for the real deal.   okay okay, the service wasn't stellar but it's a pub. what kind of service can you expect?

MjCIBCRp7p4B_ITMWDpKzQ.review_text: I came here last week STARVING after helping my friend move to a new apartment all day. All we wanted at this point was a beer and some good food-- and that's exactly what we all got.  I only tried one of their beers, I believe it was called Omengang. Really delicious, and I'm excited to come back and try some different ones in the future. I ordered the Bleu Ball Sandwich (kobe beef meatballs stuffed with bleu cheese on a hoagie and smothered with marinara). It's usually served with chips, but I paid the extra buck to get the fries (worth it). Everything tasted so good, I cleaned my plate!  The menu here is wonderful, and full of variety. I had such a hard time picking what I wanted because everything on it sounded delicious. I'll be back soon, definitely!

aluPAfSifiA7BhLfw1Rinw.review_text: Super Nerd Nite is amazing. Rogue is an incredible venue to host it. 5 STARS.

xp9UEkFyz7h7Ii1XVzU4tA.review_text: -1 star for running an outdoor beer garden and not having a list of beers outside.  It doesn't take an advanced degree in business to realize that having a beer list outside is a good thing.  -2 stars for serving a plate of hot wings so small and expensive we actually had to ask if they were quail or pheasant.  +1 star for taking that off our bill when we complained.  -1 star for not having pitchers of beer.  What kind of beer house are you?  -1 star for running out of onion rings.  We're not talking about difficult supply chain management of hard-to-procure items.  Its pretty standard fare.  +1 for having a nice outdoor seating area.  If you're in North Beach and the weather is nice this is a good place to grab a beer, but I'd stay away from the food which is both pricey and has small portions.

rEQihWr8611TN1_9io9rNQ.review_text: I was really excited to try this place, because I love Rogue and it's adorable mustachioed fella.  But when I told friends I was going, I was told numerous times that the bartenders weren't too friendly.  And they weren't.  Not terribly mean or anything, but pretty unresponsive.   Didn't answer questions or make recommendations.  Didn't clear the glasses in front of me.  Didn't make the usual bar chit chat I expect when ordering.  I'm adding an extra star for the nice man who opened the ladies bathroom with the butter knife when it got locked.  Because guess what, shocker, bartender didn't give a damn.

jGmbXO7x5CrMSb___Gn90g.review_text: Overall, a disappointing experience.   The decor of the pub is cool.  Alot of Rogue merchandise (flags, posters, etc.) on the walls and the venue itself has an old school pub feel to it.    A large beer selection with many many beers on tap.  Menu looks great.  However, many items are crossed off with a sharpie. I tried to order the beer and cheddar soup but they were 'out of it'.  We did get the Kobe beef burger (which was good) and the mexican dip which was terrrible.    Service very average.    An ok place to grab a pint but definitely avoid the food.  There are much better places.

8hh50iYCCPaMYZcRREG46A.review_text: Hazelnut brown is yummy. Service very friendly. Good beer, good cheer. What more do you want?

VEBbEios0TfDxGqSMmnxyw.review_text: Excellent beer selection, one of the best I have found during my travels in SF.  I've walked by this place several times but never stopped; glad that I finally did.  Atmosphere was dive-ish, good people watching.  I didn't eat here, but the food that I saw looked decent.  Bartender knew her beers and had some excellent suggestions.  She also chatted it up with a few of the regulars, adding to the great atmosphere.

ghS4jTPQ_5UzcGKqb_NNRQ.review_text: We got there when it opened They had not recieved their entire beer shipment as of yet We tried a few rogue beers. not bad They didnt have the voodoo donut one since at the time that was not really making the super rounds yet, just the industry and beer snob rounds They have a ton of rogue bottles to buy in their litle store section. I guess they have food

8uCNXzOuQuWjCkABKzl3nw.review_text: Why was this place empty on a Sunday? Pretty bizarre, it was just me and two friends and about 4 other people, what gives? Rogue actually makes some good beers (and some not so good ones)... though we are spoiled with some places that are better in this part of the country. A+ for the huge amount of varietals though, if you are a stout fan they have many options, if you are an IPA they have lot of those too, if you stick to lagers they have a bunch, etc. All in all, it's a good place to take your friends who are here visiting fisherman's wharf.

mruYqq_DhcD0FCE1I4tvPg.review_text: Yummy beers.  Cool scene.  I remember seeing people eating, I did not.  Forget what kind of beer I got, but it was an IPA and it was damn good.  Great music playing.  Sweet beer garden out back.  I liked the bartender.  I'd love to go back.  I want one of their pint glasses.

WZlhHviAl_LtLdV0RBmGJA.review_text: The beer here is good and prolific, both in what they brew and beers from other breweries, the bartenders are knowledgeable and friendly, and the atmosphere is decent.  The beer is the first thing to mention. Rogue has a number of their own ales poured here but for those looking for beers off-list, they also carry a wide selection of rotating taps from other breweries. HIghlights in recent months have been from Stone Brewing Company, Sierra Nevada, Anchor Steam, Anderson Valley, etc. That selection sheer combined with the fact that Rogue has a talent for picking quality brews that aren't always that well known, puts this on my "Top 10 US Pubs" list.  The only reason Rogue doesn't get 5 stars is because the food ranges from  just "ok" to "occasionally good" and the waitstaff beyond the bar are usually good, but can range in attentiveness. Also, the interior isn't bad, but it could use some touching up.  Overall, though, I highly recommend for anyone who loves a great, niche beer at a decent pub.

4Av92ZR_z7bXekMz_tagsQ.review_text: The food was underwhelming.  Took, no kidding, 55 minutes to get bar food delivered.  They delivered my meal (bowl of chilli) after 45 minutes, then the last person got their food 20 minutes later.    So literally 1hour and a half to get things in order.  15 minutes to get our side order of sauce.  Delivered a burger to the table calling it the chicken sandwich, so a friend started eating it, which meant they had to recook another burger, which took 20 minutes on top of all this.   I can't say enough, get more staff.  Staff are nice, but overworked.

a8N9dAsIZHQNKZZZehRACg.review_text: If you want a bar where you can grab a table on the street, and watch SFC pass you by, while enjoying a view of Coit Tower and Washington Square, this is your place. Gets some of the last sun of the day. People that work here are friendly. Beer is good. Fernet is available. Thursday trivia packs the house. Takes credit cards, which is a rarity for a place with a full liquor license in this city.

Q-rcjUuCurPsFxe5OcHVmw.review_text: If Oregon's Rogue brewery didn't have such damn fine beers, if their brewpubs didn't carry such a huge selection of those damn fine beers, I'd avoid this place like the plague.  Although the bartenders are usually friendly and attentive (if you're at the bar), I can't say the same for the general wait staff I've encountered which have ranged from "do I even have a server?" to "do I even have a server?".  The food is par for the course pub food, nothing to make a special trip for.   It's too bad this installment is such a dud.  I've been to one in Oregon and Washington and it's night and day insofar as service is concerned.

CXhcRjo0_0VAcJQCSAW7pA.review_text: The burgers are the best I've ever had! The Kobe beef is a class above the rest. 5 stars for the food & beer.  That said, service was ABSOLUTELY terrible!  I got my beer 20 minutes after ordering it. And my food arrived some 45 minutes later. Also, they do not serve beer in pitchers. Minus 2 stars for crappy service.

98EwiJyMYtmcpzHRS3OgkA.review_text: We were visiting SF and stumbled upon Rogue as we were walking back from the Fisherman's Wharf.  We stopped in for a beer at the bar and had a great experience with the bartender.  Can't remark on the food, but this Rogue is way better than the Rogue we went to in Portland. The worst part was the bathroom.  Seriously folks, get a grip on whats going on in there.

e-Bh0XDCOgYMaC-BmdxkAQ.review_text: Not big on the North Beach scene, but this place is super caszh and not a bad place to meet some friends. Origins from Oregon and they wheel in alot (and I mean ALOT) of their own brews, like 20 or so. Now from all my beer guzzlin' experience, that means that it is a crap shoot on what will be good, cuz not all of them can manage that. So please taste a sample before committing to a pint. I've had my share of the good, the bad and the fugly here.   Recently tried the Irish nachos and they are an obscene calorie-laden, drunk person's salvation. Waffle-cut fries laid out on a plate and topped with chopped Corned Beef, a shit-load of melted cheese, green onions and sour cream. Sober...Bad, Drunk...Good.   And their back patio is secluded enough to do the bier-garden thing, enjoy, sip, chat, enjoy the fresh air and intermittent whiffs of norcal afghan cush from the neighbor's window. 3 stars Rogue, you ai-ight in my book.

VEgMc0Jat_HMTrnQ3ZWnEw.review_text: My review is based solely on the service and non beer drinks.  I was excited to see Moscow Mule on their board of drink specials.  When it arrived and I took a sip I gagged.  It was terrible.  For those who don't know Moscow Mules contain ginger beer (distinct taste), vodka and a tad of lime juice.  I asked the waitress how they make theirs and she chose to tell me after I had already ordered they were out of ginger beer so they use ginger ale (big difference) and lots of lime juice.  She was nice enough to exchange it for a martini.  When the martini arrived it was in a margarita glass and also terrible.  It may be my fault for not ordering beer.  Overall the service was slow and the non beer alcoholic drinks icky.

vA3_zZTBUyGdiRMzJLp6bg.review_text: This place has GREAT beers! The only drawback is that it was a "seat yourself" type restaurant and there were many squatters taking up the few tables they had. We finally were able to snag and table so we could order food and the menu had a lot of choices. The food was just ok in my opinion. I ordered the Roast Beef dip and after they brought out 2 wrong orders they finally got mine right. It tasted a little bland but I was so hungry and the 2 beers I drank were starting to kick in. It's a good place to stop for a pint of Rogue on tap but I wouldn't take a family here.  Word of warning: the bathroom is atrocious. Just be prepared to be grossed out and you should be fine.

QcPN-Dee_dU2IWno-f2oYA.review_text: Didn't eat the food, but tried the beer.  Really enjoyed sitting outside and getting the 4 glass sampler while enjoying the sunny day.  Ladies - this is a great place to bring a guy friend visiting from out of town - you can bring them to North Beach, you can enjoy the atmosphere of the neighborhood, and they can get there beer.  Also, it seems like they facilitate a community atmosphere, with longitudinal drinking games for regular customers. -- went there twice yesterday.  their beer is a cool microbrew, but  i'm not fanatical about any of the flavors.  Their American Amber is a standard Amber Ale.

2--3--v8yHU3a3FljCcBRg.review_text: Probably the best beer selection and probably the hardest trivia questions of any pub/brewery in the city.    Food is typical pub food, don't expect to have your mind blown.   The Rogue Imperial IPA is incredible.    Pint glasses are 3 bucks if you buy a beer.    Seriously though if you go to their trivia night and win singlehandedly then sign up for Jeopardy quick.

KX61VMj5Sw9MYp7t4fJO-g.review_text: I've been back on the hot and sweaty east coast for almost two weeks and I have often found myself daydreaming of the mild and cool outdoor tables at Rogue Ales Public House in North Beach.  Situated directly across the street from Washington Square and the beautiful cathedral that abuts it, Rogue Ales is one of the best places to sit, drink, talk, and people-watch that I've ever head the pleasure to visit. Facing the park full of people and pets with Coit tower hovering to the right, this is just a plain-old fantastic place for an afternoon beer. I visited twice (both on Mondays) right around 5 p.m. Both times I sat and talked the day away while watching the human parade down Union St in the late afternoon sun. The beers featured are obviously from Rogue, but they have plenty of alternatives as well as a full bar. The bartender both times I went seemed friendly. When the warm afternoon sun gives way to the cool San Francisco evening, tastefully hidden heat lamps illuminate to warm things up. If I lived in San Francisco, I am sure that I would find myself parked outside at Rogue Ales almost daily.

DKYogTVxh8QQXA73LpRpRw.review_text: Food: Worst burger ever? Possibly. I ordered the Kobe beef burger w/ white cheddar and it was the most tasteless waste of 13$ in my life. Not to mention they ran out of onion rolls so I got mines on a regular kaiser roll... Yay. I begrudgingly ate about 4 bites, finished off the fries, then complained for half an hour about what a pitiful excuse for a burger it was.  Beer: I don't drink it but my boyfriend was very satisfied with the few he drank. Thus the 3 stars instead of 1.

IxKjgqLAG6teY_pqGnh9ZQ.review_text: Sunday night is not usually a drinking night, but if you live with me and my roomies, every night can be a drinking night.  We're not drunks, we just like to have some fun now and then.  I hopped out of bed at 8:30p, got out of my pjs, put on some jeans/sweatshirt and we all walked down to Rogue for a beer.    Original plan was just one beer, but it was hard to resist to just drink one.  I started with a pint of Brutal Bitter (hoppy with some citrus taste), then, Yellow Snow Ale (light, easy to drink) and Dead Guy Ale (very malty).  Ended the night with a nice cold Irish car bomb!  The beers at Rogue are good, but only if you find the right one for you -- it takes some getting use to.  It took me three pints of different beers before I figured out that Dead Guy Ale is my favorite.    The layout works.  Bar right when you enter, tables on the left, more tables up ahead on an elevated platform, bathrooms at the end of the bar and a retail store in the back.  The bartender was so nice, gave me recommendation on which beers he thought I would like.  He's also easy to talk to and loves to talk about drunk men behaving badly; some starting a fight with fellow drinkers.  Crazy, crazy stories.    Pub Quiz every Thursday night; and Hoppy Hour, micro brew tastings, and free tasters every day.   I will be back... sooner than I think, so 3-STARS for now :-)!

aqWXHhcR_CdmKmxggFOlEA.review_text: **I've only been here for drinks**  For North Beach, this is a surprisingly laid back place for beers and other drinks (pleasantly surprised to find a full bar also as I thought it would just be beer). The bar is relatively big and in the evenings, plenty of room to sit and sprawl out (would imagine those tables are used for dining earlier in the evening). It was relatively empty when I was there on a Saturday night....   There weren't many bartenders working - one actually. I just happened upon the bar when the bartender was on break or something, so it took a little while to get a drink. Once the normal bartender was back, all was good and the drinks came quickly.  P.S. The bar is a little bright, though I guess if you're looking for dimmer lighting, the lights were dimmer in the back of the bar...

Gq5D1V5jwrYPpOxfwM5lag.review_text: I love this Oregon brewery but $6 for a beer in the middle of the day is a lot. Come on guys, where is your happy hour? But grab your beer and head through the restaurant to the beer garden. On a lovely afternoon or major pub crawl there's no where else you'll crave to be. Never had the food here so I can't speak to that. I'm a sucker for outside gardens, just wishing for cheaper prices.

WM80WSMD380ZaHFincK87g.review_text: Great Beer.  Great Location.  Great Service.  We did not eat any food so I can't speak of that.   Billy was awesome!  Super attentive and helpful getting me just what I wanted.  Restrooms were miserable!

EPanKtpGAoIw3zNA2mgK6w.review_text: Rogue is one of the best microbreweries on the West Coast.  I am very lucky to have one of their brew pubs in my city.  Even though the beer isn't brewed at the facility, they offer my favorite hop beverages fresh on tap.  I tend to order the Brutal Bitter or Imperial IPA because of their exceptional hop flavor and aroma.  These beers are of course exceptionally intense for lager lovers.  As a nod to all tastes, they have an extensive array of guest taps.  Beer Garden area is available for large groups.  For those wanting to feel the bustle and buzz of Washington Park and enjoy views of Coit Tower, outdoor street-seating is offered in the evenings.

JwkLRs3-kDZFtNAuY0vJ5Q.review_text: The word "sessionable" when applied to beer means something akin to a drink you could comfortably stick with for a night's carousing.  That's somewhat how I'd describe Rogue. It's not gonna change your life, but if you've got a rowdy bunch who'd like to go to a somewhat straightforward place to get some pints and a cup of beer-and-cheese soup -- Rogue could conceivably work out for you.  The atmosphere is fine; jukebox and singin' Giants' fans.  Don't expect anything from the floor service -- they've got no time for you even if you track them down in the kitchen.  Recommended? = Well, sure. Not the best, not the worst, yet somehow slightly adorably "sessionable." Have the soup.
