CNhhP_OSJp_-OhZerMWYlg.review_text: I hate to give a bad review but this place is not all that..The beer is OK. If your a person who likes IPA's this place is not for you.  As for the food it was horrible. I ordered a bacon cheese burger. Thank god for the bacon and cheese because the meat had 0 flavor. So bland. Our server was nice and that was the only positive.

XD7g8XBBWEqk-m9eaUog2Q.review_text: I love Rogue beers and I love this place. It totally reminds of a place I'd find in Portland (it is an Oregonian beer, afterall), just bigger. They, obviously, have a huge beer selection, but they also have a full bar. The bartenders can be kind of brash sometimes, but ultimately, it doesn't matter because it's not as though they're making something special. This is always a stop in my North Beach outings.

uDBnapEGywTQ0ovaCu7Orw.review_text: One visit to Rogue:  -1 sampler of 4 beers (soba, sig's red, dad's, mogul) -1 glass of the mead (19 original colonies) -1 beer float with vanilla ice cream (chocolate stout) -irish nachos -kobe bleu ball sandwich -no medium sized shirts for sale that night, boo  Yea I think I made the most of my time here. Cheers.

vU-YIJ6ZKMCeygtAnXXXcQ.review_text: Was roaming around Northbeach on Saturday night with a friend and i ran into this little gem. It's a seat yourself place , I was lucky and found a great spot in front of one of the TV"s.  I got the Mocha Porter and loved it.  For food I ordered a american kobe burger with blue cheese. I asked for medium rare but it came medium at best.  It was still tasty. My friend ordered the fish and chips  and she enjoyed them.  I will be back I did enjoy the ambience of the place a lot and I hope to try more of their beers.

wxCFYitE2XkXfhHdCDiCIQ.review_text: On my first day in San Francisco I cable-car'd it down to Fisherman's Warf and on my hike back I was feeling like San Francisco was going to give me tourist overload. Then I spotted it.  Shining like the Christmas Star, the green Rogue sign in the window was calling out to me, promising delicious Oregon Brewed Drafts. The crowd inside was very cool, there were a plethora of beers (both Rogue and non) on draft.  It was a Sunday, late afternoon, and there were still quite a few people enjoying themselves. If it were in my hood, I'd be a regular.

ecjnj3UEUacvNxJXOmc0zQ.review_text: Wish the service as good as the beer!  First thing bartender says to me right as I walk in the door, "If you want anything you'll have to come up to the bar, Im the only one here and it might get busy."  Dude, it was a Monday at 12:30pm you're not busy, we're the only ones here you pretentious rude prick, oh and hello to you too!  Strike 1!  So I walk up the the bar to order a few IPA's.  Bartender: "we're out of IPA, we're actually out of half out our beers"  Strike 2!  Your the "Official Rouge Brewery Embassy" and you're out of half your beers?  WTF?  If I wanted to try your guest beers then I would have bought one at 7-11.  After a few beers and watching the bartender mill around the room looking very bored and checking out various pictures on the wall we decide to leave and pay the bill.  Now the bartender is nowhere to be seen!  Five minutes later bartender emerges but apparently doesn't see me standing alone at the bar (we're still the only ones there).  Strike 3!  I've worked customer service and restaurants and this place was appalling!  You can get a beer anywhere, its the atmosphere and service the make a place worth going to.  We finally GTO, would defiantly not go back or recommend.  21st Amendment Brewery is a few miles away, they've got my business for life!

v9GJDjFkS0IvCw83k-D1xQ.review_text: Rogue Public House is a pretty laid back place. The kinda place I wouldn't mind spending an evening  or an early afternoon in. Which is exactly what I did this week.   With 40 beers on Tap you'll be sure to find something to drink. Not only does this place have the Rogue family of beers but it also has guest beers. Aside from beers on Tap there is a selection of 22 oz bottles and growlers.  All so you can take beer home with you which is a nice touch.   Sadly, the beers are all written on a chalk board at the front above the bar. This is great if you are sitting within view of the board but sitting in the back room means you'll have to get up and look at the board if you want to try new beers or write down what you want, or taking a picture of the board.  I have yet to try the regular menu food or go out on the patio so I am holding back on giving the extra stars.  The  service was kind of slow during the evening when more people were there but in the early afternoon it was good service.

UXHqrudE70S8aALAwNuRow.review_text: Great location right across from Washington Square Park, nice space with a chill vibe and a patio outside.  My partner and I were visiting from out of town and love a good brewery, and were really happy with the knowledgable staff on both visits.  We took the bartender's suggestions and loved everything we tried: 1.  Beard: Just super tasty, not too sweet for a  Belgian 2.  Fresh Roast: Light bodied with a definite coffee and malt taste and aroma 3.  I2PA: Best IPA I've tried from Rogue 4.  Oregasmic Pale Ale:  My personal favorite - hoppy and crisp with a really nice fresh finish 5.  Miscellaneous samples of various tasty beers including stuff from their Farmhouse Series and some guest tap stuff  Got some great recommendations of other places to check out while we're in town from the friendly staff that we wouldn't have found otherwise.   If you're a local or in from out of town, I really recommend checking out the Rogue Ales Public House!

2OW04CGDqyKTpX5R6FtPBg.review_text: Beer flights. Enough said.   As an incredibly indecisive person, the large selection of beers on tap would have ordinarily been overwhelming, but the beer flights made it all okay.  I love that the flights aren't pre-selected combinations like at most places - instead, you get to choose ANY four beers they have on tap and try what you actually want to try.  Genius.  Every establishment should start offering these build-your-own flights, ASAP. I'm thinking like, coffee flights, or cheese flights....or burrito flights.  My favorite beers from what I tried: -Chipotle Ale: the chipotle/smoky flavor is noticeable, but not overwhelming -Beard: tasty, hoppy, wheat-y -Dead Guy: delicious, dark, and flavorful -Double Dead Guy: double the delicious, dark and flavorful-ness  They also have a big outdoor patio which is perfect for day drinking, and all the bartenders are friendly, knowledgeable, and patient when faced with someone as annoyingly indecisive as I am. Will definitely be back!

_W4y7ku6Q0uGoiI3ePtkgQ.review_text: P.S. Ask for a Rogue Ales club card (free) and get 75 cents off every pint forever and a free pint and t-shirt on your birthday. Cheers some chipoltle beer to that!

6bcScVQIVishxonzoBN6sA.review_text: My second time here and enjoyed it same as the first. Great craft beer selection. Decent food and service. This was a must stop on my non guided walking tour of San Francisco.

nj3syiLs3lABLtPVyL0ivA.review_text: This place looks like a true dive bar - only with craft beer. It's got the old time feel along with the latest in Rogue Ales beer lined up. So you will find all your demands for what Rogue is brewing here.   I have to mark them down cause they don't update the specials boards at all. Walked in and read they had beer cheese soup. Having had this in Portland brewery, I was so let down when they came back stating that they didn't have any after all.   BOOOO!   I do love a lot of their beers but I have to say that the service here was a bit slow on the upkeep. It took at least 5 minutes from sitting down to have the bartender stop yapping with a guy down the bar top to come and take my beer order. Then the lack of cheese soup, or even knowing that they had none for a couple of minutes just indicate that they don't have a tight shipping running a float.   Not gonna say it's a bad place. It has the beer that will get you where you need to be in terms of buzzed levels. I know I walked out of there after chugging down my Morimoto sobe ale with a little happy feeling going.   Over all, the place does get crowded. It has a sort of strange lay out, but at least has the outside beer garden area for your enjoyment. So you really can't go wrong. Though considering that you're going to be within a stones throw of plenty more pubs, it's tough competition for this joint and thus it just gets a three stars from me.  It's A-okay. and that's all you really need to enjoy it. Go in, grab your beer and chug it down and get out.

zeSm0mBtJT_A3T4jtW9mKg.review_text: Ok so this is one of the first brew houses that I have been in for a while so I was easily impressed. The food was good but I really went for the beer. I loved the Mocha Porter although it tasted alot like my favorite which is the Shakespear Stout.(delish) It was a little hard to find at first since I am not familar to the area much, but was well worth the time since we were in the city already. We went on a weekend day and it seemed to be a comfortable busy. Service was good and friendly. I would definetly go again sometime.

9N2cVpu1L3sGDDS0R77dkg.review_text: Great place to pop in and have a cold one. Great selection of brews and easy to eat snacks, food. Beer is outstanding, atmosphere spot on, food is ok. Great location

-RWKA7Wf17T4DcVjwZ81Vw.review_text: Didn't try their food, but the beer was delicious. Went with four friends and got 4 flights (small samples). My favorite was Rogue's Chipotle Ale.

uEyA6WaMQmcaF_1LYTi-Zw.review_text: Ask for Tim. He is here for you and doing a great job. This place is a great spot for beers and burgers. They have a great selection of both and its a nice low key spot to go and enjoy a few drinks.

gjZp61JZaqcLrKjEDVSPIQ.review_text: The atmosphere could be improved upon, but the beer is tasty.  They have a beer garden for sunny days.  Service is consistently terrible.

ryQzhVKN-LwrtQ92DEdvRw.review_text: Talk to Jay. This guy is like your friend for years. He's very welcoming and helpful. He knows all the tastes of the beers so definitely hit him up for recommendations. Here's what I had to taste between our party of four.  Mocha Ale - Tastes like coffee! It's super dark and maybe all you need for the night, but it's like a nice bitter hit at the end  Chocolate Stout - Super interesting. Think of chocolate milk, but without the creaminess. It hits off clear and crisp at the end with a chocolate taste. The taste is just so complex it's hard to describe.  Brutal Bitter - Sounds really bitter, but not really! The bitter is a good type of bitter - it gives lots of flavor to the beer. It's an amber ale so it goes down easily with hints of bitter here and there.  Morimoto Imperial Pilsner - This was definitely my favorite. It has an exotic Asian twist to it so it goes down really smooth, and hits you with a slight amount of bitter at the end. It actually tastes like a tea at the end, as suggested by my friend. Best "general" description would be alcoholic green tea.  The place is down and homey. Not pretentious at all or not filled with pretentious people. I think I'll become a regular here. Very nice people and very nice microbrews. They're awesome about putting stuff on the TVs for you too so you can enjoy your drink.  Oh, did I mention $5 microbrew pints? This stuff is quality at an affordable price. I'll be back Rogue Ale House!  P.S. They had a "garage sale" for Labor Day Weekend. We got $3 pint bottles to go.

1eFJXbzad-ye0heUyI-1Qw.review_text: I live in the neighborhood and been there a couple of times.  Food is okay for pub food.  But the bar area the worst service ever!!! One of the regular bartenders is a complete a-hole.  We walked in on weekday afternoon.  Only 2 other people at the bar who appeared to be friends of the bartender.  He looked right at us picked his a** for 10 minutes before asking us what he wanted.  This place doesn't deserve the business.    P.S. Clean up the cigarette butts on the sidewalk or at least give the customers a place to dump them.

s1Hsu9cFf5qJym5-ujO2MQ.review_text: Our favorite bar that we found in San Francisco.  We liked it so much that we came back two nights in a row.  Quite frankly, it's a lot like a Boston bar, so that's probably why, but Rogue beer is freaking delicious and that's most of what they serve.  They had about 15 Rogue beers on tap and a few non Rogue beers.    Atmosphere is nice - a large bar when you walk in and tons of seating.  This is the one bar in San Fran that was insanely busy both nights that we went in.  I would definitely come back whenever I'm near the area to try the food (and drink more Rogue beer, of course).

vAkpKtEvDxxavhva_vAIxw.review_text: The Oatmeal Stout was awesome. The atmosphere was ideal. Server was polite and attentive.   Eat before you go. We had the sampler platter and were sorely disappointed with what we got for $18. The Blue Balls, which were just meatballs with Bleu Cheese, were tough, not tender. The flavor was OK. The rest was OK, too. That's just the beginning.... So long story short, the drinks and peeps are great, the food not so much.

B4cJvWuf59j7XlTdexnVZw.review_text: Went here once and didn't care for it.  Seems a little too forced like a fake british pub.  Not that I've ever gone to a real British pub, but I just felt like I was in a chain that was trying too hard to achieve a certain feel, and failing.  The food and beer was ok, I just didn't like the atmosphere.

355W7iKObLwu3greKAJcqQ.review_text: So despite having lived down the street from Rogue for 5 months before I moved to NY, I only just now when visiting/packing up my apt tried Rogue...first we stopped by last night, as we got a late start out, and were catching up with another couple so wanted somewhere quiet and lowkey, and while i didnt intend to spend the full night here (quite a bit overdressed for SF in general, and definitely more so for a divey beer place), we ended up sitting at an inside table and staying until closing time. The vodka iced teas were good (albeit weak, and no better than anywhere else ive had them), but the overall bill was cheap (especially now that i'm used to NYC drink prices), and the waitress was sweet. Returned today for a bloody outside, and had read on the sign that they specialize in bacon bloodies...being that i DESPISE bacon i wasn't going to try that, and the regular bloody was mediocre, however, the service was INCREDIBLY slow...they did bring our dogs water ASAP, but my bloody took around 20 minutes to come out (and the regular, non bacon one at that)... still keeping a solid 3 stars as last nights experience was much better service, but probably wouldnt return during the daytime...nor necessarily night, unless i were looking for a divey place--also i despise beer so cant speak to its quality, but they do brew their own here! they also have a cute patio out back, that i'd probably try if i were to return

SWDoQRZII76ewKPLhgtzpg.review_text: I have been a part of a 10 week trivia league which has required me to be at Rogue every Thursday. So I will write a 2 part review:  1) Rogue - foods okay. Beer is good - like the home grown feel. Strongly suggest the half-e-vison. Very good - Stay clear of the Smokey one - tastes like you are drinking bacon. Gross  2) DJ Appropriate Trivia - even though I suck at trivia  -  I have had fun. Pop in for a night or join the league - fun either way. My main complaint is that it is a mellow crowd and it goes late which is a hard combo. Be sure to like your company or the night can drag.

MUIoOSt5n9F6hcnQ4aUYRQ.review_text: We love this place! First time going here. Got a appetizer, the Kobe Blue Balls are excellent! Ground Kobe beef seasoned and mixed with bleu cheese, blue cheese crumbles on the side.. Yum!  The brews are really good. My husband is a Pale Ale guy and I had the lighter brew. Quite delicious.. The service was great as well.. We will be back soon!!

QTLL0xbcy7AyLUPJogk5kg.review_text: This place was such a big dissapointment.  I live nearby and the boyfriend and I had been excited to check it out. pub quiz night! beer! food! and dogs on the back patio?! la trappe is closed on mondays so today we finally  went in to check it out. We parked ourselves and our pooch at one of their outdoor tables and I went in to order.  The bartender wasnt the most friendly/kind of ignored but i shrugged it off and ordered our beers, was then informed that if we took a menu outside a waitress would be out to take our orders soon. cool.  we head outside, 30 minutes later after deciding our mocha porters tasted crappy and watered down a waitress finally appears. we order our appetizer.irish nachos.  theyre out of the waffle fries so we say regular fries are fine.  the boyfriend gets an amber after finding out they were out of the beer he wanted. also not great. 15 minutes later the waitress comes back to tell us that they are out of the corned beef which is an integral part of our dish. so basically they could have told me 15 minutes ago they were out of the fucking dish and saved us both a LOT of time. we decided to check out the menu again. i have no idea why.  15...20...almost 30 minutes later. still no waitress. but a friend happens to walk by and confirms that yes, everytime shes been here it hasnt been a great experience either. at this point we were so over the shitty service and decide to go elsewhere to spend our cash, so i go inside to begrudgingly pay for our crappy beers. the bartender ignores me for a good 5 minutes while he shoots the shit and takes a shot with some regulars. thanks dude. while i wait i look around for our waitress-or any waitress for that matter and dont see a single one. wtf? bartender finally gets around to me and sounds a little miffed that we didnt go through our non-existent waitress to pay. whatever. $20 later we are out of there, pretty irritated by the god awful service, and having paid that much for grody beer.   i tried to give them 2 stars, i wanted to give them 5 but in the end i definitly left saying "Eek! Methinks not." indeed.

F9bqY7U85I4jxERi9ILcaw.review_text: An unexpected isle of Issaquah in North Beach! With tired feet in need of beer, we stumbled into, and out of, this fine establishment after walking all the f over town just for fun.   Hazlenut, I love you.  "Philly" not so much.  Oh - and wtf with the totally ambiguous bathroom labels - hops and barley? I've made my own beer and I still don't get that. Unlike my gf, I guessed correctly (ok, so she guessed INcorrectly and I had intel) but still - that's got to be a bit of sport watching people figure that one out.

38zhUVIh6t_-mpcmbWYmiw.review_text: Great beer and pretty good atmosphere.

7Xpb51viDdOaV_89olxp5w.review_text: Cool vibe, nice walk from Union Square shopping: 1.1 mi according to Google = 24 hilly minutes walking up Powell.   Service was casual but slow; seat yourself; a bit hard to find an open table due to large crowds of twenty-something used-to-be-hipsters (jeans and t-shirt guys, and girls with uggs).   Food was not very good; the Idaho fries stuck together, the beer cheese soup was just OK (with a very small portion of buttered Hazelnut ale bread, couldn't taste the beer). The Kobe beef chili dog was hearty. We were told the chips were literally Ruffles brand. Nice.   Best part of this place is the beer flight: 4 beers, hefty 2 oz pours, for $6. The IPAs were not bad, as was the Dead guy. But they didn't have the Yellow Snow, which we had tasted at a bar in Vegas, and was the express reason why we came. We were able to buy a 22oz to-go, however, so all was not lost.

6Meybo4c6oo-K2fB2agCZw.review_text: The beer's a bit up and down (the Hazelnut Brown, though, is world class) but the vibe's good and the food was surprising tasty and cheap. I'll be back.

fF2ySjtkHaCNztL-eu6GWg.review_text: I'm torn, this place has great beer but I've been there twice and I'm just not feeling it.  There is something missing, but it's not the beer.  There is an outdoor space in the back which is cool. Ah I'm sure I will go back when I'm in the area, but it's not a destination for me.

Rw5jCOK3wV7USLBrzx_NJA.review_text: Service was so bad it made the beer taste bad, and it was a good beer!  Enh go someplace else.

kDPbqHf6iVj6klNLooRQBQ.review_text: As a lover of the Rogue Ales Brewery, I have been looking forward to venturing up to the city to check out their public house. I finally made the trip last night, and man was it great. I was absolutely overwhelmed by the variety of beer they had on tap. My girlfriend and I each got a sampler and tried 8 of ther 40+ varieties. All the beers were unique and delicious in their own way.   We found the pairing of the Imperial IPA with the fish and chips was exceptional. The reuben was the best I have ever had. Next time I will be trying their famous Kobe beef burgers. I highly recommend this place to all. The pub-like atmosphere was cozy and welcoming. Wait staff was prompt and friendly. The perfect way to wind down a long week.

6bfcLLL35DpsxAxxk5ZNAQ.review_text: Great beers and I didn't know this before but they also make their own liquor. I sat next to a nice young man from Texas killing time while his girlfriend attended a conference. Samantha and I tried 2 samplers so we could taste a wide range of their beers on tap. We ended with a gin and tonic. Who knew they made gin? I didn't. We promptly had to find a bottle to buy after that. They don't sell their liquor so they directed us to the corner liquor store: Coit.  Wonderful end to a rare Saturday out in North Beach!

S7p4PdCAEtdHqnlSIHDKZg.review_text: An excellent beer bar. Great selection of craft beers on tap, very casual atmosphere conducive to sipping on beers and chatting with friends. I'm a big fan of Rogue.

ct-V9YPrLgWuxk8L20tDig.review_text: I had an excellent experience at the Rogue Pub/Distillery in Portland, and while I acknowledge this is more of an "outpost pub" for Rogue, I still expected something with a similarly cool vibe to the Portland pub/distillery.   Sadly, I was very underwhelmed.   All this place is is a bar to go to if you want to have a larger than normal variety of Rogue beer choices and watch sports.    The bar staff was not very interested in talking about their beer or making suggestions as we contemplated our beer orders, they just sort of blankly looked at us.  Which in a pub that is supposed to celebrate their special micro-crafted beers, you want bar staff who at least eager to point you in a direction.  While the staff was very nice, the service was exceptionally flakey/spacey.   And while I think getting too fancy with food in a brew pub spells disaster and annoyance, they go the complete opposite direction here and opt for super bland and poorly prepared.

a2pSOhEiQDIdiqE494dGXQ.review_text: Really cool vibe. I went here my first night out in San Francisco, late on a friday night. Everybody was having a good time and the music was excellent. Amazing beer selection (and the correct type of glass for each one!)

1cI6RYkKUnzIZpVILf9edQ.review_text: Came all the way here just because I love this beer so much.  Listed on the wall were the beers in chalk.  The first 3 beers I asked for from the board he said they were out of.  (how bout erase it from the chalk board?)  The bar tender was rude bout the fact that I was asking for beers they didnt have, like it was my fault they were out or that I some how should have known (DUH, my bad).  I would give one star if it wasn't for the fact that this is some of the best beer in the world.  Well when its actually there.  All the other beers I tried were great.  Again the bar tender thought his job made him a rock star.    Unwarranted Rock Star Attitude Jobs = Bar Tender, Tattoo Artist, UFC (wana be's)

rM9ZJz4eoJgmuMeJZqhx2A.review_text: Just good beer!!!   We stopped in for a couple beers before heading off back to the hotel.  The place was quite packed but we found ourselves a table by the window.  The server was quick.  We got our beers super fast! I got the hazelnut brown!!! I love that it has a chocolate taste to it.  YUM! The Dead Guy Ale is one of their most popular.    I know they have Rogue beer in most speciality stores but there is nothing like hitting up one of the two breweries in the country!   I've never gotten food.  Beer is good enough for me. =)

R3745ij-KXIREK7sKuCTWg.review_text: Didn't eat here so just rating the beer.  I went with a sampler while my friend had a chocolate porter.  I chose better!  I told the waitress what I liked/didn't like.  Her response, "Would you like me to choose for you?"  Sure.  Other than #3, Hazelnut Brown, she did well.  My fav was the red IPA followed by the Shakespear Oatmeal stout.  My buddy's chocolate porter smelled chocolaty, but didn't taste like much.  It was a disappointment.  Despite that, I rate this 4 stars due to incredible selection of local microbrews.  Oh yeah, I'd go back.

YzAdXapcYBiA-Xv24lxiYg.review_text: If you've been to Rogue in Portland, don't go here. It will only disappoint you. This place basically serves Rogue beer but appears not to be affiliated in any other way. The food is mediocre. The service is horrible. I should clarify that our waitress was not so bad, but it wasn't really clear who was waiting on us for a good while. They didn't seem to a system so we were overlooked.  In summary,  I'm not going back.

WoQeDoz4agzNHM4PkK7rpw.review_text: Wonderful beer selection here.  I thought they were a bit pricey at $7 for my beer.  The atmosphere is great, and the bar tender was very beer knowledgeable. They also have a nice outdoor seating area in the back, but no smoking (anything) allowed.

CJKrqZ3yTmmVpa_6xZeMHw.review_text: Meh.  Nice patio space outside, but otherwise pretty bland.  My (overpriced) beer smelled like ass.

iuD0M_M_CUnqP2R5eYgRgw.review_text: 5 stars for the selection of beer on tap + solid pub food. Great place to stock up on a seasonal or hard to find 22. Always fun to meet people traveling into city here, great neighborhood once you get parking - always chill atmosphere inside - busy weekend nights but that's to b expected

JWJw79GaVfZVm5SMthDVFQ.review_text: Great kobe bacon blue cheese burger.  Awesome fries!  No table service during day - order at bar.

gNzjrsvgtwcEKK0Zq2eL3Q.review_text: Well, as a disclaimer I was already six beers into the afternoon when my out of town buddy and I bellied up to the bar.  But It was awesome. We were the only people there. It being, well, just barely the afternoon. The fellow behind the bar knew his stuff and it was a nice couple of rounds. Love it when people visit.

zBwFQ8ziSU8rXaXMojwvog.review_text: Where to begin...  After an 8 hour drive up to San Francisco, I needed a stiff drink.   We got in the city around 9pm and our dinner choices were somewhat limited. We dropped our stuff of at our hotel on Columbus and decided to walk it and find a place to have a nice drink and bite to eat. We came upon the Rogue's. My husband is somewhat of a beer connoisseur..and wanted to try this place in order to support the local brewery's (which I have NO problem with, even though I am not a beer fan at ALL) We walk in and the bartender says "seat yourselves"..so we do, at a table by the window. The same bartender comes over to take our order, and seeing as it's a brewery or ale house.. and I didn't want to feel like a jackass ordering something they wouldn't have,  or be able to make sooo..... scenario as follows:  Me: Do you have a full bar? Bartender: Yes Me: Can I have a Washington Apple Martini? (My signature and favorite) Bartender: Well we actually don't have any apple pucker. Me: *Blank Stare*.......Uhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh I'll just have a captain and coke then.  WHAT?! How in the hell are you going to tell someone you have a full bar, when actually you don't?!?! I digress.  I ordered the fish tacos made with halibut and my husband gets the chicken caesar salad, and we share a cup of the beer cheddar soup.  The soup was more like a chowder, but pretty tasty. The tacos were good, the fish was seasoned really well, they were served with sour cream, salsa, cheese, shredded lettuce, and soft corn tortillas, in a make your own kind of style which I liked... but no side dish which I thought was odd but I was still full after eating the tacos. My hubby said the salad was decent but didn't get the bread that was supposed to be served with it. So even though the food was good, (Nothing to write home about) I only give it 2 stars because of the lack of service ( The bartender looked like the only one there and it got pretty busy) and I don't like being told there is a full bar, when clearly there is not and then I'M the one who feels like an idiot. Thanks, but  I'll pass.

hgaNzb9cnFxWK8K6ANfM8A.review_text: So many beer to choose from!  If you know nothing about beer just ask the bartender for recommendations.  I'm especially fond of the Hazelnut Brown.  Unfortunatley, the food sucks.  I hear the Kobe burger is good if you're into eating overstimulated perpetually drunk mammal...  They get an extra star for having a banner from my hometown: Issaquah!  What what!

UvmKLvE5_OCRrzFcuCFJYg.review_text: So the food here is really pretty bad, but the beer is really pretty good. Two stars for the food -- but other than that, I like the place so I keep coming back.

19iChaCnwNcx7iYXVUGTFw.review_text: I unfortunately had a similar experience to "A K." below.  I arrived at 6:50 for an 8:00 trivia event.  I was extremely disappointed to not find any open tables.  I used to live in North Beach and come to this trivia night frequently, and knew it fills up quickly, so I knew to come about an hour early.  To take the effort to come so early and see tables taped off for other parties was disheartening.  I asked a waitress about it and whether I could call ahead next week, and she (visibly uncomfortable) replied that they don't take reservations but one of the other waitresses was holding those tables for some of her friends.  And they were 3 of the biggest tables in the bar, and there were definitely others who were looking for seats to no avail.  A real bummer and kind of wrong.  Either take reservations or don't.  I don't see how I could ever take the effort to trek over there again knowing that I might not get served since I'm not buddy-buddy with the waitress.  Stay away.

QRHS2i4DWS6R0fpkCalvaQ.review_text: The beer is good, but this place feels well just sort of...sticky.

9op2n5skR1iki7M1ntdhcw.review_text: My friend wrote me and told me he was at this place so it reminded me how much I love this area of San Fran.  Beer: Hella beer choices and the prices are good enough to get drunk, have a good time and not have  regretful hole in your wallet.  Food: Dunno?  Venue: We went during some festival/street fair and it was PACKED. However, service was still pretty swift...

RXcC7gdCgzJfiaw030eJAA.review_text: I believe this is still the southern-most outpost of the corporate owned Rogue pubs.  Great selection of both their own brews and other craft beers.  Trivia games on some nights.  Makes for a nice after dinner drink spot following a big Italian meal in North Beach.  They could use another bar, and more standing area... we were there on a Thur night, and it was getting a little crowded.

BjxKfcLGCGFynsUmzuxL6g.review_text: Yes, the beer is good.  But, there's enough variety in your average supermarket to avoid a trip to the Rogue Brewery.    As other people have mentioned, they don't print out their beer menu.  This is idiotic because pretty much everyone is there for the beer (I counted 1 table eating there besides us on a Saturday evening).  They do, however, print out their food menu, which is no great favor because the food isn't very good.  I'm pretty sure the butter used to soak our bruschetta was off.  The black bean dip was accompanied by wet tortilla chips.  In essence, two thumbs down.

_PKZQRbzUqp9XciUVcKESw.review_text: Totally love it here! Don't forget they have a lovely outside area too, perfect for sunny days! Rogue is in a kickass location right in northbeach, and it's really mellow and good times, good crowd. Great beer selection, and I also enjoy their food. Really fun to hang out and kick back here.

Lb37hatAjI3fgHEh2lMNEw.review_text: You'll never be bored or disappointed with the beer here. Just look at their endless list of taps on the blackboard and pick one. Food seems hit and miss, but why aren't you eating at any of the great places in North Beach instead?  I like the Younger's Bitter and the dry hopped Rogue Red Ale. They have a couple guest taps, and if they still have Lagunitas Little Sumpin' Ale, that is almost better than some of the normal Rogue beers. :)

6L-VcXwxYtXjmyKKRTNLkA.review_text: "Go for beer not service" I like rogue beers. The barkeep needs an attitude a adjustment. The beer was all I wanted and you could easily replace the bar man with s self service option. Go for the beer which is all anyone really wants. Final point toilets are grim but again I sm here gitu beer.

dwH2lQuw3iUADFUGXtNszw.review_text: Fantastic display of Rogues awesome beer selection. The staff us laid back so take that into consideration if you're in a hurry. I come to just relax and enjoy a pint or five.

Hc275IgCLoHQCaiL6AFzug.review_text: Tried about 4 different beers. Brews are EXCELLENT. Personally loved the Magisterium IPA and the double choc stout. Service was OK for a busy Friday night. Parking was difficult but normal for SF. Price was average, I drank 6 beers and left the bar paying 60 bucks. Def. Above average Bar. Kudos to ROGUE!

2ojO4ZImtGy71cMqoKgOQw.review_text: If it weren't for the kick ass patio, this rating would be a 2 or 3.  Service: bad Beer selection: Good Atmosphere: corporate pub Prices: Fair

FkiDKAYGGNIPQVdMe4JEXQ.review_text: Disclaimer to head you off: I did not eat here. I don't plan on eating here. I tend to do that. As you have just learned, I like a place based on the fact that I like a name of a brew they produce. Go from there.  Ok, I will be the first to admit that the atomshpere in here is not the friendliest.....it doesn't feel like Cheers. Call me crazy but I like a bar to feel like on old shoe around my drunken soul. I like to feel comfortable all around. Yeah I'm happy they have a patio but it's just not enough......if there are neighbors drinking together and rolling one then I'll give this place the last star.Community folks, that's what it's all about! But if you are "kind of" a "beer snob" this is a place for you. First off they have tons of interesting stuff on tap. They have a whole lot of stuff that the Rogue company makes on hand and only sells through their ale houses or breweries. But they also have a whole lot of guest stars to choose from. Example:they have my new favorite Sierra Nevada brew on tap--Crystal Beer. Think filtered wheat beer--all the flavors without all the chunkS! (seriously though, I can't get past this; it's like those pearl drinks, I can't get past swallowing something goopy and weird feeling down my throat---and that's the end of my commentary for tonight on swallowing). Right there,that place is worth my patronage!! They carry some of the Speakeasy line---both Prohibition and Big Daddy---smiles all around! They carry a full bar so if your friend is jonesing for a martini, you can go here sans guilt.  But back to their "homegrown".....My friend (who's promised all of us a round of new livers for everyone once he wins the lotto) and I spent a lofty afternoon drinking and we tried several of the home teams selections. The hazlenut stout, Shakespeary stout, Dead Guy and Chocolate Stouts are quite tasty and stand well on their own--hell, I'll go far as to say that Chocolate stout rivals in taste and thickness to my favorite beverage of all, The Sheaf Stout. It has that perfect balance and the finish follows up with the promise of chocolate (think: really good, expensive chocolate--like maybe one of those one's that have at least 62-70% cacao in them--yeah one of those suckers that set you back a few bucks but they're OH-SO-GOOD--none of that 3 for a dollar crap!!). But then, oh then, our bartender Brian decided to do some mix master magic!!!! He mixed the hazelnut and chocolate stouts (75% of one, 25% of the other in that order). Holy mother of.....damn son! That's what I'm talking about which leads me to my next topic.....  Brian, you rocked it!!!! Not only did you give us shot glasses of different brews to try at our whim, but you mixed me my beer magic (that formentioned hazelnut/chocolate stout comobo) AND you freely despensed your brew wisdom AND you went and found us some chocolate stout to take home (we paid for it too so no hopes on walking home with a "to go" cup). Right there, you are beautiful. But fellow Yelpers--BEWARE OF WHAT YOU TYPE!!!!!! My friend happened to mention my Yelping activities to our bartender and he mentioned that Rogue usually doesn't do well regarding yelping (a-hem!) I felt so bad!! I, unintentially, may have hurt some feelings!! Seriously, do you want to be known as the mean bitch/ jackass? I want to use my SuperYelpPowers for good not evil (ok maybe a little evil) Not right, folks, not right..............damn good brew though.

HBLBvHfpPnM5I41Mi5KFcg.review_text: Some of you need to be culled. Seriously. "I went to a pub, and discovered that the beer is awesome, but the patio needed some flowers!??!" AAAAAAAAAAARGH!!! Are you KIDDING me?!?!  It's a pub. The beers are awesome. Ridiculously awesome, in fact. And there you are. Go to the pub, drink phenominal beer. Want a cheeky chardonnay and sit on non-holey stools while admiring the flowery patio and discussing Satre? Then maybe something that's described as a PUBLIC ALES HOUSE may not be for you.  They have 30-ish beers on tap. 20 or so are Rogue's own brews, and the rest are "guest" beers. Dan, the manager, is a true beerphile, and a huge supporter of the craft brewing industry, so you'll find tons of local brews like Anderson Valley, Lagunitas, and Russian River, in addition to Coors "We pity you" Lite. But their own beers really do shine - there's something for everyone here. Want something mind blowing? Ask for a black and tan, made with their hazelnut ale and their chocolate stout. It's like drinking a nutella milkshake.  Food's not bad, but again, it's a pub. You go to the pub for beer, not for haute cuisine. So I'll knock off a star for that - NOT for the lack of patio flowers. Grab dinner at one of the bazillion other restaurants in North Beach, then waddle over to Rogue for some awesome brews. Tell 'em the bald Irishman sent ya. (They won't know what you're talking about, I just want to build my rep, ya know?!)

BWyd0o7LdQTnv68yHyhy5w.review_text: This was one of the best parts to my recent trip to San Francisco. The food was great and so was the beer. The bartender Tim was very knowledgeable about the brews on tap and beer in general. Got to try their kobe beef corndog and the "Big A** Tea Porter" along with the Brutal IPA. The Octoberfest event was cool, along with their nice growlers.  Can't wait to try more things on tap here.

iuM58omo8jIrLvO31w-L-g.review_text: The service was very poor the first time I ate there and the now the last.  I asked for my hamburger to be medium rare--the waitress didn't bother telling me the "meat" was one of those school lunch-patties that should be cooked all the way--and it was tasteless.  You can buy better fries at grocery store.    This is a poor showing for a Northwest chain. I'd rather spend my money and time at a McMenamins.

T6TjDj9BQuS46xDB8eeHFQ.review_text: It was 10:30 at night and we were wandering around North Beach looking for food. I really wanted fish n chips but O'Reilly's kitchen was closed. So we wandered some more looking for an open Italian place and we encountered a lot of open doors with neon OPEN signs in the windows but once we went inside all we saw were employees chowing down. It was like a big tease from the universe. You can get in and watch us eat but we won't serve you.   How ironic that North beach closes down so friggin early. Ever been to Italy? Real Italians don't close down early. Wimpy Americans! And for equality sakes I'll say have you ever been to Ireland? You can get food til the pub closes there. No closed kitchens while the pub is still hopping. Wimpy Americans!  We thought it was a bust. OK I thought it was a bust, my partner was more optimistic and started calling me names like pessimist polly and telling me that I give up to easily. Which I might point out was not very smart of him because I was hungry. I had low blood sugar and for all he knew I might have pulled a Bruce Banner and turned into Hyo-Glycemic Hannah and eaten him for my next meal. He is Italian so he probably tastes good. We'll just call him lucky to have made it through unscathed.  At this point we were contemplating our options. We could get back in our car and drive to Tommy's Joint or some other diner in the City that we know would be open. Or we could walk up to Broadway and pray that we would find an open Noodle house.   I wasn't having that last option because I could just imagine my mood if I walked all the way up to Broadway and then couldn't find anything open.  So I opted to go to the car. On our way back to the car, like a beacon in the night we spied the Rogue Ale House. There she was. All shiny and open with big glass windows through which we saw people eating. Actual food by non-employees was being eaten! It wasn't just a tease anymore. And the food looked good. Yummmmm  So in we went. Now I like Rogue brews so that part was great. I was hungry and the menu was extensive so it made a difficult time for me to decide what to eat. But I eventually went with fish tacos. My partner went with fish n chips. They both tasted great. Of the two the fish n chips was the better deal. There was barely any fish on my plate and it cost 3 dollars more than the fish n chips plate.   The beer is awesome! I love rogue beer and the bar tender was nice too even we ordered Arrogant Bastard by mistake. He politely told us that that wasn't one of their beers and then suggested a Rogue beer that is closest to AB. To be honest I confused the Dead Guy Ale with the AB so my bad.  Minus one star because the place is really, really bright and I prefer my pubs darkish. I also thought the paraphernalia pushing was a little off putting. By that I mean they have their bottled beers, t-shirts and gift sets out on the bar floor for public perusal and purchase. Maybe that's why it's so light . To make sure people see the Rogue stuff to buy.  I would eat and drink here again most definitely. The food is a little pricier than the norm for pub fare but it tasted great and the beers are really tasty.

uSCYNal_CJDPGBYUAenyoA.review_text: It isn't often or with much enthusiasm that I go out in North Beach, but Rogue was working over time one night to prove that this neighborhood could also show someone a good time.    Really appreciated the staff here.  I hope the managers know what quality people they have behind the bar and reward them accordingly.    Rogue has a big, unpretentious selection of beer, most of which are made by their own company off site.  I liked their house brand IPA and a Dead Man casked in whiskey barrels.  Good tasty stuff.    And since the beer is served by human beings who seem to have been raised by actual parents in some kind of moral system rather than by burn-out jackals...Rogue beats the hell out of Toronado.

ycEOM_IULl5T9Brd__brHQ.review_text: The place was kind of dirty and rundown.  Then beer was ok.  I had the kobe beef tacos and they were way to over seasoned.  My husband at the kobe beef bacon cheeseburger and thought it was ok.

xrCUksBwLKBYT0KPqXjFJw.review_text: The beer is good. Nice variety and complexity. The North Beach crowd may judgmentally stare at you as you enjoy a cold beer at a table in their sidewalk seating area with a baby in toe. But who cares, baby is having fun people watching and parents are relaxing with a cold amber ale. Can't beat it on a sunny day.

YUXZsOz_Pl__mwlLs4B1xg.review_text: I found this place by chance on a Saturday afternoon and it was not crowded, the patio was awesome.  The beers were solid, stick to the taps.  When I think of pub patios where I would like to drink, only Rogue and Zeitgeist come to mind.

R9FsuO_Np2nChWAdyNEaEA.review_text: Thought this was going to be the perfect place to grab a drink after Jazz Fest this weekend, but the attitude of the bartender (i think it was the owner actually) really blew it for me.  He was surly and rude and couldn't make a mojito to save his life.  It was obvious that they'd been slammed all weekend and it was impossible to get any attention from the waitresses, but wouldn't you think they'd know to have extra staff on a big weekend?  If it weren't for a smile and a great mojito by Rory I would have given it 1 star.  Would only go back if I happened to be in North Beach and wanted a Dead Guy - certainly not on a busy day.

sk3OWuPhUApDz8oSg_8iLQ.review_text: Amazing beer with great variety. I enjoyed the chamomellow (chamomile) beer this evening. At $6 a beer, for the quality it is hard to beat. I had the food twice before and it is good, but definitely bar food level.

ZSretWXlve11q9hP6SrScQ.review_text: DON'T get this place confused with Rouge, the douchey dance club. A few of us did and got stuck in cougarsville. Clearly we missed out on a good night because I'd rather be with a burger than a broad any day. So don't make my mistake and check out Rogue, 'cause the burgers and beer are bombdiggityicious.

kVlUVcLJDtbEkTPXfEjbHg.review_text: The beer selection here is amazing!  Trivia Thursdays is fun and different. My overall experience is great and I'll definitely comeback.

DjdSPv_IuDVO17j5lKTDLA.review_text: Three more visits and they've won me over.  Stick with the Kobe beef burger and/or focus solely on the beer and you'll be good to go.

mkQ-J4uMULsJvc9V8gMENw.review_text: Arguably some of the best beer in San Fancisco is found here. Rouge is from Oregon, and this is their first (and only, i think) brewpub in california.  And its great.  The Chocolate Stout here could be my favorite beer ever (better than the one in the bottle).  The beer list does change, and i've found the staff friendly about hooking you up with info or recommendations.  The beer sampler is great way to start. Now, if you don't LOVE beer, don't come here for great service or bargain prices and be dissappointed and write a bad review.  You missed the point.  I personally think the hamburgers are awesome, but i only recomend this spot to those who can really appreciate beer. I also like the service and decor, but if it weren't for the beer, i'd give it 3 or 4 stars. More info on Rogue - rogue.com/brews.html

gqNUHbCevmUaeK0tldMLoA.review_text: Food is your standard bar type food.  Average at best but really you're coming here for the beer.    Location is good and the environment is very relaxing.  A good place to have a beer at night. If you're a fan of Rogue definite place to stop by.    If you're visiting or even if you live here make note of where you park beforehand.

guFTy6RMgEivkIEnjm5pMg.review_text: Great rogue beer selection but the beer is NOT cold and $8 a pint is a joke.....  The unisex bathroom is a disgusting pig sty that smells of stale urine

ivG4VgMLNGf_wF1CIA1-Ww.review_text: I like this place. Came here on a Sunday and it wasn't crowded.    They have a big beer selection and do flights.   The food isn't bad either.  Some of the clientele is shady. In particular some girl who said her name was Rabia. I think she meant Rob YA!   So if you meet a girl there who claims to be a divorced pakistani of about 32 named Rabia, tell the managers and have her ass booted.  I'd come back and if I see Rabia I'm gonna whoop dat ass. or call the cops which ever comes first. Probably both.

HJBDaJuqP_QHZeTDQI4lUA.review_text: The atmosphere is nothing spectacular, but it's spacious and good for the groups. The food is reasonably priced and they have a nice sized menu. They have soo many good drafts, and pretty good service. I'll be back again.

vTbQZNz8FH4jcrni7Vkl1Q.review_text: I continue to be impressed by Rogue, last week i was here for lunch during the Saturday rush, our check took sometime getting back to our table, unprompted the server apologized and comped the last beer on our order - thusly earning herself a bigger tip and an additional star for the establishment!

7LtaYnxq1f8in3k49KHe1Q.review_text: Came here for the burger as a friend appreciated the Kobe beef burger. Mind you, the rating is not indicative of our lovely (and quite pretty waitress) but of the burger itself.  Overall: 6.5/10. Expensive.  Burger: The burger was Kobe beef, or some manifestation of a stateside cow bred from the Kobe line. I asked for it cooked "really medium rare" and it came out medium. Bun: White bun. A bit flimsy for my taste. It didn't disintegrate while eating the burger, but it came close. Toppings: Aged cheddar was good. Mysteriously, the grilled onions didn't come on top of the cooked burger, but on the side, under the top half of the bun. Seemed strange to me and I don't know why... Sides: Fries came out crispy. They were fine. Other Notables: Good dill pickle. Pale ale was decent, but nothing compared to Magnolia.  Bottom line: If you come for the beer, you can get an entry level gourmet burger for a very gourmet price. If you come for the burger, than there are better burgers to be had.

OGTLTtalwZACHQzzJbGL7w.review_text: Good beer selection if priced IMO a little on the high side ($6). Decent pub grub. Limited space & restroom facilities so it can be quite hard to move around and get loud when crowded or during quiz night.

351y-k5TzoexvJPtdLQ4yQ.review_text: I've been here a couple times when I was in the neighborhood in San Francisco. They have a nice selection of beers and cider. Overall, a nice place to stop in when you're wandering about town.  Minus stars for the tiny crowded bathroom and the super slow service.

65uUyG9yuF0rdMh0z7ajaA.review_text: Great beer selection, including most everything Rogue makes as well as a number of other local and foreign beers. Good pub food - on the upper end for pub food prices, but generally good. Great burgers, including hormone-free American 'Kobe' beef for a little extra. Open til midnight, and they serve food late.

0AZHFsD_dJrA6pgVX-HTyg.review_text: Cool place with cool vibes and cheap $3 bottled Rogue beer.

LEho8AFSA-H6M9SekKxb_A.review_text: I like this place.  It's a great, no fuss bar if you just want to walk in with your jeans and tshirt for a beer or two.    Lots of tables for groups.  They even have board games for you to play with!  I've tried the food once, for lunch.  Didn't really make an impression on me, so I'm assuming it's wasn't THAT good.  Cool place to start off the night too!

0Chi_CzoTmkw1NvZg0sksg.review_text: Not a lot of bars make a good Sunday afternoon writing spot.  Well, let's be honest - for a lightweight like me, NO bars make for a good writing spot, Sunday afternoon or otherwise.  The beers here are strong and incredibly delicious (chipotle ale was one of the tastiest beers I've ever had), so within a few hours I was all but useless as a thinker and a typer (good enough as a talker and a snowflake cutter-outer though).  The staff were warm and friendly, and clientele, including a fellow screenwriter, kept things interesting. The bar's a bit nondescript, but the neighborhood feel and variety of excellent handcrafted beers more than makes up for it.  They've got a clever location off the main strip in North Beach, though good luck getting a parking spot.  Rogue is one of my favorites out of the bottle - glad to know that the spot to get it on tap is up to snuff.  Can't wait to go back!

pRkJKmKifUi0Ub8cJdXEhg.review_text: Excellent service. Great beers on tap. The staff was knowledgeable and very friendly. They really take care of you. They are a very caring staff. I will definitely come back.

djxnI8Ux8ZYQJhiOQkrRhA.review_text: Meh, I'm not too impressed. And that's saying a lot 'cause I love beer, North Beach and divey spots.   Stopped in at Rogue before a show at Bimbo's - my pals and I were hungry for bar food. It was around 7:30 pm and they were relatively crowded. There were no open tables, but room at the bar for the four of us to sit and eat. Unfortunately, the bartender was not that excited to see us and threw menus in our general direction. He did warm up a little while he took our order, but the overall consensus was that he hated life.  The beer? Delicious. So many great choices on tap, although they were out of several of our first choices. I had a orange wheat that was just right for a Tuesday night - not too heavy, with a hint of flavor. The food? Meh. Not great, not terrible. Nothing memorable.  My overall impression was that this would be a great spot to hit up *after* a show, just for a quick drink. Not for the dining experience or the warm hospitality. Hang out, have a brew and enjoy the company because the ambiance isn't really going to do it for you.

gZ7mbHLlQsLd6S_i5U69tQ.review_text: We went here based on reading reviews that it was very dog friendly, as we had our small dog with us. We sat outside and were comfortable with the heating lamps even though it was a little chilly. We waited outside for a while before someone came outside to wait on us. He didn't mention anything about the pet menu we read about, though we didn't ask. There weren't any water bowls or anything for dogs either, so to me it didn't really seem pet friendly other than that they were allowed outside. Although the service was slow, it seemed to be so because they were short-staffed, and our waiter was apologetic. We ordered burgers, which were very good and were reasonably priced. To me it seemed like a pretty regular bar.

mYHXFms1TY4vZCcoVTGVqg.review_text: When this place opened five or so years ago I thought it would fold in a north beach minute.  Finally monday night, owing to my lack of cable i gave it a shot... Worst brew-pub food ever...soggy fries, a tablespoon of coleslaw and a doughy roll to support the "signature" dry and flavorless pulled pork.  Beer and a shit sandwich = $20. I don't think I'd risk a $15 burger.  The beer tasted like beer and the "beer fans" who sat way to close to me at the bar were "beer fans"

UKsBKla6IjgOeKe_UC5Dbg.review_text: We were on a Beer Crawl: Brainwash, Bloodhound, City Beer, Rogue, La Trappe. This was stop four on the list. I was doing Porters and Ambers, so they were all very strong beers.   I asked for the Imperial Porter and it was excellent. dark and rich, deep flavor. My group ordered sliders. I wanted a burger rare and the server said No as they come frozen so we cant do that. I thanked him for that information. It was appreciated.   Service was with a smile. Crowd was attractive and fun. Bill for 5 persons: 5 beers, 2 shots, and 4 slider platters: $100+20 tip.

E5Fbnoe5f5a74A5auXjiBg.review_text: Beer? Yay!...food? Wah-wah.  We stopped in for some pub-grub and brews on our way back to the place we were staying.  The beers were right on par with what you might expect from Rogue.  A great selection, and they even serve beers that aren't their own.  The food, however was nothing to right home about.  In fact, it was nothing to Yelp about.  Come for the beers, not the food.  I mean you're already in North Beach for cryin' out loud.

c4eh4aq5Bw9zVMt4xLG2ew.review_text: Rogue is one of my go-to breweries when I buy beer at the store, without the help of knowledgeable barkeep to guide me, because I generally find their product to be above average.  So, in need of a place to post up for drinks before dinner, my friends and I headed to Rogue's.  They offer 40+ beers on tap, which is awesome, but I'll second (or Nth, really) the other reviewers in that posting the beer list in other spots besides just behind the front bar would be very helpful.  The beer list is only really only visible if you are directly in front of that bar,  not even if you're sitting at a table in the same room, let alone in the other room, or out back on the open patio (where the attempt at a beer list is incomplete and mostly erased by the elements).  And, not to impugn the service, but when I ask what beers are available, "All the beers Rouge brews" is not very responsive to my question; a printed beer list would be better.  That aside, drinking Morimoto Pilsner and Soba Nut Ale (or whichever beer one might choose) straight from the tap in the appropriate glass is nice & the prices are reasonable.  (N.B. Glasses are available for sale, prices vary.)  I did not get the opportunity to sample the food (I was headed to Gary Danko's next so you'll surely excuse this oversight), I did glance at the menu, and it looked very promising.    Overall, definitely a place where I would gladly stop by to grab a beer or beers.  And if they could work on a more efficient way of identifying the available choices, they'd definitely be onto something.

7ew-MKKOGqsauzqjgwLfxQ.review_text: As a bar, RAPH is awesome. They have a great selection of Rogue brews, plus other great microbrews from the West Coast. The waiter was knowledgeable and able to steer us into the right direction. I was particularly stoked on the Juniper Pale Ale, which is really fragrant and tasty. The decor could use some work though. It felt like a bennigans.  As a restaurant, RAPH is pretty sub-par, maybe even woeful considering the prices. I ordered a 'Kobe' bacon cheeseburger medium-rare and had to send it back twice because it was medium-well. In the end I just had the waiter take it off the bill. By the time the second one was sent back I pretty much culled my hunger with beer... oh sweet savior beer. The waiter was pretty cool about it and apologetic. The three other people in my party thought the food was really lacking.  Anyway, bar gets 4 stars, restaurant gets 1. Someone needs to salvage this place. It's a great location and I love me some Rogue brews.

cYkHbLF0JwNzMguqKz4zQQ.review_text: Incredible beer,  I mean really, _really_ good beer. I have to somewhat shake my head at the people here complaining about the beer. Rogue is generally considered in beer snob circles as one of the top American craft breweries. The San Francisco alehouse is one of the only locations they have outside of Oregon. They have a huge number of their brews on draft to select from including several of the XS series. They also typically have one to two "on cask". The bartenders are more then happy to make recommendations or give you a small sample if you have trouble making up your mind. For more serious sampling they sell a reasonably priced flight, with your choice of beers in small taste sized portions.  For extra brownie points they carry a full draft selection of "guest beers" from other craft and major breweries. Many brewpubs/alehouses only stock their own beers, and its a testament to their confidence in their product as well as a desire to meet their customers needs that they carry so many of their competitor's offerings. A few beer recommendations for those interested are at the bottom of the review.  The food is pretty good as well. Some of the offerings are average (chicken wings come to mind), but others are top notch (burgers cooked to order with artisan cheeses and gourmet bacon). They also have a little patio with outdoor seating that is nice, if you're able to grab a table.  Only reason this place gets 4/5 instead of 5/5 are:  1. Some of the wait-staff are not very good. I don't know if they're lazy, incompetent, or just asked to handle too many tables at once, but the service can be spotty. That being said, many times I'll sit up at the bar, and the bartenders have always been outstanding. I think a lot of the time the managers are working the bar, so that may have something to do with it.  2. MUSIC! It's too loud inside sometimes, as in you have to shout at the person next to you loud. Kinda ruins one of the best parts about going to the pub, the lively discussion with friends over beer.  3. No growlers in stock. I wanted to take a growler of the Chocolate Stout home, and they told me they did not have any, but they would fill one if I brought it in. I've since purchased a growler during a visit to Pyramid that I intend to take in for a filling soon.  They have too many beers to review, but when I'm looking for something dark and sweet the Chocolate Stout and Hazelnut Brown are excellent (much better on draft then from the bottle), while the hophead in me can't get enough of the Brutal Bitter or the XS IPA. The Old Crustacean Barleywine is decent, but I've had better. Unless you can't stand the style they're currently serving, cask ale is always a treat. Finally, they always carry a few styles you can't get in the bottle, so you should ask the bartender which brews are "draft only" to see what new Rogue Ales you might be able to try.

0DxWqqWtYi5XaV12fLqMug.review_text: Checked this spot out on a Sat night.  Only had to wait a beer to get a table for 8.  I had the American Amber...good stuff.  A hoppy amber.  Cannot wait to try the rest of their selection...going to take awhile bc the selection is huge.  The menu is great for a pub.  Bar food is something this Midwesterner misses living in SF.  I mean seriously, what's a guy got to do to get decent bar food?  With that being said, the wings were decent and the kobe burger was good.  Will def go back.

hj7U5xIeohSoryeV2yVvRA.review_text: Yum!  Get a black and tan made with the chocolate stout and hazelnut...SO GOOD!!  Very friendly servers, very good beers and a chill vibe.  I would suggest grabbing a bite before you go there. The food is okay, but overpriced for the quality.  Definitely worth it for the beer though. Go here to drink outstanding beer!!!

vvxkZ00ScjQFSK_nHAgnDQ.review_text: Rogue makes a wide variety of outstanding beers and spirits, and you can sample them here. The beer garden makes for a lovely stop after walking through North Beach. The menu looked fun but we stopped mid afternoon so no comments there, other than our daughter loved the Root Beer Float.

XvbU631-FQ4GTS2zMa-YvQ.review_text: My husband and I stopped in for lunch and a beer while on our honeymoon in SF in early September.  I sometimes feel bad writing a review based on one visit, but our experience was consistent with many of the existing reviews, so I'm going to go ahead and do it.  We rolled in around 1:30 on a sunny Thursday afternoon to find a nearly empty bar.  Great, right?  Or maybe a testament to the quality of food and service.  Our beers took a while to arrive, and when they did, they were almost flat.  I enjoyed my salad - especially the hazelnut ale bread - but my husband's sliders arrived barely cooked, and it took a while to get the attention of the server/bartender to deal with it.  The server did comp our drinks, but by that point we were irritated, hungry, and not inclined to tip generously.  Aside from the food, I'd give Rogue a solid 3 stars, primarily for the "hoppy meal" offered between 12-2.  For $1, add a glass of beer to your lunch, or "super size" to a pint for $2.  If we lived nearby, we'd likely give them another try.

ybk_vGgqfsSDBRteWVCrfQ.review_text: A solid effort for a bloody mary. The crowd is really laid back here. The bloody mary had a lot of pepper and spices in it. Arguably....too much. The waitstaff was really nice and when we asked for some celery for our bloody mary's she returned with a full plate of them. The celery was crisp, which is more than I can say for Jillians.   The tomato in the bloody mary I can happily say wasn't like they took a V8 and poured it in. It was a good try, but not the best I've ever had.   I didn't try the beer here, but I bet it's good.

Eypq5gLLjCapBVVnMw_MyA.review_text: Rogue is one of my favorite breweries so I was pretty excited to see they had a taphouse in the city. Too bad their bar food doesn't match the quality of their beer but I guess you can't win them all.

AMiCGIpX4C8SQz7Tjh_0dg.review_text: Great when not overcrowded...  I love Rogue and its extensive beer list.  It's a must-hit destination for anyone who enjoys local/craft brews.  Dead Guy would be up there with my favorite beers (at least the very drinkable non-exotic ones).  Service is generally friendly and attentive.  Prices are a little steep (most beers in the $7 range) but worth it.  I recommend getting the sampler--4 beers of your choice, and the glasses are just the right size.  The food is typical bar grub, but is relatively good.  I have enjoyed the wings and the meatballs when the urge has struck.  My biggest complaint--I do not often come here on weekends or other busy times because it gets too chaotic.  It gets very crowded and service drops off quite a bit.  The bar is great, but the tables leave a bit to be desired, and the bar is often double-stacked on weekends.

KtR2zXLfKTRN3grDxfkvqA.review_text:
Like it or not, Rogue has some good beers that you can't get anywhere else.  Sure, they'll set you back a little more than your average pint and some of them aren't worth bothering with, but here's the thing:  trust their bartenders.  If you're uncertain about a beer, ask;  They're friendly, they know their product, they've always steered me right, and on more than a few occasions they've offered me samples.  They also have some nice sampler options, but sadly no prize for catching them all.
  And if for some reason you don't like Rogue's beers, they have plenty of guest brews *and* a full bar.
  A sample of the Chipotle Ale seems almost compulsory, so don't hesitate to ask for a sample of that when you're ordering your second round (assuming you tip well, but I've never not gotten a sample when I've asked).
  I've never had the food, but I don't feel like I'm missing out on some big secret on that one.

EXkO-gR8EjkFWRbebHtxSA.review_text: Come one come all, Rogue is the only bar I've found on the west coast to serve Magic Hat. LOVE. They usually list them under 'seasonal' but I heard they're stocked pretty regularly.  They also have a big patio in the back, which would be awesome for one of our few sunny days of the year!   PS. Go for trivia night on Thursdays! I for one was not the most helpful the time I went, but I did score big on the pop music questions yay.

ErJcnrBcG9-HXiB_gTp_zA.review_text: I really enjoyed all the beers I tried here. Standouts were Dirtoir Black Lager and Hazelnut Brown Nectar for sure. Servers are very knowledgable and can give you great recommendations based upon what you like. You can even ask to sample a beer before you commit to a 16 oz glass.  Recommended for a visit if you're in North Beach! Very fun, chill place to catch up with friends while enjoying some delicious libations. $7.00 for 16 oz!

9OFY0oW-W-nApq5ww8ftSA.review_text: best place for beer in north beach. awesome selections, helpful bar tenders and good food. Sometimes put fun games out on saturdays.

HifZ1C6VJAUreJ-ZoF02qg.review_text: Great bar with unique beers. I like the sampler because you can choose 4 tastings for $8. The food doesn't look very impressive, but I do like that they incorporate beers into their food (e.g. soaking the chicken in Irish lager for the chicken pita). The atmosphere is hipster, but still friendly and the bar tenders don't mind explaining their beers. That's have both rogue and other brands of beer on tap.

N7wNXF_Bvv1H7eAgK7MXuA.review_text: My friends and I went for trivia hour last night...wanted a little change of pace from the usual evening out.  The trivia was tough but so much fun...at least two hours and a mix of questions, and quite a crowd!  That might have been a bit of a downside--so many tables and so little bar for such a big place.  And having carpet in a bar?  Might have added to the unusual scent... BUT, the beer selection is GREAT, lots of microbrews and so many taps--I love my beer straight from the keg.  I probably would have enjoyed the beer more, though, if the bartender didn't act like he was annoyed to pour us all drinks!  It took ages to get his attention and then he'd sigh and say, "Another? (sigh)."  I'm sorry!  The taps are an inch away from you!  And we're sitting at the bar!  Too much?? And...they're 5 bucks, no matter what you buy...which is kind of a lot for a pint.  Well, especially if you're having more than one. But, yes, I will go back...the trivia was great, and maybe we'll just get there a little earlier...all the bar food looked GREAT!  Worth another try.

bXD3HfsnFeoY2Kw9QR4Zbw.review_text: Absolutely  love their hazelnut beer and stouts here.   Can't go wrong with it, so delicious, and it goes down smoothly.    Also- I was really lucky and met their mascot "Dirt McGirt", a cute little corgi sitting outside the bar.   What I love the most is getting a pint or two at Rogue, and then heading over to the park to just relax and people watch, lay in the grass, and watch the clouds breeze over the city. Best feeling ever on a sunny day in SF.  Try it sometime!

fXgfpYRLJD4hnKyQZ8VHBQ.review_text: They have a beer patio perfect for sunday beers and no one is ever out there it seems which is nice if you just want to hang out with some friends.  And they give you free tasters of beer.

BYdyiyKK-qnvq5jImxYXmA.review_text: I'm not gonna lie I wasn't feeln this place for one reason & one reason only. The bartenders are RUDE. :\  These dudes were so lame! Hate ta hate ya, but it is what it is.  The set up is pretty cool otherwise. Location is excellent & the seating plentiful. And if you want a wide selection this is your spot.

LJC1DsXRBbvxOA6BtYG9-g.review_text: Most Rogue establishments are similar. This one had a great bartender. Was in on a weekday so he let me try a few things and had plenty of time to explain the beers. Lots of cool brews to try! There was an awesome barrel aged one that they charge more for in the sampler. I added it to my sampler. I had a corn dog. It tasted like a corn dog should.

vjWMqGJ9bJpUQ_1t44IuTQ.review_text: Large selection of beers both from Rogue and other breweries. I was a fan of both the smoke ale and the hazelnut brown.  Food is hit-and-miss. Deep-fried things (fries, chicken strips) were done really well, and the burgers sounded all right, but the meatball sandwich was kinda funky. The meatballs and sauce were good, but the bread was.. off. It was ostensibly a hoagie roll but it was the densest, chewiest roll I've ever had. Seemed more suited for a french dip sandwich instead.  Plenty of room when we went on a Monday with a large group.

_0zaFHWLWFL_p9_akXfT1Q.review_text: You really need to have their IPA. The atmosphere was very upbeat and the workers all knew their stuff when it comes to beer  Really cool spot to just go and hang out with some buddies. I had their buffalo chips (waffles fries) which were really bomb.   The only discrepancy I had was that the waiter would take a while to come check back in for another round.

9vH4X_xEyau3eZpfEd58qQ.review_text: A great selection of beers goes without saying. Cool laid-back atmosphere.  Service was friendly - could have been a little more attentive - but overall good service. Kobe blue cheese meatballs were tasty - just need them to pony up a little more blue cheese! Kobe chili hot dog was awesome. Washed it down with a beer flight. And we kept it rolling with a plate of tater tots, some mead, and an old crusty.  I wish I had one of these near where I live. Id be there every week!

9FaUFOhwm9DIvyzfdelzbg.review_text: Did not expect to love this place, but I did.  The place is spacious, the food tasty, the beer delicious, and the service was speedy.  Awesome way to spend the afternoon.

ojur8znWZhIDlfQmdPTj8g.review_text: Blue cheese hot dog is so good!

7EzKV5tGQFOuuJCx4rbDHw.review_text: I must admit that almost every time I am in San Fran I stop by the rouge ale house for a pint of dead guy.  It is also nice that you can try a lot of varieties on tap.  Back east we can only get them in bottles.  Almost every time I have been here the service is good, the food is fine and the beer is amazing.  My last visit wasn't that great because they lost power and were out of a bunch of beer, but I will chalk that up to bad luck.  If you are in the neighborhood, it is a great place to stop in and have a beer.

gEUrtbRV0VLgwS3Da-CndQ.review_text: Typically my last stop on a night through North Beach [or first (: ]  Obviously, they carry most/all of Rogue's excellent ale selection and have a bartender ready to explain every last detail about each of them to you. While the prices are a little steep, you certainly pay for what you get.   Not only do they carry a majority of Rogue brews plus a few special ones, they typically have a few local/obscure options to add to their arsenal.   Recommended: Mocha Porter, Nitro Oatmeal Stout, Double Chocolate Stout

u7e2HMYEeAHaBhDIIK2HSg.review_text: Great beer!!!!! That is all that is really necessary for me to continue to love this place but there is more: It's walking distance from my house. Woo hoo!  For those of you that don't live at my house, there is a MUNI stop directly in front of the building. Like RIGHT at the front door on Union. I wish I could remember which one. The bartenders (and most of the servers) are coool. Like, "Oh, you've never heard of that brew before? Let's discuss it for a minute and let me pour you a sample" cool. I specify 'most of the servers' because there's a few that are careless or overwhelmed or whatever. But all you have to do is get up, walk to the bar, and have a real conversation with a real person that can tell you firsthand real details about really damn good beer. Leave the serving food to the servers! Good n mellow crowd, as well as music. Great views! I love people watching on Union n Columbus. Heaters and patio seating! Beer gardens in the back (during the day). Not too overpriced bar food...  OK, not amazing yet not terrible quality. I had the beer n cheese soup (BOMB, but probably hard to mess up), my friend had the taco salad (totally Americanized but still great), burger (yummy!), and spinach artichoke dip (SO GOOD, with toasted pita!). All in all this place can kick it up a little with some more bathrooms, more attentive servers, maybe a fancier restaurant menu. But why? It's a public ALE house. So, go for the beer! And the great vibes. :)

F1bpfqIj0XWF73YUWrZ4Rg.review_text: Not terrible. Not awesome. Their food is totally average, but they do have a good selection of beers, and many are local. They have a great, visible location, which is probably why they are busy a lot. Bartenders are also nice. Honestly the only time I go here is when Sushi Hunter is crowded and I want to grab a beer while I wait for a table. Otherwise, if I am in North Beach, there are a lot of other bars I would rather go to.

zyCbUuTfR6En4rJzpWJ60A.review_text: Being a fan of Rogue beer, my fiancee and I stopped for a quick pint after checking out Lombard Street and Coit Tower. The bartenders were awesome, throwing beer samples our way and making dinner reco's for good Italian in the area. Being a veggie, I didn't try their bacon bloody mary, but was tempted!  Good times, great beer and great people!

8V4y5czt5cn2ioVBjz78UQ.review_text: Here is the deal, Rouge makes a lot of good beer so why not go to a place that has a lot of Rouge beer?  If you like craft beer, you'll find something you like here.  I'm a IPA fan and had more than enough options to pick from.  The double IPA packs a punch so bring your drunk shoes if you plan on trying that.  The atmosphere is more brew pub than brewery.  I'm not sure the food schedule but I've been there when they were serving food and other times when it was beer only.  I'm sure you can call and find out if you're curious.  You're also damn close to little Italy so the food options are plenty near by.  Overall I'm a fan of this place.  Solid beer selection and cool location makes for a good experience.

efloHFA5jEL3P-9Kmla4vQ.review_text: Great beer, HORRIBLE service. Service was so bad that we left after one round, and decided to never buy Rogue beer from any bars or our local grocer again.

_2h9MazCl88U4Bnry1jHFQ.review_text: Really 3 1/2 would be the accurate rating. Great beers--but come-on, this is basically a beer joint and all they had were 1 person bathrooms?  It was crowded when we came in, and they DID manage to serve me "fairly" quickly--but I had to go get it. Didn't see much table service. It is a great North beach Vibe and good spot to people watch. Yes, I will be back!

jkLIPaSAdGcgnLGaoElOmA.review_text: I like Rogue Ale House in SF because I love Rogue Ale as a brewery. They make some phenomenal beers. And they have an awesome birthday treat for you. The space is pretty good, nice backdoor patio section, and the front has a view of the park. It's not as cool as the one in Portland, but that's not it's fault.  It does have one flaw though that I hear almost everybody mention when they talk about it. IT DOESN'T HAVE A HAPPY HOUR. What's that all about?

5ECpPlyJaZsopL4GIHdMTQ.review_text: Rogue Ales Public House: a beer oasis in North Beach The Rogue Ales Public House across from Washington Square has in six-and-a-half years developed some of the characteristics of a neighborhood "local" pub: a place you can meet a buddy before going out on the town, or enjoy an afternoon snack and some good beer in pleasant surroundings in the middle of bustling North Beach and Chinatown. Rogue SF, the southernmost outpost of the Oregon-based Rogue Nation, has a lot going for it in becoming a local hangout. The bar is in a good location (formerly Mel's Steakhouse and Little City) on the corner of Powell and Union and it's open every day from around midday on. It's kid- and pet-friendly, and serves better than average beer with food. The outdoor patio gives the ale house a bit of an urban oasis ambience and Thursday night pub quizzes are popular. The pub pushes Rogue's beer and paraphernalia pretty hard - bottles for sale are lined up all over the pub -- and the staff is eager for you to try the beer. Servers are happy to oblige with a taste if you're curious about any of them.  Sometimes the devil is in the details, and Rogue SF is a bit frayed around the edges. The vinyl-covered bar stools are cracked and show considerable wear and tear, the patio is a little dingy, and the whole pub seems a bit tired and very 1980s. Food is typical pub fare, though the Kobe beef chili the bartender recommended was nicely balanced and tasty. Clearly, the chief reason for being here, other than trivia night, is the beer, which you order from the large chalkboard that looms over the bar.  The pub advertises 40 beers on tap, and even though several taps were out, there's still a lot to choose from. Unlike some other chain pubs, Rogue shares taps with beer from several local breweries, including Anchor's Old Foghorn Barleywine, Drakes Imperial Stout (Denogginizzer was out), Anderson Valley Huger Boont and Lagunitas Hairy Eyeball.  Rogue makes an extensive range of interesting beer, from pilsners to IPAs, porters and stouts. The Dry-Hopped St. Rogue Red Ale I had with the Kobe beef chili was delicious, bringing out the flavors of the dish while at the same time quenching the spicy chili and refreshing my palate. Even though the hops were noticeable in this red ale, they didn't predominate. At 5.1% abv, it's a very nice session beer. Rogue makes some excellent stouts and porters, too.
