Of the 18 Rogue beers listed on the chalkboard, six were porters or stouts. The SF pub served Rogue's chocolate stout, with imported Dutch bittersweet chocolate, in a hand-pumped cask, and it was delicious. Who needs dessert when you can have your chocolate and your beer all at once? Rogue Ales Public House in North Beach is worth a visit just to sample a nice variety of well-crafted, well-poured beers. The food isn't spectacular, especially considering the abundant options available in the area. But it's a good place to duck into for a pint in a cozy atmosphere with some North Beach denizens.

CBPN5JK2F64lIT79t5Owzg.review_text: I do love Rogue beers. They tend to be expensive when you purchase them at Bevmo, or Total Wine, but the Rogue Hazelnut especially - one of the best tasting beers I've ever had.   After visiting Napa for a bit, we drove to San Fran to see if we could find some breweries for beer. It was so awesome that we found a Rogue bar. We did the tastings (you choose 4 beers each tasting from a big list on a chalk board). Surprisingly, I only really liked about 3 of the 8 total beers (we had two tastings). The double chocolate stout is insanely thick - it tastes pretty good, but its basically like chocolate cough syrup. The regular chocolate stout they have is really good though, so is the asian sounding beer (forget the name.

EAUrXj9VgqYvGuPYEVYOJw.review_text: I have a really good idea what's going to occupy my free Thursday nights going forward...  Trivia night at Rogue!  So many great beers to choose from...which makes their sampler/flight of beer that much better. I really loved the Siamese Twin. And the chocolate stout and mocha porter were good ones to end the night with.   And then there were the burgers. Mmmm... So delicious. I had one with blue cheese - so much flavor that ketchup wasn't even necessary.   The trivia questions weren't as hard as I was expecting them to be - but that didn't stop our team from getting last place. But even the losers are winners here - we got a coupon for a free pint for the next time for having the lowest score.   As for the service, our waiter and the guys at the bar were great. I mean I think any 33 year old female is going to feel warm and fuzzy when they ask for an ID. :)

DDwuwjZHsTmN7-Fju7D1qw.review_text: Great beer selection, decent vibe, so-so food.  During my visit, I sat at the bar and found the bartender friendly and efficient.  She recommended an IPA which was quite drinkable and delicious. Unfortunately, the chicken pita sandwich I ordered was made with dry hunks of chicken that tasted like they'd been cooked much earlier and had been sitting in the "chicken chunk" bin waiting to get tossed on whatever dish called for dry chunks of chicken.  In my case, I got them on my pita...had I ordered a chicken salad, they would have shown up there, I'm pretty sure.  C'mon Rogue, cooking a piece of chicken couldn't take that much effort, eh? The pile of busted up chips on the plate added to the mess.  Next time throw me a bag of chips instead - cool?  Oh bummer, another 3 star beer joint.  I'm a beer guy and walking through the door of a tap-handle laden place should garner 4 stars alone, but not the case this time - 3.125 stars.

-6tQ0-a5ZV3PAQZAb2GmUQ.review_text: Numerous craft beers on tap from the well-respected brewery, and arguably a pioneer in its industry, of Rogue. The selection also included beer from a few other breweries as well.     They also have a cask. Chocolate stout was in the cask at the time I was there. Although I greatly enjoy cask-conditioned when drinking beer, I was in the mood for something other than a stout so I opted for a growler of Belgian ale by Issaquah Brewery, which cost about $24.      It was nice that they were open at around noon during a Sunday to allow us to stock up on some great brew for the football game.   Extensive selection of amazing ales in a large and comfortable space. Would be a regular spot if I lived in SF.

IBrL-6twlZmQBGLdV2DQiw.review_text: Sunny day, Dead Guy pint, dice on the nice patio, taking all my friend's money.  Lovely Monday afternoon.

EKdyI4jpUF29YtPkKiCtcg.review_text: welllllllllllllllll, yeaaaaaaaaaaaa ... taking a good 45 minutes to park for this joint is a bit out of control ... i can see how north beach is poppin and all, but come on... whether it be 9pm or 6pm or whatever time it may be, i didn't realize after all this time, north beach was THIS bad.  lots of local and foreign beer for your booze luvers.  place is known for the kobe beef .... after being spoiled by michael mina's japanese kobe, i feel that there is nothing else to compare it with.low key joint where you can come on in with a baseball cap, sweats and flip flops.  i guess it can get fun on a really nice day since they have this back patio with these picnic tables, but we stayed in watching the game.   place closes at midnight, so come one, come all, and be a big fart here while you're at it. i took a picture of a centerpiece that was on the table ... that is, if you care.  not sure if ill return anytime soon. maybe one day, or not... i might as well just go down the street and play eenie meanie miny moe and pick one in the marina since it is part 2 of the college days, i mean, those days you partied it up with those soroity/frat boys... *shrugs*

K7hIaTkVIl36KE0T9zAumQ.review_text: I've always been a big fan of Rogue beers so I was definitely happy to come to the San Fran location (twice). The staff is knowledgable about their beers and their guest taps, great recommendations.  I particularly love the Belgian-style Beard Beer. Get it while you can! Bartenders Katie and James gave us some great sight-seeing tips that weren't touristy spots.   We will definitely go back!

UwUnSHtNCpfYWgDidFsyEA.review_text: I love that there is a place south of the Oregon border where we can find such a great selection of rogue beers!! Went here last night and loved it. The only food we ordered were the irish nachos and they were delicious! !! It took forever for them to come out but in the end it was worth the wait! The criss cut fries werent spicy, but the horseradish cream gave them a perfect kick! The corned beef was cut into little pieces and crisped up into tiny pieces of salty, fatty goodness.  The hubby and I shared two beer samplers to get the most beers tasted. Some of the highlights were the brutal IPA which was so smooth and flavorful! ! I was also a big fan of the beard beer. Consuming yeast from a grown man's beard.. sorta made me feel manly.

AHqqO7iAn6MXyw28bB4P8g.review_text: Cool location. Heavyset waitress pretty full of herself and has quite an attitude. Great beers I would just stay clear of her.

m5cBT7OYfn0HM0d-RCsdZQ.review_text: Great space located towards the end of all the North Beach touristy nonsense.   That being said, it is nice to find a brewpub that encourages slouching at the table AND carry an expansive variety of beers on tap.  My friend tried the Hazlenut, which I would recommend because it was pretty much the smoothest beer at our table that night with hints of smoky hazlenut.  I had the Hard Apple Cider since I am not much of a beer drinker.  Another friend had the Dead Guy and last but not least, flavored soda for those committed to not having their friends drive drunk.  If you get the nibblies, I would have to recommend the Hummus plate.  It was not what we were expecting because it was a large portion AND pleasing to the eye.  Not only was there hummus, but a handful of olives, artichoke hearts, and slices of pita that were pretty fresh and soft.  We also ordered the spinach dip, which is a winner no matter where one goes.  This also came accompanied with a bunch of  fresh pita slices.  Great spot to hang except for the occasional waft of cigarette smoke from the outside, but the lazy-inducing vibes, warm interior, and stellar customer service eradicates all sense of negativity.

xV0zwASagIV-5wqMZZF_XQ.review_text: For beer this place is five stars but I had to give it only three because the food is just so so. I got a ham and cheese sandwich that was supposedly "cuban style" which just means a lot of pickles. The cheese on the sandwich was made with their beer which was pretty good, I'd like to try some other items on the menu that feature the beer more prominently than what I ordered.   The bartender / server was the friendliest guy ever, and absolutely knows his stuff so don't hesitate to ask for recommendations.

7rjAgnw-DsHThvzf6TDBLQ.review_text: Go here for the beer, not the atmosphere or the food. Good beer selection, but the food is best avoided (except the kobe burger apparently).  A big negative for me is the ratio of bar to seating. For an excellent ratio, most favorable to the customer, see Woody Zips up the street. What you want is a situation where the bartender(s) can fill all of the orders without you waiting. Essentially the balance between restaurant and bar, in a place specializing in beer, should lean towards the bar side. At rogue this is effectively an unfixable problem (I mean, they aren't going to double the size of the bar, which is what a space with this much seating would need to be a good drinkery), however this doesn't mean that this place is doomed, no, all it means is that they need to step their food game up to compensate. Make the menu bigger, lower prices, make people want to sit down and eat while they (by necessity) wait for their beer.  That's my 2 cents.

LCFxLA2yo-qN27Xvk34qEQ.review_text: my san francisco trip was mostly spent here. i love the atmosphere and the laid back mood everyone is in.

cYegBehFXJ7pI8nS0dWHRA.review_text: Went to the Rouge Ale mothership restaurant in Portland, OR. Once again, the beer was fantastic, and once again, I found mold on my hot dog bun.

x_IZffMZFj3dCjgoT3dYVA.review_text: Great beer selections from Rogue and New Belgium while I was there. The bartender was friendly and quick with tasters and suggestions for whatever brew you are in the mood for. The food was really disappointing though. $15 Kobe cheeseburger was a flavor-less frozen patty with blah accoutrements, it was amusement park grade, and most dishes seemed to have a lot of cheese. The Pub is next to Washington Square Park and two Muni stops. Fair warning if you prefer your beer alfresco though, if you hear chants of "Less gas, more ass" avert your gaze, lest the visual of old nude dudes on bicycles spoil your appetite.

wf924SjCjgJQzh0vzTxMNA.review_text: Great place to watch a game, get a beer, even have lunch. I went for a World Cup game and the place was packed - but the bartenders were very attentive, food was served quickly. They have tons of beer on tap - fun flavors, lots to try for even the pickiest people!

SUQk-LIalVZvAO_lVAGR8A.review_text: So, my review only covers the beers.  They have a great selection of awesome beers.  Tons of Rogue Beers(...obviously), and the non-Rogue beers there are solid.  The Bartenders were good at making suggestions when I was being indecisive.  The only detraction was that I would like to see some more beer's from other breweries, and I although the bartender's were knowledgable they were a bit slow, nothing too bad though.  As for the food...There are a lot of better places in North Beach to grab some food, go to those places

ldLzs1Zom9hshFGxsHS66A.review_text: The beer selection here is unparalleled. Like 20 Rogue offerings and another 20 other microbrew offerings (including Deschutes and Lost Coast, two of my favorites). The bartender will sample you anything you want to try - I go for the Rogue Amber Ale and Sig's Red, and stay away from the Hazelnut brown (yikes). It's nice and roomy, and there's a patio that seems like it would be a fantastic place to spend a sunny afternoon.

S4MB2dpIaBJwDAw2pxkqKA.review_text: Fantastic beer as always, and a really good blue cheese burger.  The guy serving my date and I was kind of an asshole. He never checked up on us and we had to flag him down for the check.

tnt0bvc67xqmwuRU7KESUg.review_text: From a beer perspective I am a fan. Been coming here since it opened and part of the famed and prestigious Rogue Nation since 2004. (jealous?) . Beer has always been top notch. No complains here. The back "Beir Garden" is a great addition. Place is getting messy though, even unclean. Floors filthy, bathrooms worse. Tables aren't maintained, some so unstable they can't hold a beer. But whatever, great beer makes up for allot. With that said, Food is horrific. Kobe beer sliders, flavorless hockey pucks. "Extra order" Fries awful. $14 burger doesn't even come with fries. Handfull of broken shitty ruffle chips.  Never understood this. Fries cost about 4 cents, put them with every sandwich! Lots of them! Nothing disappoints more when they get a burger, and it doesn't come with lots of fries. You are making a shit ton of money on the beer. Add the fries. There with a table of about 7. Not one person liked their food. Go there for the beer. Go elsewhere for the food.

QPhKwoNEGYzIeidIOh-5gQ.review_text: The three stars are for the back area. When the weather's nice I love sitting out back at the picnic tables and with my friends or making new friends. The back area is chill and only a couple blocks from my apartment.  They have a nice selection of beer and the staff is either really helpful or absentee, depending on the day. Their food is not great but if you've had a few beers and need something to soak up some of that alcohol then I'd recommend a burger.

3MyVWAgc3z1pkfZAenqTWw.review_text: There is a patio in the back - huge fan!

ZtmeHAQyNFku338dJMIfTg.review_text: Amazing selection of beer. Honey Orange Wheat is delicious. Food wasn't as grease-ball as expected. I've only had the Kobe burger and tried some of the Kobe taco salad and both were pretty good. I'm thinking anything Kobe is the way to go. I was surprised by the healthy portions of fries with my burger. And when I say l healthy I actually mean a small, don't stuff your face 'til you puke, portion. I'd like to go back for trivia night.  And to be clear... this is 4 stars on a bar/pub scale... not my usual SF restaurant/dining experience.

ckRJJpob4eCFCIBWl6fsNg.review_text: Nice selection of beers - both Rogue and guest beers.  We love to take the dogs back to the patio/beer garden in the back.  Nice place to relax with a fine beer.  They'll bring your dog a bowl of water, and sometimes a milkbone.  I wish the food was better.

zoahf1GKypVKEe1GxH0OUw.review_text: The atmosphere was good, good crowd. The staff there were really accommodating for our large party and even offered to let us reserve room in the back to host our event. I really like how they had a projector screen. We were able to drink while playing Street Fighter 4 on Xbox. That was a first for me at a bar.  The staff was nice, especially with that many of us demanding food and drinks, they managed to get around to all of us. The long wait was understandable and the food quality was decent.  The room they put our party was not circulated enough unfortunately, but it is not very typical of  San Francisco to have Air Conditioning... With our projectors, Xboxes, and TV's, the heat in the room was overwhelming.

j45PuQ1uZeljOh4vCmwi3w.review_text: Excellent outdoor atmosphere! The front is a great place to sit and chat with friends. For your pleasure I reviewed the beers I remember.  Glen Strong - Good smooth-bitter taste. Solid offering, 7/10 Summer Cream Ale - Great for one time, the finish is amazing! 7/10 Mocha Porter - Bad Taste, Bad Finish, no bite. 3/10 Summer Solstice - Smooth with a hint of cream in the finish. 7.5/10 Merimoto - Most bitter beer I had. Good fruity after taste. 8/10 American Amber - Best Beer of the night, Also the last - 'nuff said. 8/10  And sauntering home to the Bart, there is something special about feeling the bumps on the wall as I descend the escalator of the Montgomery BART station hammered.

dNbEgktKHAJsQaImV62hgQ.review_text: great selection of beers. Watermelon wheat beer was delicious. Nice view of a busy street. Really nice atmosphere. Hummus and pita bread was yummy.

isHgDvU7uLpBpdf5JtY9IA.review_text: So many places to compete with in this SF neighborhood, can't say the Rogue Public House stands out in my mind.  It certainly wasn't my favorite, but they have the basics; lots of beers, a food menu, seating indoors and out, and carry out.  I can't say that any of the Rogue beers blow me away, but I did get to try something new, which is always fun.  Simply a mediocre review for a pub that's pretty mediocre.

P5bUL3Engv-2z6kKohB6qQ.review_text: If you like lots of different types of beers this might be a place for you. Unfortunately I only drink stouts and wasn't too crazy about theirs, so I had to resort back to Guinness. Good for hanging out with a bunch of friends and having a few pints, as it seems pretty low key as North Beach goes.

hxjAthEnwYCEMg5hGDIO-Q.review_text: We stopped in for a drink mid day. Server took 5 min to come around but she was friendly when she did. My husband is a fan of the brewery since it's hard to find back home. Average $9/ beer. Very good selection of beers. We didn't eat anything so I can't comment on the food . Nice atmosphere and a good place to hang out.

TPFxyUqpnXEDbC0hkKxxUA.review_text: MmmmMMmm sometimes I dream about the Kobe beef burger with blue cheese and bacon cooked medium rare...ok I'm lying I haven't dreamt about it but if I did and I were a guy I would wake up with a surprise in my pants. This has to be my favorite kobe beef burger I've had  so far especially after 2 Imperial IPA's. One thing about this place...if you use the bathroom the sign on the doors don't say women or men it just says barley or hops. So take a guess at which is which, but I think barley is the womens and hops is the mens.

j14WgRoU_-2ZE1aw1dXrJg.review_text: Come to Rogue for the beer, not the food.  Rogue is a brand of beer from Newport, Oregon.  The company has several breweries & distilleries and restaurant-pubs in Oregon.  There is also this Rogue pub in San Francisco, which is located near the border of North Beach/Telegraph Hill and Russian Hill.  It's Rogue's southernmost location and the only one in California.  The inside of the pub is like any old traditional bar.  It's casual, worn, there are TVs playing sports... it feels like another laid back watering hole.  The space used to be Mel's Steakhouse and Little Cities.  My buddy and I stopped by to grab a quick dinner on our walk back to his apartment in Telegraph Hill.  On a weekday night, the pub got pretty busy.  I'm not much of a drinker, so I didn't try any of Rogue's ales (though my friend did).  I believe the house ales ran about $7-8 per bottle.  Not the cheapest bottles of beer, but I guess it is a special, local brand.  Food-wise, Rogue serves typical pub grub: soups, salads, sandwiches, burgers, hot dogs, fish and chips, tacos, wings, dip, chicken tenders, etc.  One interesting thing to note is they use American Kobe beef in some of their burgers and all of their hot dogs.  The Kobe beef is sourced from Snake River Farms.  These Kobe beef burgers and hot dogs are what is most recommended by the staff.  I had the half-pound Kobe cheeseburger ($13.95) and my tablemate had the Shepherd hot dog ($9.95).  Each of the Kobe burgers is priced around $13-16 and the Kobe hot dogs are around $8-10 each.  This is pricey for hamburgers and hot dogs, especially at a bar which isn't really a gastropub.  Normally, I wouldn't mind paying these kinds of prices if I can taste the difference in quality, but in Rogue's case, I couldn't -- they tasted much like an ordinary burger and hot dog.  Though nothing tasted bad, the sides seemed "amateurish" and unmemorable.  The Kobe cheeseburger consisted of a half-pound American Kobe beef patty, Rogue Creamery white cheddar (also choice of Oregon blue cheese), wasabi mayo, lettuce, and tomato.  I had my burger cooked medium.  The patty was thick and hearty, but not terribly distinct nor flavorful.  The burger came with a pickle spear and a side of plain French fries.  The Shepherd dog consisted of an American Kobe beef frank, topped with Kobe beef chili, and black beans.  It was served with shredded cheddar cheese and chopped purple onion on the side along with a side of ridged potato chips.  The dog fared much better than the burger.  It was more savory all-around.  The cheese, onion, and chips looked like they were picked up at Safeway.  The chips resembled (or actually were) bagged Ruffles crinkle-cut potato chips.  Service was A-OK.  JP was our server and he was friendly and hospitable.  Rogue in summary: Food - no. Beer - yes.

c8RF5DgEzea1l-6rZHFaxg.review_text: Solid list of beers. I've tried a few and would like to try more. I'll definitely return to this place.

KnK55UzmzL3qerIbsH0MfA.review_text: Meh, Rogue's alright.  I felt like I was stuck in the early 90's... the jukebox was consistently playing music from my late high school/early college years, reminiscent of Reality Bites and late nights listening to Live 105 in the  car on the way to Lyon's for a cheese stick.  I digress.  I admit that I had been passing by Rogue for a long time now, but had never stepped inside. Every time we passed by, my boyfriend would remark that it seemed too much like a "Dude" place, which sadly, it is. The decor reminded me of TGI Friday's. That combined with the sports on the telly, the guys in striped shirts & polos, and the outdated music only further enforced this stereotype.  Eleven bucks is a hefty price for a burger. I was willing to try their Kobe burger once at this price, for I am on a quest for the perfect burger. Verdict? Not worth the $11. *Maybe* $6. It was thick and meaty, but not spectacular. The bun left a lot to be desired, dry and a bit too large in proportion to the patty. Fries were fresh and hot, but flavorless.  Our waiter seemed in a rush to end his shift, so he was hurried, forgot our silverware, kept checking in with us (read: interrupting a lot), wiped our table down as we were still lingering over our beers.  I give the most points for the beer. I had the Mocha Porter (a no brainer, as soon as I saw it I didn't want anything else) and my dining companion had the Chocolate Stout... nice meaty brews appropriate for the cool autumn weather.  I'll stick to buying Rogue Ales somewhere else, and not bother with the Public House.

-SkaVyvc4QJJoSOqicGzog.review_text: Maybe it's just because we happened to show up there for a friends birthday and the bartender warmingly informs us he gets not only a free half-yard of ale, but also a nifty rogue ale house t-shirt as well. Now that's some neighborhood love. Not sure what the crowd is like on a regular basis (it was basically empty when we were there on a wednesday night) and it closes at 1, but still, I gotta say I dig this place.

Gw0WuzoMHjjmPJBvBpt_rQ.review_text: Rogue has some tasty beers.  I recommend getting the flight so you can try a bunch at once.  I'm partial to the hazelnut brown.  However, I've been on more than one occasion when they haven't had the beer I wanted.  Also, the menu is big, but the food is just so-so.

KyGkyqSPuJW-Sq7OXPVu2w.review_text: This is a pretty decent bar. I went here  on 10/29/11. The bar is fun. The bartenders are fast and can make the drinks quick. I never heard of this bar but it was my first time going there last Saturday. it's pretty big inside and nice and with a bunch of tables. I will probably come here soon when i'm back in the city next.

c9-jEIfBnLa4iNHxVmXAHA.review_text: This is a craft beer heaven.   Located in San Francisco's North Beach area, Rouge Ales from Oregon serves up some of the most unique suds in the city. Their signature "Dead Guy Ale" is pretty tasty although I find the hops to be a little too burnt for my liking and usually can only drink one before moving onto something lighter.   Their selection is pretty extensive and more often than not you'll find yourself trying to decide on what beer it is that you actually want, something dark?, something light?, something heavy?, something with a high ABV? (depending on your stress level that night) or something you can drink all night.   Well I haven't had the food I'm guessing it's your average Pub grub, nothing too special other than to fill you belly with beer soaking munchies.   Well I can't see myself spending an entire evening here, it certainly is a great spot to have the occasional "one or two" at on a night in North Beach.

nj5T2S55xIRP918o2k705g.review_text: Located on the corner of Columbus and Union, Rogue is pretty hard to miss. 6 of us came here on a Sunday afternoon and there were tables big enough to accomodate us. Our server was friendly and quick with our orders.   There is a massive selection of beers on tap and in bottles, the ones on tap are served in a cute glass with "ROGUE" cartoons on it. I have to admit I'm not a beer fan at all, but I must say that the Hazelnut Brown Nectar (Rogue beer) is pretty darn tasty, not over-beering at all, with a subtle hint of hazelnut.   Lucky for me, Rogue also has a full bar and a decent selection of house special cocktails. My favorite was the Ginger Daisy, the soothing taste from the lemon and ginger almost made me forget the toxic waste I was actually ingesting.   To make things even better, Rogue has a food menu, ranging from appetizers to full meals (burgers, etc). We ordered Idaho tater tots, Idaho fries, and bruschetta. The tater tots are out of this world, we all absolutely loved the crispy fried potato balls. The fries were good as well, but the bruschetta can be skipped. The bread was soft and cold, the tomato had some sort of weird herb mixture in it- PASS.   Overall, a fun SUNDAY FUNDAY gathering at Rogue.

LdyVNZyPl6vR0THDPw5zIQ.review_text: I thought the food was pretty decent. The service kind of sucked. No actual front door service, sat a table for a while before a server ever came. Sampled friends' beers, yum.  I might be back...after all a bowl of chili and warm place sheltered me from the cold.

8fSaLfemE1G403PMJzfATw.review_text: 5 stars for the beers and selection 3 stars for the food  Rogue Ales House is a great bar that has always seemed to be figuring out exactly what it is: sports bar, beer bar, company store, regular bar, bar/restaurant. I have been in a few times and it certainly can serve as any one of those.  There is ample seating throughout the bar, but surprisingly not many comfortable areas to stand if there is no seating available. The beer selection is top notch, especially if you like Rogue beers. They have many hard to find Rogue offerings. They also have a handful of visiting taps (beers from other micro brewers), so even if Rogue isn't your thing you can still get some delicious craft beers.  The food is really the only thing keeping the Rogue Ales Public House from 5 stars. Their classic fried foods are delicious but even simple things like a burger are not consistent and can sometimes be downright disappointing. The tater tot dishes, though, are worth it!

UiwKgaQ_52bb6-o5o8jEYA.review_text: This review is strictly for their American Kobe Burgers and fries...they are insanely good!!!! About $14, but worth every penny. The burgers are generously portioned, juicy, and perfectly seasoned. Their house Chardonnay is delicious too...you will find me fighting for a table there...don't order the last Burger!!!! It's mine!!!

6AKefJkxjEulK4TkmrLyEw.review_text: No idea on the food side of things what it's like, but this was fun to check out one night, when my brother realized there was a Rogue Ale House along Columbus Ave. Obviously since I already was a little familiar with Rogue from the fact Edgewater Lounge in Chicago always has had a lot of Rogue beers on tap, I naturally had to check them out the night he told me he was going here.  So a pretty nice place. There are both booths to sit down and eat, along with the usual TVs and a comfortable bar area. I sampled several beers, and getting a beer flight wasn't too expensive. They even do sell beer bombers of their beers, to go.  Sad news is that I learned the hard way(don't fly often, unlike others) liquid bottles of anything bigger than a certain size are prohibited to be taken through the TSA security checkpoint, and that you only can take those onto a plane if you check in a bag. As a result, my Rogue bomber was confiscated. :( I also didn't want to create a scene or anything like that at San Francisco Intl. Airport, or be gawked at weirdly by others hurriedly sipping a beer, so I said 'ef it' and allowed my bottle to be confiscated. Luckily, I only lost $10(how much my bomber cost), as a result of not knowing this. So if you buy a bomber and you flew out to San Francisco from somewhere else, purchase it with EXACTLY the expectation you should drink it down in your motel/hotel room or wherever else(i.e. friend's apartment, a BYOB restaurant, etc), and avoid what I went through! I'm sure whatever lucky TSA soul drank my bomber as a result of it being confiscated and showing up among all the confiscated items, had fun(boo to him/her).  Why the heck this TSA rule can't be reversed in 2015, I have no darn idea why. Not everyone cares to fork over $25 or whatever airlines are attempting to charge these days(god bless Southwest for still not charging for checked bags, and sadly I wasn't flying with them on this trip), to avoid a beer being confiscated if you prefer to not pay ridiculous checked baggage fees.

1ljC2JgUafYC9wtEUXJ3bQ.review_text: I came with a big group of 20 people for my friend's birthday sometime last (Indian) summer and have been coming back ever since.  Rogue is a great place to eat and drink for large groups.  There's a patio in the back, awesome beer samplers, an "endless" selection of beers to try, so it's hard to imagine having a bad time here.    When I have guy friends visiting from out of town, I like starting with Rogue first and then wandering to other North Beach bars to finish off the night.  There's also a trivia night on Thursdays, which is fun!  One sad thing (that is understandable) is that they don't let people dressed in Santa costumes in on Santa-Con.  Boooooo.  But I get it.

ezO9k_mcyTrW9ZRvuv59qw.review_text: I am surprised that some people have given this such low marks.  The positives about the place include the beer garden, which is a very relaxing place to enjoy some brew on a warm day. They also offer a pretty cool sampler that comes out in a paddle allowing you to try 4 different brews. Some of there beers are not that good, but I also really enjoy a couple of them including the fairly unique Hazelnut Nectar and their most famous "Dead Guy Ale."   The food is maybe slightly above average which is really the best you can hope for in a reasonably priced brew pub. They also seem to have a lot of events here like tastings and trivia nights. If they had some better specials for happy hours it would be my favorite brew pub in the city. All in all a great place for an afternoon beer or to start a night out on the town...

KfAfarlZrXBwYpKJoTVHoQ.review_text: Rogue is a great place to grab a very good beer but   ........the service and food has become consistently sub-par. My friend and l ordered beer and dinner on a rather quiet Sunday afternoon, our food arrived before the beers and I had to ask three times for my drink.  I finally got the first, ordered the second halfway through dinner and finally got it just before we got the bill! (and yes, we had to ask for that too) When we said something about the service the server got defensive and had an attitude.  They were totally uninterested in our complaints and showed no concern about improving their service.    When we spoke to the manager, we discovered why the service was so poor.  The manager was apathetic and dismissive.  He had no interest in keeping us as customers even after we told him we go there somewhat regularly, enjoy the patio and would like him to be aware that we've seen the place go downhill.  He made absolutely no attempt to resolve the complaint. In fact the only person I thought heard us was the new guy who started a week before! (Awesome job man, I'm sure your next boss will appreciate you--and thanks for trying.) He didn't offer us a coupon for our 'next visit', a complimentary beer, not even an apology for the piss poor training that he's given to his obviously inexperienced staff. I got the feeling he was fine with losing local customers just so long as it didn't distract from his routine of watching TV.    I won't go back.  If I'm going to spend my money it will be at a truly local place that values my patronage and respects their clientele. Good day sir.

CO82sC1pmHrRs_JXW96FAg.review_text: Go for the beer, and stay for...the beer. The rest is just crap window dressing. Certainly could use a makeover. The pub-style food is ok, too, if that's your thing.

r636kd302eGgDGuS-dR4bQ.review_text: trivia thursdays is the reason for my existence.  always in last place, but the environment is lively and fun.  The putnam pornographers will one day win at trivia.  maybe not in the near future...but someday.  hazelnut ale is the only beer i get.  the artichoke dip tastes horrible but the other appetizers are legit.  sweet potato fries are a must.    very friendly service.  all the waiters get to know you if you go there enough.

ehdrFZwh1XRxzqR-6Kbg9A.review_text: FIVE STARS mainly because it is very dog friendly here- this review is long overdue by a few years.  The first time I came here which was a few years ago- the server gave my dogs treats, a huge bowl of water, and dog bandanas.  My dogs normally do not wear clothes, but I dressed them up in the bandanas to get into the spirit--  They were working on a dog menu at the time, but I do not think it ever came into fruition...either way- you can bring your dog here- actually walk through the restaurant with them, and go to the beer garden back patio to eat etc.  My dogs like it here- picnic table like seating- everyone pets them.  They might get a french fry or a popcorn shrimp if they are lucky..  The menu here is good- standard "pub food" with a twist-  kobe beef burgers (yum) and other things- if you drink beer, they have a million different kinds.  They make me home made ginger ale if I ask for it.  Blue cheese lovers will like this place- lots of dishes with blue cheese..  I definitely recommend this place if you have a dog(s)- there is a lot of space, the food is good- and afterwards go to Washington Square Park across the street and hang.

GCuDiPUKYxhgFHP5LqJa2Q.review_text: Been back since and the last visit was for food.  Our waiter was very friendly.  He walked us through their beer selection and gave us samples of a few until we found one we liked.  We decided with their amber ale ($5.50) and DeadGuy ($5.50).  We had the bbq wings ($10.95) and asked for extra bbq sauce ($1 - seriously???), a reuben ($9.50) with fries ($1).  The wings were ok only.  The reuben was the size of a tea sandwich - seriously, it was small - we had it with our pinky up!  Never expect such girlie portion in a pub.

aPXKEuJLx6FQREFXEtGUWw.review_text: I've always been fond of Rogue's fine beers, so I figured a trip here would be nothing but pleasant. Seriously, one server for the entire place on a slammed Saturday evening?? I think in the hour and a half I was here, we only managed to sip about three pints. Every time we'd ask the poor waitress for another drink, she'd roll by about three times before it dawned on her that we had ordered something. In fairness, maybe somebody called in sick. At any rate, if that's par for the course, HIRE MORE HELP!   We ordered a hot dog and the fish and chips, they actually showed up at our table in a reasonable amount of time. The hot dog with bleu cheese and caramelized onions was quite tasty.  Good beer, decent food, overworked staff. I want to return and see if I can give them another star.

gUECqDGMzq8mU_oz-Kp7Ug.review_text: My wife called July 17 about noon  to ask for directions from our home in the East Bay. The bartender who answered the phone said he didn't know how to drive there. My wife asked if he could ask someone else and was told "no".  "What an Ass" I thought. "Is he there by himself? Impossible because they serve food. He could have asked the cook or the wait staff.  What poor customer service."  I almost changed my mind about going after this but decided we should be able to find it and might as well check it out as I have been wanting to for some time..  I'll be damned if that poor guy wasn't there by himself cooking, cleaning, bussing tables, serving drinks and pouring beer.   I was hoping they served pitchers and seems they don't but I had two glasses of their Imperial Pilsner that were pretty tasty. Two beers and Wifey Had an ice cream sundae for $20 total. Plus I left a good tip for the man who I thought was rude but was really just overworked.  I would like to stop by again.  Management if you are reading you need to look at the staffing and also plug in some Wifi. Also remind the bartender to issue a fresh glass with each beer. Not a good idea to pour beer from a tap into a used glass as germs can pass to the tap.

cBU1QrFMY5c2SjohOuUPlw.review_text: I have mixed feeling about this place. At first I loved it, food was good, beer was good, but the day after I went my neck was all kinked out due to having to look this massive board, with little to no descriptions of beers i had to turn my head 180 degrees to see.   Buy some cheap environment-safe paper and print your beer list daily and have an 86 board. so much easier then the current method.   I also find it terribly annoying to watch your server stand out side smoking cigarettes while we were waiting to be greeted for a beer. Then they reek of cigarettes a big no-no in my book. wash your hands, pray some cologne or perfume and then go to your tables.   the food has gotten lower and lower quality every visit. good bar food i guess. However they still get 4 stars for great beer selection which in all honesty is why we go there.   just get a better beer menu/descriptions and you'll get a 5th star.

nAbwXrHgJx5BshmOcCRCZQ.review_text: What 's good:  (1) Nice place to start a pub crawl without breaking the bank - get some solid food in.  Then you can go either way on Columbus or hit any side street between Stockton, Leavenworth, Broadway and Mason.    (2) beer flights, but you can only order from the left board.    (3) trivia - I'm no good but it's fun to watch others bite it  Not good:  There can be quite a few people blocking the bar; sit at the bar too long and you might end up hearing a strangers sad story.

UzO_9SHVaCPsT3KZbbQ0gg.review_text: Rouge is a little out of the way to go to for me, but i seem to end up there after a night of drinking elsewhere on many occasions, brewed on site (maybe) i can't really form a distinct impression of this place, but the beer is good and the ambiance always leaves me lacking, too bright, and too cafeteria like i think.

gLke-4oih1t7urvoQAENcQ.review_text: Love the place, the Rogue beers, and the excellent trivia nights, but $7-8 for a beer is kind of steep.  The Hazelnut Brown is usually at the top of my list, but they've been out of it the past few months.  Trivia means getting there by 7 or even a tad earlier since there are plenty of people eager to play. Lots of bros and their entourage, but since it's North Beach, I suppose we're all in their territory, so no real complaints.

tSdz6ZkR0psn41cCaaTlYw.review_text: I enjoyed the beer flight that I had, but the service could have been better.  I wish they had a beer menu that explained the beers in more detail from a flavor perspective (perhaps they do and they just didn't offer us one).   Overall, the hazelnut beer was my favorite - highly recommend this if you like darker beers, but want something a little lighter.

VvmEMZxJk3zp9lyGDkjxRw.review_text: Umm...yeah.  The food is not so great, the place is a little run down, but the beer makes up for all of it.  Try the Daddy's Little Helper, or the Chipotle Ale if they've got it.  I actually had my wedding rehearsal dinner at the Rogue Ale House in Portland, so I've got a soft spot for them.  Park around the block --there's a nice and relatively inexpensive garage across from the police station.

S0yLkzB9QHC3Q4BpfM_iCw.review_text: Beer beer beer beer beer! If you like the sweet liquid nectar from the gods, you'll love Rogue! They have a ton of beers on tap (reasonably priced) including a bunch of beers I've never heard of before. Check out the watermelon wheat, it's every bit as delicious as it sounds! Or if you don't do that, at least try a beer you've never had before; life's too short to only drink Sierra and Anchor Steam.

o-bynyv9GHdG0nHlQUeYUA.review_text: Great bar to stop at if you don't want to get hassled about using their bathroom! Great selection of draft beers. I'm not the biggest fan of Rogue, but this bar is pretty cool. They carry brews other than their own and it was a great spot to meet some friends and get plans together for the night. Our server was great, didn't leave us waiting for anything.

AyJcTC6ZKWNbiBJAaepSVw.review_text: Love bars with tons of beer. Just love them. And this one did not disappoint at all. They have a large variety of beers to choose from. Ales, blondes, porters, stouts, ambers, etc. I tried the oatmeal stout, which was ok, but I have had better ones. They have a bar to sit at or you can take a seat at one of their tables. The wait staff are ok - its SF you get what you get pretty much. Cool place to just sit and have a drink.

fKrXlmBItmzNXFn6JD4d1w.review_text: This is a solid, no frills place to get a beer. They brew their own and also have a selection of beers from other breweries, including great local choices such as Lagunitas and Speakeasy, and old stand-bys like Stella Artois. There is also a full bar for those not beerishly inclined.  The decor is minimal, and I do not mean minimalist, I mean ain't nobody thought much about it. It has a very college town feeling, complete with TV's throughout the bar and wasted Brohemians bonding with the juke box.   We had a couple of beers here and then moved on. Didn't try any of the food and that was on purpose. I had already been forced to feed the beast at Chili's earlier that day and could not stomach any additional culinary mediocrity. The good news is, this place is right next door to Cinecitta.

7nzj8i-myMogZ83WYGHGSg.review_text: Wall of taps. I've never seen that many beers on tap before.  If you don't know what you want, simply tell the bartender what you feel like (ie: light and sweet), they'll take care of you :) Also you can sample the taps if you're not sure which one you like/want.  Bar atmosphere, good for a group of people who are too lazy to go dancing/just want to chill and relax.

k7a_AaA38JZ1DfMEdoI5CA.review_text: Pretty good drinks, pretty lousy service.  Well located in the North Beach district, but don't expect to get waited on attentively.

czKYXOuClINUXE7WRBaw7A.review_text: Stopped here twice on our visit to San Francisco.  They offer an impressive selection of beers. The music was good too. Didn't get a chance to try the food or sit outdoors. Would definitely visit again.

s7C3buBJR06S90v4rkI51A.review_text: Great selection of beer. Tried the chocolate stout. YUM! Need to go back again.

Rg8IqGsEV6l0kmzXUbRjmQ.review_text: To make a 5-star pub: 1. Serve beer 2. Serve good food like Kobe burgers, hot wings et al 3. Have patio seating 4. Brew your own beer (and have it come out oh so good) 5. Have good bartenders and wait staff 6. Be in a warm part of town 7. Have sidewalk tables 8. Be open during the afternoon hours on a weekend when guys can sit outside on the sidewalk tables and watch the pretty girls walk by wearing little, because its so beautiful outside.  9. Be right next to Coit Liquors

_fAgp3TRT1mBQbQHyMBAdg.review_text: Despite having a flagship ale that is particularly triumphant, this brewpub remains thoroughly mediocre.  I wouldn't say it's a bad spot by any means, but I've never been too impressed by the food here and I've tried several times.  The prices are a beet steep and some of the items are just lacking in quality.  They do however offer a wide array of fantastic and unique beers on draft at all times.  I can never turn that down.

GrktSJ7Bv9t37gwDLIlAwg.review_text: I am very grateful that Rogue has a public house in San Francisco. It beats flying up to Portland every time I have a hankering for Rogue and it's better than out of a bottle. I would recommend coming for the beer, but skipping the food. It's a relaxing, laid-back place. Guys like this place a lot, it seems from the clientele. You can get some bottles of Voodoo Doughnut ale to go too. Hit this place up if your local grocery store doesn't carry the Rogue ale you're looking for. Or if you want to buy a tshirt to profess your love.  As for the beer, they do some pretty eccentric stuff, so taste around. And you can do that with a taster of 4 for $8. You pick your own 4. It could be really hit or miss per individual. The hef was not my favorite hef, but I truly enjoyed the dry hopped red, very hoppy indeed. The jasmine mead was delightful too. I've never seen a beer so clear before. Some sour beers are likened to wine-beer, but the jasmine mead was like a tea-beer. The Oregasmic ale was very hoppy. If you're into barleywines, try Old Crusty, pretty intense. I thought the Rougenbier was pretty intense too. For something more mellow, go for the Imperial or Yellow Snow or Dead Guy.

xLKZiBs6iIJWk2vwEJQRMg.review_text: Great pub, love the Dead Guy Whiskey. Also the Hazelnut Brown Nectar is quite awesome.

HTy2oDeWfMTzmJ5MkHYrYQ.review_text: food sucks, place is freezing, servers suck, ambiance sucks, but they got the Rogue brews !  Morimoto Soba Ale beeyitch.

x-8MamivBk3ZXMPUca1fMw.review_text: An awesome place to grab a beer and a snack! Mellow, but not too quiet. Classy, but not pristine! Great house beers, especially their porters. And of course being in the heart of North Beach is always great. Drink inside or outside on a sunny day or muggy night! And their food isn't bad either! Wings are great as are their burgers. If you're in the area its worth a stop-in!

2pPNxXnyh6EDUuBJVuoQmA.review_text: My North Beach experience tonight was very underwhelming.  My friends and I arrived at around 11, and there were no tables except a dirty one. We sat down, but the waiter didn't really give it a wipe down after he cleared the previous guests's plates.   Some big group was yelling and screaming and causing a major ruckus (over some drinking game. I think). It proved to be very distracting, and downright annoying at times.   $6 for a watered down whiskey sour is not really my idea of a good value. I should have stuck to beer. They do have an impressive selection of craft beers.   If I'm in the area, I *might* check it out again, but it's not very high on my to-do list.

L1q7c2w6BZOvSuvYZvNGaQ.review_text: Rogue makes great beer, so that was definitely expected.  The service was good, and the food was good too.  Cool environment, very laid back.  Would go again.  Although, the homemade chips needed seasoning

p7eBbebXQ8bxwXRtPiwXiA.review_text: I was there for trivia night. The beer was excellent!! hands down. The food was also great. The trivia guy was awesome, and I should have had a great night. But I want to give the bartenders one star. They wouldn't smile, they wouldn't listen. Every time I asked for something I felt like I was bothering them. At first I thought it was because they were really busy, but the servers weren't busy. And there were dirty dishes every where; which is odd because they gave us plastic glasses. I wouldn't even care if they were busy or not, I would have waited. But never once did I get a 'hi' or anything.

uIuPnF98lmUiSv9q0yINqA.review_text: Great atmosphere, but don't come here for the food.

-uglef88WEwkI6UlAqwO0Q.review_text: My wife and I were in San Francisco and I was here about 5 years ago and it was a solid place. We returned and I was really disappointed.   I ordered the Cobb salad, which was pretty good and my wife also got a salad. They were pretty good, but the atmosphere was really disappointing.   I am a beer aficionado and the waitress did not know what style the beers were. I mean this is a flagship bar for Rogue Beer!!!!! This is one of the best beer brands in America and the waitress doesn't know what the beer styles are?!!?!? Sacrilege. How does the waitress not know what style the Rogue Beers on tap are?   The food was okay, nothing special, but not having a waitress at a Rogue Bar not know what the beers are is just wrong.

mx--3imE_FSUN7CMZ-ZdEw.review_text: This place is all about the beer!!    Rogue Public House could be located in a decrepit old barn and still get five stars from me just for assembling so many incredible beers under one roof.  But this is not an old barn...it's a home-away-from-home feeling bar located in the North Beach section of San Francisco.  Also a nice place to sit outside along the sidewalk at one of the handful of tables on a perfect spring day as it was when I visited.  One need not be a Rogue Nation geek like me to indulge here as there is a plentiful selection of guest handles available as well as a full bar. But come here to drink Rogue on tap...it really doesn't get any better!  Rogue Nation!!

XF8ALuBfoEfO8t3C88fugQ.review_text: Love love love the beer garden on a nice afternoon.... there is something about picnic tables at a bar that I find very endearing - it encourages close contact with your neighbor!  Their beers are very good - I can't remember some of the ones I've had, but now after reading some of these Yelp reviews I have a few specific ones in mind to try next time I'm there.... I have never eaten here, and probably won't anytime soon since there are so many good food options around N Beach.  But I will back for beers, and maybe trivia (how is it that I didn't know about this before??).

Y-X11AD0MckRX4rSrAlUYQ.review_text: $7 a beer? No happy hour... that's just ridiculous.   The food is standard pub fair, a little less than average and inconsistent.   The place has a smell that isn't pleasant... the bathrooms are gross.   In today's brewery world, this place is severely lacking.

vPWjHU0ZFjy_9tEtk-8_pg.review_text: absolutely loved this place on a recent trip to SF. I love, love, love breweries and this one did not disappoint. Its located right across from Washington Park, which is a great location.  This is clearly where the cool kids hang out and with good reason. Great selection of Rogue and outside beers on tap. Very chill atmosphere and great burgers. Outdoor seating gives a great view of the park and is a fantastic way to spend soem time with friends. Go there!

j6GK2SSR2g-B2peogcws_Q.review_text: Everything sucks. Life is a joke. I want to die. The buffalo wings are great. I ordered a drone strike and a fireball and I received both, as was my choice. Life is full of winners and losers. Everyone dies. And thus, we all are losers. Try the fries.

pEnPxArLOZlKC94iVkVFxQ.review_text: I have wanted to come here for days!! And yesterday, I did!  I had a hazelnut beer... I think... well it was bomb!  The outdoor patio is very nice as well as a number of tables and a bar!  The meatballs looked incredible!   I will definitely be frequenting here from now on.  Especially since its next to the park!

zUtBqANQg_zuusKXRQNwzA.review_text: Great location.  Good beer selection, but on the pricier side.  Not the best service.   Accepts drunks so not a bad place when your sluuuuuuuuuuurin

xsMd6OnEJ6_Np6Es0uxOIg.review_text: I went during the day so I didn't have to deal with the bartenders, but the servers seemed attentive. So many beers to choose from on their list! I had a sip of a nectar beer a friend ordered. It tasted pretty sweet. I wanted to order the double chocolate stout they had on the menu, but the server mentioned they didn't have that yet so I settled for an oatmeal stout. Both were yummy.

A9La_4Lju3u8PHSWQ5Vzyw.review_text: If you live here in SF I could see this being a solid place to frequent. As a tourist though, you might want to only come for the beers as the food is nothing special. It's American bar food which you can get anywhere no matter where you're from.

zqttuCEWI4-l4ZBCbfGk6A.review_text: I'm not even a beer drinker and I'm a fan of this place! Awesomely delicious Bloody Marys and a cool, relaxed vibe in one of my favorite parts of the city.

PuRGm01YPZXn-NIa2nxqkA.review_text: Gawd, what the hell is the point of reviewing anything in SF, everything has like 100+ reviews.  Freaks.  You know what one of the coolest thing about being on vacation is?  Beer - at 1:00 pm - on a Thursday - at a bar. Now I realize that for a lot of people this isn't such a big deal.  But for me, at least for the last 3 months after they banned alcohol at my workplace, this is pretty freakin' cool.  The Public House falls smack dab in the middle of the range between a high-end brew pub and a dive bar.  This place has seen better days. And you know what?  There's nothing wrong with that.  Seriously though, you go to this place for the beer.  Rogue makes some of my favorite beers (Dead Guy) and the idea of having this place as my neighborhood pub that I could walk to if I lived in North Beach is kind of dreamy.  The service was slow, but it was because they were undermanned for Thursday afternoon.     We skipped the food, but what I saw and from what I've read, we didn't miss much.  It enough for me to have a couple beers after wandering around SF all morning. Check it every once in a while, if you are in the neighborhood, but don't make this a destination.

eUmVXP9UnoWtz9NSBwY4jA.review_text: Had a couple of beers here recently with a friend out on the back patio...good beer, dog friendly, will be back on a sunny day to check out the food.

dEW7W1vrAwOL1XDtf3dwTA.review_text: Service 1 star, Food 2 Stars, Beer 9 stars!

Sz600UsLJJaw9XDBpa_4ZQ.review_text: Rogue is a great local joint for interesting beers and trivia on thursdays... other than that an improvement in service, food, and # of TVs would really make this place a winner.   I enjoy the option of ales, however the crowd is spotty depending on the night and I think an improvement in TV size and frequency within the restaurant would really make this my go-to spot.   As for food.... meh, nothing to shout about, but those chicken fingers with ranch sure are tastey!  And finally service... meh, the staff generally seem pre-occupied, but fine with me, 3 stars it is.

0QeJC2inz6P-OVzROU_LNw.review_text: It's a shame that I am giving this place a 2 but that's only because I waited and waited at the bar to make my purchase but the bartender did not see me.  It was like I was invisible - I could have walked out w/ the First Growth Single Malt Ale in my hands and nobody would even noticed.    Unlike the location in Portland, OR, this one is so packed w/ college kids.  I felt like I was a sardine in a can.  I could not envision dining here and having a pleasant experience but this rating is purely based on my alcohol buying experience.    Two Saturdays ago I spent the day indulging in sweets but I had my heart set on stopping by Russian Hill for Coit Liquor as I was told by a personnel of Rogue (I called) that they do not sell their whiskey and that Coit Liquor does.  When we got there, I was shown the goods but sadly I wasn't able to afford it; they have 2 kinds available but they run between $45-$60 a bottle.  I basically gave up but then we stumbled upon Rogue.  I went in and then I became overwhelmed because of the noise, crowd, and lack of service.    It took me over 10 minutes to make a purchase.    I'm sending his Valentine's Day gift today.  I hope he likes it..

P2W_d4yZjhn6kI90U4vUxg.review_text: Ugh. We took my dad there for pub trivia, which was fine. It was our waitress' first day but she she was really attentive and helpful despite not knowing the answers to any of our questions. They get two stars just for her.  The food was not good at all, and way too overpriced. I was shocked at our final bill--even after receiving a refund for the nasty calamari (no doubt frozen or just hella old), it just didn't seem like we got our money's worth. The beer was flat, not really cold...and did I mention that the food was crappy? For what they charge, they should either up the quality or quantity.  Where are the dinner entrees that are posted on their website? Nowhere to be found, as if we made it up on our own. Niice. And Kobe beef? That's no Kobe beef. At those prices, you're just getting tastier crappy meat. A real Kobe beef hamburger would run you $50. Fools.  And maybe they could make the place look a little spiffier? Or am I asking too much? Maybe.  We will not be back. Oh, I had such high hopes, too.

A-q5Rz4z7k6Kafos0Vx96w.review_text: Hello massive beer collection!  No joke, they have a ton of beer on tap. Most of it is their own stuff, but the rest is microbrews. I love coming here because you are always guaranteed to find an awesome beer to drink to.  This time around, I came with a friend and we made the mistake of coming out on trivia night. Ok, no big deal, but I couldn't find a table so I snagged 2 seats at the bar. I still had a great time hanging out just would have been nice to sit at a table. On the plus side, we did join a trivia team and ended up winning :).  Food was pretty good to. I did notice the fries in my fish and chips were a little greasier than usual, but that didn't stop me for eating them.

qDeflAyeYm2grvZTu7yq-A.review_text: Good vibe for an afternoon beer. Inside is a little drab for the daylight, but I loved the beer garden in the back. I tasted--and enjoyed--the Rogue Oatmeal Stout. I'll definitely be back the next time I'm in the North Beach area.

fRgdiUDUAu05WdLUC-bQcA.review_text: I LOVE ROGUE BEER!!! I did not eat here, just drank and had a great time trying new beers and drinking favorites like the Hazelnut Brown. They could have had four stars but did not have some of the beers I wanted to try in stock at the time.  My girlfriend and I drove up from Reno for the weekend and met friends here and we chatted with the bar tender (GREAT SERVICE) and tried samples of (hiccup!) quite a few different beers from Rogue and Dogfishhead; I recommend the bacon vodka we tried only in Bloody Mary's and not for shooting. Stumbling out at 1:50 (damn last call) with a Dogfishhead growler of their Pumpkin Ale, I left wishing they will open one up in Reno sometime soon.

JOtF5CrxlvHKpoKU4ByAbQ.review_text: Been here a lot - it's never been that great. The food was mediocre, the bartenders are usually ridiculously slow. There are many bars in north beach that have better beer selection (Kennedy's, La Trappe) so there isn't much of a reason to go here if you aren't specifically meeting friends here.

pskRvwKmjnp50N_65W5KTw.review_text: Kudo's right from the start! Thanks you for having "Devil's Canyon Full Boar Scotch Ale" on tap. Wonderful selection of beers!  I wish this would portend things to come, but sadly NOT.           My buddy and I were planning on staying at Rogue for a bit, and just recovering from a short race. After our first order, we were deciding on follow-up choices. Well...  we each asked to taste; ONE(1) each. What we got was half a shot glass, and a "look" as if we were a nuisance. Having been in quite a few bars, asking for a taste of something is usually NOT perceived as a customer trying to get a free buzz, but rather, a patron trying to DECIDE what's next! To this guy, is was obviously an irritant.         I did NOT realize these "tastes" are deducted from  the bartender's salary. I would not have asked, and I would have just leaped in and ordered whatever had the best GRAPHIC. My bad. Soooo, after a micro-taste of whatever, we decided to cut our losses, and make the slog over to Park Chalet. We traded our grouchy barkeep, for live music, dogs, kids and SUN, and the beach. Good second choice for us:-)

LdWIjNvjdaAoAfpQhT6F9w.review_text: If you have the option of eating elsewhere, please do! However, come back for the selection of beers, friendly service, and fun trivia night [Thursday]. It might not necessarily be my crowd, but a good time can still be had amongst friends. They also have a tasty pomegranate cider for those in need of their antioxidants! We arrived early to save our spots for trivia night, and it's a good thing we were there almost an hour and a half beforehand. The server working in the back area was awesome, helping all groups find enough chairs and table space as he could. He was also attentive enough to keep the drinks/food [though not recommended] coming. Trivia night gets so packed they run out of beer glasses, and then you're stuck building pyramids and towers on the table with plastic Rogue cups [farm5.static.flickr.com/…. I'd definitely want to come by when it's not all crazy packed, but I certainly wouldn't mind reliving an occasional "gather a bunch of friends for trivia and WIN" moment - go Team "I Went To Seaworld And All I Got Was This Bloody Poncho!" You make me so proud!

xuYgXEzt2g2hqB4krSFvzA.review_text: i think it's funny all these people actually review the food and decor. it's rogue beer.  a whole bar full of it.  what is a matta??  buttloads of good beer.  that's all you review from now awn yelpers.  no more of this silly stuff.

fbcMojj5zHf7DqP0H7RAhA.review_text: MMMMMMMMMM super tasty beer on tap!  This is one of my favorite places to go in San Fran when I'm feeling bummish, don't want to spend more than 1 minute to get ready, and want to hang out with people that simply enjoy good beer.  The place is definitely screaming "we don't care how bad our bar looks", but I think thats part of the super chill/ non-pretentious atmosphere.  Pretty much you come here to relax and try some uber tasty beers.  There is always something new to try as they rotate the beers.  I can still taste the Double Mocha Porter...yum.  I've sat at the bar each time I've been here and the service was pretty good.  I'm not the kind of person who appreciates someone asking me if I'm ok every 5 minutes, so a little laziness is really my style at a place like this.  Haven't really tasted the food, but this is a place I go for the beer, not so much for the food :).  Enjoy!

7OagHIAKx2Rm9z3CQ0OmvA.review_text: This place is pretty neat. I appreciate the 40 beers on tap, and I'm not even the biggest beer drinker. The last time I came I had a glass a merlot too which was actually quite good. Since it's in the neighborhood, I always come here to meet up with friends casually. Sort of like my default bar. Very laid back, nice spot.  Only thing, the food's not so good so get your munchies elsewhere. I tried the cheese covered version of their "famous" hazelnut ale bread...sounds cool huh? Wasn't anything special and made my jaw hurt the next day bc it was so tough.

UszTrHi-o5TENb6nD1Bzug.review_text: Ah, Rogue. Being the beer geek that I am, I can't help but love Rogue beers for their selection and just general good quality. So why does nobody at their brewpub seem to give a fuck? Surely you could hire people who care about beer a little bit, I KNOW it's not that fucking hard because I know a lot of those people myself. Rogue is wasting a great space by not doing anything worthwhile with their outdoor patio and by not bothering to educate their employees about the beer they are selling. I am as dissappointed as you are, this could be a great spot.  Three stars for the GREAT BEER but buy it to go if you can.

OjvA0B76RI_p_nXB7a-ZbA.review_text: Very large number of taps although they all come from the same microbrewery in Oregon.  J.C. the bartender is quite friendly and helpful when trying to select a beer.  North Beach location makes parking a huge pain and no MUNI rail service either.

dmk-EAklM3BStINiFdTI6w.review_text: Still horrible service years later. We were ignored to order and ignored to pay. left some cash and left since no one would bring us our bill. Oh and by the way clean your bathrooms, seriously disgusting!

mE-hdFF4RgCxspZU72GAsw.review_text: I can't believe in 15 years this was my first time at this excellent local beer house. Located in a mellow part of North Beach, Rogue is a perfect place to start (or end) the evening. To immediately gain respect from the beer-tenders, opt for the 7hops IPA. Served with a smile, it's the real deal. Stay away from their sweet potato nachos because, well, you won't stop eating them, and then you'll regret it later because it's probably much worse for you than the beer. The beers go down quick here so be careful otherwise you may not remember the nice time you had here.

e6OJuu_w0pQ94kZl3qeIhQ.review_text: I stumbled upon this place in summer 09 when attending a conference and looking for a cool place to grab a beer after getting into SF.  I didn't eat here, but the beer selection is superb.  My favorite beer on tap here is the Lost Coast Great White.  Atmosphere was pretty chill and I also ran into a couple of cool guys who gave me some tips on other great restaurants and bars in the area.

TvHrgD6bBzE9Z9zchtPepg.review_text: Rude manager!!! We had a decent server, but when we gently reminded a staff member (who turned out to the mgr) that we needed silverware to eat the dinner set out in front of us, the manager responded, "We only have so many hands." His response and tone were unwarranted. They even forgot one order altogether. What a mess! They weren't even busy...

7Na1pUcEv3oF_QTRwZ-2iw.review_text: Very cool brew house.  I love the area that this place is located, and I love ROGUE ales!  Great flavor I tried when here was the VOODOO maple bacon donut also the peanut butter and chocolate flavor was interesting.  Great for groups but definitely can get crowded.

_q_MC7ebjDOCpX5Ec7TXEQ.review_text: Rogue has a huge selection of on tap beers, plus flights that you can try out for only $5 bucks! The bartender was super nice and kept giving our table free drinks...even though we weren't even seated at the bar! Our server was super nice as well & was our impromptu photographer for the night =)  The seating is plentiful and cozy so it's easy to make friends with your neighbors.  The food is your normal bar food, wings, fries, but they had these "kobe" slider burgers that were absolutely delicious! oh yum!! definitely try those out when your there!   Thursday nights are super fun because it's....TRIVIA NIGHT!!!!  Beer + Trivia = LOUD obnoxious fun! and prizes! if you win =) haha which we did not =P   This will definitely be someplace to go back to for a fun ladies night out!

F709hTh4pOIesjePhzi1aA.review_text: Did not eat here, but I enjoyed the beers.  I especially like how they had plenty of other brews on tap (not just Rogue Ales).  Nice variety.  I went there twice during my trip, and the bartenders were friendly and good.  This place is in a great location.  I will definitely visit again the next time I'm in San Francisco.

ssuWkMne1wQ6_WmxmXhl5Q.review_text: I'll start with the disclaimer that I am not a huge Rogue fan to begin with.  However, with that being said, I did enjoy my flight (Big Ass Braggot, Charlie 1981, Jasmine Mead and Brutal).  I think the flight came in around $8.00 or so.  The bartenders were helpful and accommodating but the atmosphere was just meh.  Definitely not their fault.   I didn't have the food but did check out their bottle selection.  Everything was way overpriced.  I could find each other those bottles in a store for less.  Doesn't make much sense to have bottles priced above market at your a brewery extension unless you don't intend on selling them.  Even though I only gave this place ***, I would return if I was with friends that wanted to grab a quick drink here.

PhAt76Bw5kVdEFfozawNtQ.review_text:
gotta love rogue, even if youre not a regular with your own little plaque at the bar.....goooood bar food (spinach-artichoke dip, french dip) and now they have all sorts of strange new "kobe" things on the menu (would you try something called kobe bleu balls?)
 but i'm not gonna lie, i'm here for the beer
 taster sets are a little obsession of mine, and here you can choose which ones you'd like....one problem- sometimes on busy nights they run out of the good stuff (no dead guy? nooooooooo) and sometimes the glasses are warm, which makes for not so cold beer. i think it might be a beer connoisseur thing, but i'm a food and drink temperature extremist, and i like my beer COLD
 but i have a soft spot for good ol' rogue, if anything it gets me out of the marina, which is enough

Y-INEv-QS9f7qJVDe5HjTA.review_text: Large selection of beers, feel free to ask for suggestions or a taste before ordering and the bar staff is knowledgable and helpful in finding the right beer to suit your palate.  I love the Buffalo Chips, steaming hot from the fryer, they are the perfect accompaniment with a cold beer on a chilly day. The atmosphere is pleasant and the people-watching from the windows is great. They have minimal specials, but the pricing is average for a good, well-made pint of beer.  The beer garden is back is a nice surprise on sunny days.

XgXeGLT_MXYVt9PoPtxr4g.review_text: Rogue is a must-do on Thursday nights for Trivia - always an awesome time. Waiters are attentive, beers are plentiful and filled quickly, food's totally decent (try the blue balls), and the crowd is fun.

d_Bg88z72HQXt89MnSQ33g.review_text: As a card carrying member* of Rogue Nation I expect better service.  Well, I expect better service even without the membership.  Food also sucked.  My tater tots were over -cooked and dried out. The lights were nice and bright, always so pleasing in a drinking establishment (sarcasm).  The beers were good.  I have been rudely informed I am not a card carrying member,  I guess the shite service was deserved.

DI7mg1oQHeUApMm-9Y-BGw.review_text: Contrary to the other reviews I see, for a San Francisco bar-  this place met my expectations. Perhaps they were not high but I've been to the Newport and Portland locations and this seemed par for the course.  The beer selection is yummy and semi extensive. I certainly love me some Shakespeare stout. I had a great cheesy artichoke dip outside in the beer garden with my friends and was content.   The server was nice and attentive for a place that was so packed people had to stand. It seemed to me that they were so busy the bartender and server were both distracted trying to help everyone- not snotty about it but just had a limited amount of energy to spend on each customer.   I came to drink beer, which I did, and it was good.

4AwA8QlK6NR4kMfyCvlrJw.review_text: Stumbled upon this place a few years back while visiting the Bay Area and was thrilled to see one of my favorite beers (Mocha Porter) on tap here.  Of course I went back on my most recent trip, but didn't even get to have a Mocha Porter... there were so many other amazing choices!  I started with the advertised Choco-Taco (Half chocolate stout, half chipotle ale).  I love spices and chocolate, so this beer definitely hit the spot.  The next time I went in, I tried the Hazelnut Brown, and the St. Rogue Red Ale.  Both were also very good.  The bartenders were great with suggestions, and the Celtic's game was on in the background,  which made for a great night :)

nbfyMmgqnxXIp7EDqTmkqw.review_text: I love Beer Cheese Soup. It's the perfect dip for bread, and ESPECIALLY for their Kobe Slider. Throw in a garden salad and you have a full balanced dinner!  Huge selection of beers and spirits- if you can't make up your mind, get a 4 beer tasting flight! You get to pick any of the 4 Rogue drafts and try them before making a decision on a pint, or you can continue on with the tasters and try them all!  There's a really good Single Malt Blonde Ale and a yummy Morimoto Soba Noodle beer. Next time I have to try the Chipotle Ale. Good selection of Apps at a decent price, big enough to share with your table and yummy.

CYudliQYtElHDn0UdGvPBA.review_text: Great atmosphere, awesome selection, a little expensive for me...but then again, that's SF right?

PAbcAfoz-MEZIk7IU7XYPw.review_text: I first befriended Dead Guy Ale on afternoons at Zeitgeist back in 2001/2002. When I finally opened my first bar and had to pick my taps, it made the cut. I've been a friend of Rogue since then and they've treated me really well, including the CEO, a crazy f#@*er if ever I met one. They are really into beer. Sure the purists will knock them for some cockamame (sp?) recipes, but I give them credit for trying new ideas, constantly. When you experiment you are bounded to fall on your face time and again, but it is the exceptions that make it worth doing. When you come up with an excellent new beer, it is a just reward for all of the flops. So go there, try the beers (they have great samplers) and get a Kobe burger. I too dinged them for the atmosphere, but the people make up for it. It's a tough room. I know because I almost bought it...and passed.

BJ7wlt-lwY6gqdpLBEtGLw.review_text: Rogue makes quality beers. I can't give 5 stars ONLY because I didn't get to try the food. Even as a person who doesn't really drink beer the guys were still friendly, welcoming, understanding, and helpful. The Beer Samplers are an AWESOME option at a good price. The music was original, no main stream club music. And its even pretty clean for a bar! We were thoroughly satisfied.

awIHeee0mCbn_44DQDJV1g.review_text: Just popped in for a couple of brews.  It was pretty packed but we were able to find a small table near the bar.  We are a little jealous that one of our favorite Oregon breweries has a pub in San Francisco & not in Los Angeles.  Whatever, on to the beer... I had the OREgasmic Ale & my husband had the Juniper Pale Ale.  We sat back, chatted & enjoyed our beers.  Cool spot.

qdCtPatYFJYmLnIW9G0xyQ.review_text: When I saw that this place only had a 3.5 star rating, I had to chime in.  The beer that is served here makes it the best bar I've ever been to.  Rogue beers are amazing, and having them on tap is nearly a religious experience.  If you're looking for some kind of a fancy dining experience, then go somewhere else, I guess.  But if you want some of the best beers in the world and good bar food, then you will not be disappointed.

u1tTJIA64qFlvWH0shNK2Q.review_text: Went mid-day and found it to be a relaxing and laidback environment. Staff was fine, could've been a bit more helpful. I had an amazing chipotle ale (had just a tiny kick to it) and a jasmine beer that tasted a bit like champagne (not my favorite, but she did warn me!). My family also got the mocha porter (delicious and rich!) and an imperial stout that was great! A nice midday beer rest-stop :) Oh, the battered shrimp appetizer went great with our brews. If you're looking for GREAT food, just head elsewhere..

a8wKua129w25q4wtP26p2g.review_text: We decided to stop in on a drizzly Sunday afternoon on a weekend trip up north. It was a beer themed weekend, where we visited a few breweries and such.  You'll be greeted by the stench of stale air as you walk in, you can either grab a seat by the door (which is propped open) or just let your nose get used to it. Seating was a little tough to find at 11 am on a Sunday.  We ordered a couple of flights of tasters, and the "bleu balls" which were kobe beef meatballs with bleu cheese. Delicious. I've been craving them since.  Service was good, the place is cramped, and a lil' bit hispter-ish. Oh and it was also "garage sale weekend" so we snagged a case of Dead Guy Ale for 28.00.

uiDYNRp-sScuSMIO5pKiXQ.review_text: Went here for trivia last night. Good beer, though they were out of stock of a bunch that I wanted to try.   We grabbed spinach artichoke dip at the beginning of trivia, anticipating that we would get another appetizer or two a little bit later, as trivia is a marathon and not a sprint. Really delicious and warm, but not huge- probably good for two or three people and no more. Our server didn't inform us that the kitchen was closing, so when we tried to order something else (it was only about 9:15 or 9:30) we couldn't.. bummer. If not for this, I would give Rogue 4 stars for sure.  Server (Tim) was never MIA and was knowledgable on the brews. He was cool and relaxed, never looked rushed but never took too long-- good fit for the atmosphere for sure.  Trivia was awesome (I might be saying this because I got a free beer- wooooo)- pretty tough but the system they use and the DJ were 4.5 stars out of 5. Lots of teams there, lots of competition, and a lot of fun. Definitely get there pretty early if you're looking to do trivia with a bunch of friends- it's tough to find a table and chairs for your trivia crew if you show up after 7:15/7:30.

h3Yg3OE9uD6XEAPyEm3qEQ.review_text: This is a rant - you've been warned.  This place is only getting 1 star for the beer... even though our waiter was nice, the bartender was incredibly rude (I'll get to that in a minute), it just wasn't enough to warrant another star since there's a good chance I won't ever come back here.  I came a here a few weeks ago with a friend in the middle of the afternoon on a Friday and we asked to do a beer tasting (you order 4 different beers and get them in smaller than usual cups) . Our waiter said sure, but before he could ask us what beers we'd like the bartender interrupted from the other side of the room to call him over and very loudly let him know that he couldn't do that because he didn't have enough of the tasting cups.   Seriously Rogue? Not enough tasting cups? Oh, people steal them and they break? Order enough tasting glasses to keep your barware appropriately stocked - you are running a bar that specializes in all things Rogue beer. Of course people are going to want to do tastings.   So our poor waiter came back over and told us that he was really sorry and they couldn't do the tasting... well, we took a few minutes to look at the beer menu. When our waiter came back, my friend asked if instead of the tasting glasses if we could just have tasting size portions in regular glasses (of which there were hundreds). So, our waiter proposed this to the bartender who again very loudly protested (obviously so we could hear how unhappy he was about it), but finally agreed though he adamantly told the waiter not to give us the tasting sheet because other customers would come in and want to do a tasting too and the place was about to get really busy (which it never did, and we left around 6pm).    Basically the bartender went out of his way to loudly complain about our order and make us feel uncomfortable. Luckily, our waiter was really nice or we probably would have just left without trying the beers we were really looking forward to having. The beers were great but unfortunately I won't come back for a while until maybe things have a chance to change. If I do walk in though and that same bartender is there I will definitely walk right back out.
