I'm sad to give Rogue only 1 star because there are a few things they could do to drastically improve and bring it up to 5 stars and an awesome place to hang out and have beer for hours. 1. get rid of the rude bartender and hire NICE people who understand that you are running a business and customer service is important to keep people coming back to spend their money at your establishment 2. print out the beer list of what's available each day. this place is huge and the only place you can read the beer list is on the chalkboard behind the bar. if something runs out, the waiter can let the table know of any last minute changes. 3. make sure you have enough things like glasses of all sizes...

VHtB9pjUN2uDkgQukKtJrQ.review_text: Wandered in here on a North Beach Pub and Restaurant Crawl. We ordered Bacon Bloody Mary's which were unique and good and onion rings which were just OK. Our waitperson was great-wish I remembered his name.

A7FNqfL30IjpcQ6fQffoOQ.review_text: Nice selection of Rogue as well as other microbrews. The food here is standard pub grub like wings, fries, and burgers (kobe beef) which are awesome. The service was helpful and friendly. In all the times I've been there I never noticed there was a back yard! I mean derrrrrr! How could I be so oblivious to something I would enjoy so much? Well I plan on making up for lost time and going more often.

RZJd7l-GyqHT24F7dQFT2w.review_text: The only reason why I give this place 5 stars (the best reason, I think, too) is for two words - EYE CANDY.  I haven't seen so many good looking dudes in one place (other than the Castro) since I've been here in San Fran. And that says a lot for a single, straight girl!  The guys here were HOT!  Maybe it was the North Beach Festival going on, maybe it was the USA/Italy game, but I think I'll hang out here more often - or maybe become more of a soccer fan!  I Didn't get to drink the beer because of the scenery. I did check out the outside patio which was cool for a sunny day.  Beware, girls, go to the bathroom before you get here. There are only 2- one in the front, and another in the back - and they are NASTY.  Oh, and yeah, the girls were very good looking too!

VqFKPuF3kjrmxonaKa9-ow.review_text: The beer is excellent as you probably guessed. Decent atmosphere. A lot of stalking for tables. Food was disappointing though. My expensive Kobe beef burger was clearly a frozen patty that couldn't be cooked to order (asked for rare, was served an overcooked shoe). You would think a place like this could offer better quality.  I recommend just drinking :)

knReN1F-2WbpQzyhElvnYQ.review_text: Rogue's has a huge amount of space. Plenty of options for drinking your face off and is pretty convenient to get to.  I was there on a Saturday night with my husband. We sat at the bar and the service was great. Prices were reasonable and the two different pilsners I had were delicious.   My husband tried a whiskey and it smelled and tasted like Tequila, weird.  The only off putting thing about the place is that it feels like a college bar, but then you look around and everyone has to be about 30+. Just an observation.

7gGYXm7f2XZ39yGK3PsFkw.review_text: ehhh kinda bummed out cause I heard lots of good things about this place. They were really busy the night we showed up, tuesday I think? Which I was told is odd. Anyways! I wanted a sampler, been wanting one for weeks, really jazzed over it but the guy was like NO I am not doing another sampler sorry! I was like ok great whatever. The music sucked too, they were playing shibby rock slow put me to sleep shib. All the waiter did was complain. We made it super clear to take his time, we are in no rush. but still no sampler for us, and I sat there watching other waiters bringing out samplers. f that dude. Also, waiter said he saw us sitting outside waiting at a table but he was all NO I am not coming to you!

1Ft_pnYQ6B7BMd94Q6fffg.review_text: As you can tell, I don't write many reviews, but Katie earned a 5-star mark for her effort to take such good care of us during a party we had at Rogue this wknd.  The outstanding beer and great pub food speak for themselves, but her attention to service was key.  Will be back pronto.  Thanks.

z5SZnvVRhUdUmSrX-xnhZg.review_text: This is a late review but I use to live in NorthBeach about 3 months ago, so I thought I'd give my 2 cents.   1) Food - 4 out of 5 stars The food is pretty good for a bar, I would have given it 3 stars but there is something particularly good about the french fries. Maybe its just me, but I came back mostly because of the seasoned french-fries.  2) Beer - 5 out of 5 stars If you a beer connoisseur and you have the extra few bucks to get a good beer, then you will like Rogue. They have a very nice selection of beer and the bar-tenders, from my experience, are very knowledgeable about the details of the beer.    3) Service- 3 or 4-ish out of 5 The service, admittedly, can be hit or miss. The best server I had was some punk-ish girl who told me once that she was going to SFSU for a psychology degree. Sometimes other servers can be a little slow getting to you (especially if you are not sitting at the bar and just walk in and sit down at a table). Also, as a heads up if you DO sit down at the table and order something I would suggest NOT walking up to the bar and ordering beer or another item. This makes this ring up two different bills, and then its just more confusing and annoying for both you and them when it comes paying for everything.

3cnIyELXdZa9C9nFH5NXtg.review_text: It was a warm SF night and discovered this place walking around North Beach. Well I saw that there was an outdoor patio and insisted we needed to go.  As with most dive bars it has that built in spilled beer and liquor smell, but the place was big, although the main room was a bit cramped.  The side room was more roomy.  The patio was really nice and a great place to hangout and drink on a hot night, but too bad it closes at 10, at which point everybody goes inside the hot stuff bar area.    Large selection of beer on tap and a small but good selection of liquor (especially if you like whiskey).    I would come back on another warm SF night.

lb0PUiJ6SEp8Wydo3soEeA.review_text: Its the beer. Thats it. Seriously, Rogue's got a big selection of good brews and plenty of tables for you and your pals to down several pints. When you walk into Rogue its like any pub but with sunlight. Nothing new or unique about Rogue.   Every time I go in, its the same thing: the staff is ok to absent, the food is below average. Every so often I get a warm glass with my beer. There nothing to recommend, every item tastes like it was frozen and given 5 min in the fryer or microwave. But thats not why you're there, down a few pints, I'm sure the food will seem much better.  Rogue could be really good, add real food and you could have something really solid, but thats not what they're about. Good beer and selection gets the two stars. Honestly, its a good place to get drinks and meet with friends before you start your weekend night.

ajD8zStXcbZLoCGX8XhqPg.review_text: Good selection of beers but I didn't have the food so I can't comment on that part. What I can say was the afternoon bar tender was on his game. He was the only server in the entire bar and he was easily out numbered 40:1. Running food to tables, pouring numerous beers, and still finding time to give samples and explain the styles. Overall a great experience and I look forward to going back in the future.

TqbCxAazP2LOHDB6yXH5JA.review_text: Cool Place To Chill And Have A Beer

-Ox9xMII04O381mFX-JSBw.review_text: Beers are definitely not bad.  Some breweries in Little Italy have beers tasting like water or pi$$ sometimes but this place does have good beers.  I personally like it although their atmosphere has nothing special.    The bartenders here are nice as well - if you are thinking what to get, then they will let you taste some of their beers.  Cool!

_UOoOxOYe9ljXwzORgPgoQ.review_text: Grunt...Grunt...  Beer good!  Food bad!  scratch...scratch...

eurIEcpGa_tTi1LMWa1pUA.review_text: Outdoor seating (in both the beer garden out back and on the sidewalk) + more beers on tap than you can shake a stick at = happiness.  This place is great. It's a wonderful place to drink, but I have to be careful. Too much fun here makes the girl mad because I lose track of time and don't go home on time. Then dinner is cold. :(  Speaking of dinner, they have food here, and it's OK. They have a nice variety.  The space inside is a vast one, with high ceilings and a pre-1906 aire about the place. I like.

lC8HWvXejW01Xegf5J_czg.review_text: I have to give Rogue 4 stars because it is unique. It's a great place to go if you want a beer you haven't had before. On many occasions I've found myself sitting at the bar on a Saturday afternoon sipping chocolate stout. Just make sure you stay away from the Chipotle Ale...blah!

DYyD1OUCZj3Lo4zW-coeZg.review_text: I previously gave Rogue a glowing review as I held several large group events there.   After almost three years of incredible service and a friendly staff with little turnover, the GM left and the lead waitress was fired. I didn't know them personally so while it was sad that no one would know our group we were optimistic. Then they double booked us, twice.  Two months after we canceled our reoccurring events I received a call from "Ryan" who wanted to follow up with me to see why my group hadn't been in for a while. I told him about the double bookings (the back room was booked to us- a boardgame group, and a college reunion group- it was awkward). He said the turnover issues were over and they would love a second chance.   So we took their word for it and went back. It.. was... awful.. Although I confirmed the reservation the week before and the day before they were clueless when we arrived. No extra staff, and 20-45 minutes between drinks.   Then the waitress told us she needed to clean the backroom so she could leave by 12am. It was 9:30. WTF? I told her I always had the room until midnight, and a few us of from the group always stayed to help clean the room and we collected tips for the bar before everyone left, that's why we've always had such a great relationship with them. Hell, the old guys even served those of us who stayed to help well after close, they were our neighborhood place and we turned it into our little nerd bar. Over three years I held 20-30 events there that averaged 60+ to 200+ (in and out, this place is not that big).   Anyway, the waitress told me "the manager would "tell me". (it was a threat). She then went to the bar and told him that I said "we were going to stay after close and didn't care about policies" She didn't realize I was behind her when she said this and came back and told me that he said " we better leave now and they didn't want nerdie types there as that is not their desired demographic", That was not what he said. But I didn't care at that point. At that point I started asking my group to leave, and told them not to tip.

BdIGjFOQ2aQ-Eo8VlQEjEQ.review_text: -- Rogue Haiku Trilogy --  Food tastes like cardboard! Never knew what that was like, Until Rogue's bleu balls  Pub quiz drop outs flock, At Rogue they feel smarter; I'm off to Mad Dog  Beers are pretty good Their only Yelp 2-star save, but no good wheat brew

s3VekgpxQ_Ryxqu1QtScEg.review_text: Awesome stop in San Francisco. In-house brewed beer and their own cheese, combined with a great location and chill environment = 4 stars. I will note that they may overhype their Kobe burgers, which - although bomb, weren't anything to write home about. However, the menu has a pretty good assortment of tasty items - and if you're in the mood to stop and grab a bite and a beer or two, check it out. They have a back patio area and accomodate large groups nicely. Crystal was barraged by our disoriented clique and handled her server duties very well. Props'

DgjHA9zexvzZgyHO_GZjLw.review_text: Good beer, friendly and speedy staff, dog-friendly beer garden...Rogue hit the spot on a sunny Sunday afternoon!

Bx1iLCgUyu4HPepkYut4Uw.review_text: I love Rogue! One of my favorite neighborhood bars. The atmosphere is casual, hipstery, but not pretentious. This is place is fun early in the evening before going out as well as late into the night. I've noticed some people complaining about the service in their reviews, but the time I did sit at a table (I usually prefer the bar) I had great service. Our server - Logan - gave great beer recommendations and made sure we were having a good time. Overall cool place, no complaints...

sBwkkmAr8t0H64sqtr33fg.review_text: Two words: Crusty vomit. This rating is just for the bar as a poor North Beach Neighbor. I live in the neighborhood and walk past it every day. They'll leave piles of garbage outside on the sidewalk for days (probably until someone else in the neighborhood takes the responsibility and moves it.) and let's talk about the dried puke on the sidewalk. Really? How about at the end of the night they clean the bar AND hose the sidewalk?. I'm tired of having to navigate crusty vomit on my walk to work. You don't see that outside any other neighborhood bar.

zI7IOFz-GEz-4QWDnfWREg.review_text: This is my direct stop for Portland brewed beers in the Bay Area. They always have a good selection of their own beers, plus other good craft beers(even my own) on tap as well! The service can be a touch slow for food, but the beers never slow down and the food is worth the wait.  MY ONLY WARNING, THE VOODOO MAPLE AND BACON DONUT BEER IS GOING TO TASTE AS IF YOU HAVE PUREED A DONUT AND ARE DRINKING IT. I didn't order it, my friends did, and I tried to warn them, brewers will only call it what it is.

J_ZY3YDkAVzEEYxvthozCw.review_text: Outdoor bar! Outdoor bar + trivia = WIN.  The beer here was pretty solid but what I love here is the atmosphere.  It reminded me of a college bar with the chill vibe, friendly patrons (think post college/grad school Cheers types) and close to public transit.  -1 star for college bar bathroom.  Thank god I do yoga so I can squat.

p-8vlScJDlYfmDQoKAmshg.review_text: I've been here three times and never had the taster tray. Save yourself the trouble and try this the first time you visit. It's such a good deal. For $8.42 you get to sample four different beers. Perfect for someone that drinks slow and enjoys every last drop. You get to pick which four you want to try, or if you're trusting, have the bartender pick for you based on what you like.   I had the following:   1. Orgasmic ale (oregonasmic ale)- This one is part of the grow your own Chatoe Rogue series. Everything is sourced in Oregon for this ale and that's why they called is Orgasmic, although I think "Oregonasmic" is more fitting. It was a bit bitter for my taste but it was OK.  2. Sig's red IPA- I don't remember much from this one but I enjoyed it more than the first one. It was less bitter and a little more smooth.   3. Shakespeare oatmeal stout (nitro)- This one was rich and thick and sort of chocolaty. I was told by JP that this is what Guinness wishes it tasted like. They add nitrogen instead of CO2. It's good. Drink it slow.  4. Mocha porter- this one was similar to the stout but it wasn't as thick. It was my favorite although I did enjoy each beer progressively more, which leads me to believe that maybe I was just getting more inebriated.   If you like beer, stop by Rogue (not to be confused with Rouge).   BTW, JP is awesome. He is the bartender that helped us out and he was very knowledgeable about the beers and made great recommendations.  Lastly, they serve food here but you have to get here early. Ask them to pair the food with your beer.

W7l29DDa3d3uqPE1f68JGQ.review_text: Five stars for the Kobe Beef Burger.  They call it the world's greatest for a reason.  Keep the party under four if you're ordering food (quality suffers).  A couple good beers, lots of mediocre.  Carry-out service (22 oz bottles).

wJnDMAz_FlUkGQn6EMp2Bw.review_text: Most of the times I've been in there (generally when it's not even busy!!!) the bartenders seem to want to do anything but serve me a beer: chatting it up with other patrons, staring off into space, or plotting about how to further ignore me, all take presedence over serving me (and therefore getting my $, my happiness, my nic e yelp review).

SZq4WeQXRFkU5JtesPjVkg.review_text: Great beers and good atmosphere.  Sampler flights are a good way to go.  Also, they have jenga.

lC66L0GETHVoM3X011Q6Sw.review_text: Ambiance 2.5 stars  - kinda dingy, lots of folding tables & chairs...I'm not sayin' that's bad, I'm just sayin' you're not going to impress anyone you bring here.  Food 4.5 stars - Bomb-tastical.  Good burgers (with great cheese), good appetizers, great beer (& beer selection).  Price - 3 stars - not cheap, not expensive  Service - 3 stars - totally unpredictable.  They're always cool, but their not always very motivated  I've been here 3 times.  Gotten the fish & chips once (above average) and the cheeseburger twice (best in the area, including Mo's)

5gbkhlWANGVzQYi_0m3vOQ.review_text: The beers here were nothing impressive (but I only judge based on the Hefeweizen or equivalent Belgium Beer).   The place also smells funny, and not in a good way.

AM8s4g3NafOfjrGkGCrNiw.review_text: I was in a cab in San Francisco headed into Little Italy when I spotted the distinctive Rogue logo in the corner of my eye. I realized immediately that it was a Public House and told the driver to stop right away. I didn't know at the time that this is the only such establishment in the state of California, so we were lucky to come across it. They were out of my favorite offering, Dead Guy Ale, when I got there, but that was just before midnight on a Wednesday so I understand. Not to worry, they have many many more to choose from. If you like Rogue Ales, craft beer, or having fun, I highly recommend stopping in.

DvcAC_nlKaTDsHcA8Slagw.review_text: Rogue Ales used to be such a treat back in VA when you were cruising the beer aisle at my local Kroger. As such I was excited to have Rogue Ales Public House in my neighborhood when I first moved here.   Now the beers do not disappoint in terms of variety. From the go-to dependable American Amber to more unique brews like the Morimoto (as in the Iron Chef) Soba Ale, Rogue Ales Public House has plenty of taps to delight. In fact, I think they have around 40 taps I believe. Food is standard pub fare but you can get a pretty decent burger here that will stand up to the brews.   Service here can be spotty especially when it gets crowded. However, if all you want are beers, the patio of Rogue Ales Public House is perfect especially on a sunny SF day.

WiBPLt5wnY87yH-Bjg_Gqg.review_text: You go to Rogue for the beers. The food was decent, but nothing to write home about. As for the alcohol selection, top notch.  Best Non-California based brewery in the Bay Area. They are originally from Oregon.  - $$  - Dry Hop St. Rogue Red and the Dead Guy Ale are two great brews if you like a lot of hops in your beer.   - $6 Pints   - Over 20 Rogue beers plus another 20 or so other micro brews  - Pub style food, nothing stood out

5qgJTus1l35A6bqW2fFk0w.review_text: Came here after dinner in North Beach last weekend to grab a flight of beers and just hang out.  The bartender was a cheerful guy with recommendations on beer, as one of our choices was not available.  The hazelnut brown was soo delicious & the ale's weren't bad either.  We were not a fan of the oatmeal stout at all, but that may just be a personal thing.   Wasn't the best brewery I have been to, but wasn't bad either.  I would go back with friends if I was in the neighborhood.

SRSmzTPA2dX2Zpfa2uE4sA.review_text: Stopped in here with a big group. I liked this place, cool atmosphere, easy to chat and meet ppl - not too loud or crowded. Also had a patio outside, which looked sketchy, but it's nice to have some room outside. I started with a Rogue beer, the Beard something - I like flavorful wheat beers and this one was okay. Kobe Chili: suggested by my server. This was some great chili, flavorful with a nice little kick. You should definitely try it.

henDqMyd5F1K6jBnHTrYqQ.review_text: Come with friends and grab a table and a pint at this southernmost outpost of the Rogue Ales Public Houses. They serve about 40 different brews, half which are Rogue and half from other craft breweries.  Their Hazelnut Brown Nectar, Mocha Porters and Chocolate Stouts (double and non-double) are delicious, and I feel relieved to know I can get this stuff by the bottle in NY.

sNwZ_u22NdTGyAxHhTM_Yg.review_text: This place is great. One of the best selections of IPAs anywhere. They always have a great selection of diverse beers from everywhere. . The bartenders are friendly and remember the patrons. And believe it or not the food is delicious. Always an upbeat vibrant diverse crowd. On my trips to San Francisco I never fail to stop here several times a week. Some friends around the country always refer to sitting outside at the rogue and people watching. Another favorite at their outdoor tabls overlooking washington park.

An9YDbyGDD58y4tQJQPwMQ.review_text: yes, amazing distinct beers! yes, great location/kosher setting, yes decent reasonably priced food (it's pub food, no big deal).....but the buck stops there. I am big on service, maybe other yelpers are not but I am.   No need to lie, I can be frugal when it comes to tipping especially during these troubling economic times, however, if I am satisfied with friendly, efficient service I am up to splurge a bit.   ...but a certain D-bag at this place apparently does not know the meaning of proper customer service. As a patron, I do not like having to ask twice for Tabasco sauce and not receiving it while my sandwich is getting cold by the second. Nor do I appreciate when everyone at my table has their beers minus one because our so called "waiter" is momentarily preoccupied with scratching his ass. I also do not like the fact the appetizer is brought out during the dessert portion of the meal rather than prior to the meal.  And last but not least , I hate it when the D-bag hipster "waiter " with plastic fake Ray Bans comes after our group and complains the $5 tip was not good enough (granted, it was a $90 bill but the service SUCKED LIKE NO OTHER.) The hipster than whines about "losing money" on our table! Excuse my french, but screw that asshole!   I have been a waiter before and no doubt lousy tips suck but you have to put forth some effort to earn a decent tip. Either way, you are getting paid hourly though the tip is not obligatory but rather a nice gesture. You give what you can, I mean Rogue is by no means Spruce. Sometimes I envy the European restaurant service, at least you know you are getting bad service beforehand so you are not expected to leave a tip AND if you do, it is only spare change.    Dbag hipster waiter with long hair and fake Ray Bans ruined my Rogue experience. I am obviously bitter. Hope he doesn't get you as well.

ZAIgiXXv-IJZiG3ns6rlYQ.review_text: Was walking my way up towards North Beach and stumbled upon this place unexpectedly.  I have had and enjoyed Rouge beer before and noticed the logo on the sign outside and had to check it out.  It was about what you would expect as far as pubs go.  Great beer selection, bar tenders were good and knowledgeable.  Pricing was very reasonable.  Only complaint is that there were not enough TVs to make it a good hang out to watch some sports..

TEMM4rXJeNMi5WUAu9EdUg.review_text: I like their beer, but this place is dirty. Really dirty. And the service is, meh.  Someone needs to deep clean the bathroom.

EoqbPV9lqqB_z6z9Vv8x5Q.review_text: what an awesome place.  dozens of amazing draft beers and friendly bartenders who will talk your head off about them.  they serve plenty of great variations on typical bar items (kobe chili, brutal reuben, kobe bleu ball sandwich), but why would you waste stomach real estate on food when you could have so much beer?

S2n6Av5Id6nExA9qyDwIPw.review_text: The beers are pretty good, but the waitress we had was not pleasant. It wasn't that busy but yet she kept rushing us to order and was very rude when we asked questions. Halfway through our order she left saying she'd come back with paper so we could write our order down ourself. Not going back after that experience.

8rB8Ar3uF9KBZ1OkojOB_A.review_text: Slow service, incorrect check that needed to be adjusted, beers sloshed over the sides when served and not served with coasters so the table got wet, and possibly the WORST fish and chips recipe I've ever encountered.  I LOVE Rogue beers, but I would not return after this visit.

2Z4Csqpo4KoMXtFv23QzUQ.review_text: Really top notch beers.  Best I've had in town. Don't like the food? Go somewhere else.  Great service, great outcast vibe.

LnZUtFx6qTWs8NV6lAARxQ.review_text: There's usually plenty of seating and lots of beers to choose from.  We went here this past Saturday and the service was quick.  My only advice is to skip their Smoked Ale - it has too much of a smokey flavor and lacks the ale elements IMHO.  Their Hazelnut Brown is as sweet as a dessert and mighty tasty!

82dCHyU-ANOgdhxUgZsUeg.review_text: I had already drank a lot of fluids right before coming here so my experience is not 100% recollect-able. At any rate, any legit alehouse is at the top of my list of places to be so I'm happy I stumbled into this joint with my friends. I really wanted to try the donut beer in the pink bottle but they didn't have it on tap so I decided to get whatever else they had on tap while I was there since I could get the bottled stuff anytime/anywhere. If you don't already know, whenever you ever order a beer and it's available to you on tap, you must get the tap because it should better contain the true taste and intention of the brewer. They also serve some good food here. I remember I had a chili dog that was gone in a couple minutes (because I ate it fast). If you're in North Beach, then Rogue Ales Public House should be a priority visit, among the many other great places down the street.

LaNXfiMDjMib2NhK4BE7-Q.review_text: Rogue gave me writer's block.  So after a bit of thought, here's how I'd sum it up:  It's unique, but lacks in execution and details.  It's got some decent food options, but they are pricey.  It's got a ton of beer options, but there's no drink menu, so you'd better hope you can read the chalkboard posted by the bar (unfortunately we weren't even in the same room).  It was dimly lit, but not in a sexy way. Think Round Table Pizza.  It took 15 minutes for someone to come greet our table. I was beginning to think we didn't exist. There was also no explanation of the menu specialties or the beer options, which would have been welcomed, seeing as how the majority of us had never been there before. Couple this with the no drink menu issue and we felt like we were covering our eyes and ordering whatever our finger happened to land on.  As it turns out, you should definitely order the bleu cheese balls or bleu cheese sliders. They saved the day and made me forget about the awful chicken tenders I made the mistake of ordering. Their french fries (which they charge extra for) are bland and made me wish I was at Red Robin eating a basket of their crack-dusted steak fries. Which reminds me, Rogue's ranch tasted bottled, and costs an extra 50 cents.   Any place that charges for condiments isn't looking too promising, especially when you need them to spice up their bland offerings.  We went out of our way to come here, when I'd say it's definitely more of a "Wow! We're starving an are only a block away!" type of place.

dim5Svrt-B1jvvQsOIX22A.review_text: I've been here a few times now and have tried a variety of the beer. Trivia night is always fun, but a few bad apples tend to get there early to horde the seats and tables. Nevertheless it's a fun venue for that.   Coming in for drinks is ok. Service is scattered and slow. Can take awhile to get service as well as return service for additional rounds or the check. Patio is nice on a lazy weekend afternoon especially if the sun is making an appearance.   I'll agree with another reviewer in that the Voodoo Donut varietals are kind of weak and gimmicky. Overpriced for what they are.

t76Rs-fgL1uD422d77PL1g.review_text: Decent bar to hang out w/ friends where you can actually talk to them w/o yelling over music.  Wide selection of beers, but definitely consult the bartender before you order

dfYNTBw--CYlZbFz581kYQ.review_text: Good beer, a neat outdoor area, and fun trivia (though too tough for me!) but the bartender didn't have any of the supplies for a bloody mary which was a big disappointment to me. I haven't had their food but the fries looked pretty good... I usually just stop by here rather than spending a full night but the beers are fun to read about on the big chalk board and all sound good! Guess I shouldn't be expecting good cocktails at a beer joint...

TSdV_lsddT4F3TJvmdmXag.review_text: All things considered, Rogue, I'll give you four stars and we can totally still hang out.  But I won't come back for your food.  When I ate here a couple years ago, I seem to recall that your burgers and fries were pretty decent.  This time, not even close.  I've been craving a burger, but what I got was bacon-topped cardboard.  And my +1's pulled-pork-sliders?  Ew.  He ordered "pulled pork," not "cold pork."  Okay, fine, you've changed; we've both changed.  HOWEVER - your beer is delicious, the selection extensive; Thursday night trivia is fun, and your servers are great at working with big crowds of people (many with popped collars or super Marina-style blondies).  You get a star just for Dead Guy and Hazelnut Brown alone.  I like coming here in the early afternoons, when hardly anyone is around.  Then it becomes a prime spot for North Beach people watching and beer-sipping.   (Also, who am I kidding?  My bedtime is 9pm; most drinking I do is bound to be in the afternoon.)  Come Thursday night at 8pm, however, it is ON.  The only thing I like better than drinking beer and playing trivia is drinking beer and winning trivia, which indeed we did (go team I Went To Sea World And All I Got Was This Bloody Poncho!).     But next time, I'm eating somewhere else first.

ZfGuzxGb9TUp_MfXeOSkOw.review_text: Staff is terrible, service does not exist. We stopped here for a drink on our way walking to our hotel. Bartender asked me for my ID and made a comment under his breath about us being from San Diego, CA. It was clearly written on his name tag that he was from Apple Valley, CA. Please explain how you can make fun of people from San Diego when you came from Apple Valley. Other bartender was grumpy and did not talk, he then named out table "Dummy" on his Aloha computer screen. I know it was our table name and not his computer ID, because I watched him enter it onto the screen and I have used these systems for 8 years as a bartender. Drinks were overpriced, bar is a hole in the wall, and food (from couple next to us) overpriced as well, about 6 onion rings for $9. Would never return.

bG6DkJKwhKMMQ0Z3GSOpmA.review_text: Sunday afternoon, post-BYOBW (which was NUTS, by the way), I headed down to Rogue on my bike & met up with a bunch of fellow big wheel-watchers for a few pints in their bright, sunny back courtyard.  My roommate just got herself a dog, & they just so happen to keep gourmet pet treats (which look very much like cookies, so beware) back there. How convenient! The bartenders were informative about what type of Rogue beverage we should consume, & the other patrons were friendly & talkative. Overall, it was a great place to spend a few hours on a Sunday afternoon.

WfePuaS_iXGNGU6bfDe3JQ.review_text: Okay, sooo....Rogue is like this...You either love or hate their beer. Personally, I only like a few of their beers, most of them just taste gimmicky to me.  Why the four star then? The selection of the other beers they offer is awesome. The day that I went they had Racer X IPA on tap, one of my favorite hard to find beers. They had a few other rare beers on tap as well, though I can't recall their name as the night went downhill quickly.  The bartender was friendly and offered several good selections to my girlfriend. Rogue is also a good place to hang out and meet friends.

YDFRtvQCQ9hehuKE2BEQCQ.review_text: The outdoor patio was wonderful on a warm morning.  Thank you to the bartender who checked on my question of "Is the Chocolate Peanut Butter Banana beer in the take home bottles vegan?"  He went and checked the ingredients and confirmed yes, it is vegan.  Thank you so much !!!

JHxA-sVxxy0sMmEOIpxbkg.review_text: Last Saturday I had a good time here. I sound lame by saying I haven't been here (if i had gone I was probably blacked). Anyways, we were pseudo kicked out of our friends party temporarily on saturday day, and decided to swing on by after receiving a call from our buddies inside. The last place I wanted to be at that point in time was to be inside. Rogue's outside standing area fit the bill. The weather wasn't the best, but with the crowd and the great atmosphere, I couldn't have asked for a better location. I love beer and their IPA was perfect. Anyhow, good brew+outside seating=can't go wrong...

isQxsxlCjj6P8GQ_uuFwew.review_text: Came here with my coworkers on a team outing.  They set us up in the back room with some veggies, wings, and chips.  The "wings" were really chicken strips with hot sauce on them but they were good.  The patio in the back was cool and I enjoyed the hazelnut stout. I tried the jalapeno beer and ended up being it to a stranger because I took two sips and could not drink it - it tasted horrible.

yCIDLnM5petEyTacGU4CwQ.review_text: The only reason that this place got two stars is because of the quality of their beers. Its a really confused Ruby Tuesday's and the set up is pretty wack..  Beer lovers go have one or two, not whole night. But choc stout on tap is on point. BUT, if you go to the outdoor beer garden outback which they should hype up a bit more, is very nice. Go out there and have your beer, better experience.

xyNdK7m0i1Y4pb4gJicA6g.review_text: Nice bar on a sunny day, as it has a beer garden out back with picnic tables and umbrellas where you and your group can drink your beer in the sun. Doggies are welcome there. Inside the interior is a touch elegant with its dark woods and brass, yet laid back with its dressed down 20s-30s North Beach pubbers, and spacious.  The problem is, the beer itself is hit or (lots of ) miss. It's good if you are already a fan of Rogue Ales, or are adventurous and like to taste various brews. But even then you have to consider the possibility that you will happen to be there on the day or night that they are serving pints too cold, too warm, or stale.  The food, while at times generous in portions, is pretty crap too. It's not advisable to try anything on the menu outside of the standard fried bar dishes. Beware, the clam chowder was not New England as it claims, and it tasted like someone knocked a salt shaker into the pot. "Served with bread" really means there will be a pitiful slice of toasted garlic bread placed next to the bowl when they bring it.

91h4n2W-pbrtmEy5ADUM0Q.review_text: I'm a big fan of good brew houses, and this is the best place in my neighborhood.  The burgers are really good too.  They have some old games too, just ask.  I last played Stratego with my girlfriend over some chocolate stout.  Thank me for assembling all the pieces.  I think there is just one missing, maybe a number 5.

q5afJ8gTV5TPEOkzyeJ_WQ.review_text: visit: 7/8/11 Walked from 21st Amendment Brewery. On this day we walked around 10 miles total,this was on the way. My feet hurting with blisters on top of blisters, I figured a few beers would help numb them! They have quite the extensive list on top. We each had a couple full size beers, then two rounds of tasters. I loved Morimoto Soba, chipotle ale, and buckman village ginger. Would return in a heartbeat. I love a place with so much on tap!

yPg0ay4ANuoGj_Ur8E4bZQ.review_text: Best beer around!  Hamburgers are great too.  Can't get enough of this place.  Has a community environment, can always count on meeting outgoing, laidback people there.  Not only is the beer delicious, it comes in fun bottles!  Definately reccomend it!

VfAKTux35iMcOYPthkg6dA.review_text: Very helpful bar  Plenty of room to hang and have a great beer outside or in.   Loving it and enjoy the day.   How freaking rad is this place?  Come in in the city and enjoy yourself.    I am loving this spot.   Love it and coming back for sure. Next time and I staying for a longer time.

FHD0yf0gSsQT9Or0FLi07w.review_text: 10/10 Chris awesome points. The highest standard of achievement I have to offer an establishment. I'm going to make a cardboard plaque for you guys.  If you had a bad beer here, that means you were too shy to ask the bartender for samples... you realize that this place is an embassy to one of the nation's best microbreweries and the kicker is that Rogue actually located in Oregon and they have a big HQ pub in Eugene, OR. They were just generous when they planted this place in SF for us folks.  Food I didn't even bother with based on these reviews but I drank my fill. I drink for the taste and to develop a palette (I sound like a douche) not necessarily to get sloshed on a Sunday night.. (lol)  Afterwards I totally raided the merchandise area with my friend. They're totally out of sizes due to how popular this place is with hop-heads (beer enthusiasts) but HEY I CAN SHRINK AN XL DOWN TO A LARGE RIGHT GUYS?!  Thank you for the amazing beer which oddly enough I can go down to Whole Foods and buy, but I just had to go here with a friend an hour away from home just to see it and it would have been worth it if there were no bartenders or beers on tap just to see what a Rogue bar would be like....  Now if only we can get a Dogfish Head pub in SF/SJ/Santa Cruz we'd be golden...  PS. Drink everything. I literally mean a little bit of everything they have on the board. You don't want to leave the pub before doing that. I literally mean sample everything and tip the bartender extra extra if you need to. Rogue is incapable of making a bad beer, even if I drink outside my comfort zone with stuff I don't normally like.  They have other high profile beers from other breweries on tap but my vision was blurry from all the stuff I'd have to special order from bevmo fresh on tap.

pplRPxVZ8iWt4QaUlLo6DQ.review_text:
I'm not really into the 'served-at-fancy-temperatures' gourmet beers, and the atmosphere is pretty naff, but the burgers .. oh man, the burgers .. the bacon and cheese Kobe beef burgers here are carried entirely on the flavour of the beef and less so on the other ingredients, but that flavour carries them so far and so high, highly highly recommended.
  I'm very glad it's so far away, or else I would most surely die of beef poisoning.

wpI3AQvA5kxp-moP46m8NA.review_text: 4 Stars. Two stars for beer garden and two for food :).  I have only been there two times.  First time on a wintry night for a birthday party....it was ok.  Second time beautiful SF day, discover beer garden and food.  Happy camper!

mZokz37TaR5jFgMrx4WyFw.review_text: My only visit here was during the World Cup finals (mainly to watch the debauchery on Columbus...ITALIA!), and I don't know if I'd return.  Of course, the place was packed.  But our server forgot to put in our order, then tried to double charge us, and then "forgot" to give us our change.  They didn't have a lot of beer in stock (even though they advertised the game), but their Rogue Lager is pretty good.  And hell, just give me a little beer and I'll add a star to your review.

L-De2VOtv2B79r0K1sPsPw.review_text: We went here for the beer (we're big fans of Rogue), and we weren't disappointed ... until it came to the food. Don't get me wrong -- it wasn't horrible, but it was certainly forgettable. The Kobe burger with blue cheese was really nothing to write home about and not worth the $13 or so we paid for it, and the bun was so stale, I wondered why they served it. We were happy with the service, though. Our server knew a lot about beer, made some good recommendations, was friendly, and made sure we were happy with our choices. I'll go back again for the beer, but next time I'll skip the food, as there are much better options in the neighborhood.

Fb4IkSuAmEchILfkAUswsA.review_text: For being such a fairly large microbrewery, the restaurant/bar was nothing special. It had the feel of just an older bar in SF. It wasn't terrible, but it was by no means anything special. I probably won't go back, just because there was nothing memorable here. Maybe I was too sober when I got there and it was kind of packed. However, it was just packed right at the bar and in the very back. There were a ton of table open, but everyone was congregating around the perimeter of this place.  In all fairness, I wasn't drinking the beer. Instead I was going for vodka drinks. If I had their beers, my review could be completely different.

QwIkbYgUlInFzuelaOvxOg.review_text: This is where I go to further my studies in malted hoppy goodness. JJ the bartender is great at picking beers from Rogue's proprietary selection as well as their amazing guest taps (Moonlight and Russian River) to name a few. As for their food, I have never tried anything, but for their beers they get a 5.

ov9G-Mn1XGFp6m8sFEmEng.review_text: We walked 15 blocks to Rogue for some much anticipated beer. After tasting in Oregon we never made it to Rogue. Luckily there is a San Francisco location.  Welcoming feel and good people. Only problem was we couldn't order a sampler because they had given out too many already and didn't have glasses. It was so disappointing. We ordered two different pints and waited around. Even after other people were finished we weren't asked if we still wanted one or if they could put the beer in different glasses/cups, etc.   It just didn't seem like anyone was willing to go even a little out of their way to showcase the beer at Rogue. I still want to go back because I feel like I still don't know the beers Rogue produces. Well see.

Xj0O2l0bp633ebmG468aZw.review_text: OK place. It does attract douchebags (like so much of North Beach). Some dude just randomly approached me and was like - I like your sweater. I replied, "thank you". He repeated himself. I told him "Would you like to buy it?" He replied, "I really like it." That pretty much sums up the clientele. The beer was good, but I'd prefer a Mission crowd any day.

NhHgulkfIPnCqO0vyzne2w.review_text: Rogue is really a brewery for true beer lovers, and the Public House has the most extensive selection of Rogue brews I've seen in one place. I'm willing to overlook the shortfalls in ambiance in order to drink such well-crafted brews.

uO_yDmbYGbRd6kGQO4S4hA.review_text: Loved this place.  It reminds me of some of my other favorite pubs that I've been too.  Solid venue and greet beer list.  We just happen to get their on quiz night.  Rocks that they have this.

oD8PrAO_GUtlFNFv4ZUY9g.review_text: Went here during Beer Week 2011... I've got to say that our experience would've been quite a bit different if we came on a slow day.  The place was JAMMED with people and as a result the service suffered.  I'm pretty familiar with rogue beers, and if you aren't, you may want to pick a bottle or 6 up before you head in to get a taste.  They have dozens of beers on tap, I believe half of which are Rogue.  The do offer a sampler/flight which is a great way to experiment.  Food was typical brewpub fare, nothing all that special, but went well with the beer.  The location is really convinient to bus stops, and the decor was quite comfortable.  I'll go back, but likely on a slower day.

TZ09H4TaXoVXSHfO8W-nOA.review_text: Went here for a board-game night last night with some folks from reddit.com - Good atmosphere, great beer and good food.   Would definitely recommend their Kobe beef "haute dog" with sauerkraut.  Delicious.

AGEFNAQYn0Ih4E8RjWS6sQ.review_text: Oh, how quickly excitement turns to disappointment.  Excitement at spotting a Rogue pub while in SF on business and out prowling for a beer and a bite to eat.  Disappointment with just about everything else. First, we couldn't find a server to save our lives, on the patio or inside. When we finally found an employee, he confirmed that they did indeed offer table service. After a further wait, my buddy gave up and went to the bar to get a couple beers at least. A while later a server finally showed up, cleared some of the stuff the previous patrons had left on the table, and we quickly placed our order (in case this guy never appeared again).  We ordered two types of tacos -- mahi mahi and "kobe" beef. When they arrived, both plates looked more like the mise en place for tacos then any actual tacos. Perhaps this was a cutting-edge deconstruction effort that my unsophisticated midwestern palate could simply not grasp, but that seems unlikely. Each component was piled up separately on the plate. This technique was especially unkind to the fish which had been mashed up as if intended as baby food.  When it finally came time to grudgingly pay for this unfortunate meal, the server was again MIA. Upon tracking him down, he said he'd bring the check right over. You might not be surprised at this point to learn that he didn't. My friend finally paid the bill at the bar and we left.  If you ever go here I have two suggestions: (1) Don't order any food and (2) sit at the bar where you will be relatively difficult for the waitstaff to avoid/ignore.

gDUb6UfocBVxUvMdyeudiw.review_text: Good service, good beers. We got the tasters and got a chance to enjoy all the house brewed beers. Service was good.

BzkXyR-45yc8EJeVySMJWg.review_text: woefully and painfully neglected bar.  Great beer, great location.  No-one seems to give a sh..... care about this place.  No minor repairs.  Filthy.  Broken down bathroom.  Menu with black marker crossing out things and marking in new prices.  We got the bleu balls - would have been great if cooked fresh  These were microwaved and so tasted like microwaved meat balls.  Got a hot dog for the boy, was served in a frisbee which we thought we could keep- but alas was whisked away never to be returned.

XNz_CoTUBxnFPMtlAHTXAQ.review_text: Came here for a quick drink while waiting to visit a friend in SF. The beer flight I decided on was excellent with the hazelnut being my favorite. If you like dark beers you will love the hazlenut. We also decided to try out the Voodoo doughnuts drink which actually succeeded the hazlenut. Great beer selection but the service seemed a little slow for how vacant the place was.

0qvijl9gnUNKZ4YilSlsqA.review_text: Still love the microbrew selection. I had the Rogue dry hop red last night. The waiter was incredibly nice. "Earnest" is the word that came to mind. They didn't have any Belgian style ales, but my date thought that because Le Trap is so close, maybe it would be redundant. We had a light dinner; he had chili, and I had black bean dip. All the accoutrements for the chili come on the side, which is great when you are on your New Year's eating healthy plan, because you can skip the cheese and sour cream. My black bean dip was really really tasty. It had some heat, and was a little tangy (from lime?) It was overcooked and crumbly in one corner, but eh. I didn't come here for the food, and I was still pleasantly surprised.

HWzrsq8gry5nPfD5bm7zyg.review_text: Worst service ever. That's all I have to say. My boyfriend and I waited half an hour outside in the cold because the inside was full. We told them in the beginning we'd be outside and no one ever came to take our order. Finally we went back inside and said we'd be out front and again no one came. One of the waitresses passed by our table to serve another couple that had just come in, and didn't acknowledge us. We ended up leaving and I'll never go back. I liked Rogue at first for a few beers on the weekend, but now I'll never go back. The service sucks and I was extremely irritated and disappointed. Get it together Rogue. I understand wait staff gets busy but they are rude and inconsiderate as well.

FzJRCkoalWORV9MskE2CuA.review_text: OVERALL:2.4   FOOD:1.5   SERVICE:3   AMBIANCE:3   VALUE:2  "This Kobe is like a piece of dehydrated cardboard!" "Well, where do you think you are?!?!--this is a brew pub."  Ahh, this is CLEARLY the start of a promising culinary experience, minus the culinary.  And the promising.  If we're talking straight beers, sure--4 stars, EASY (i.e., Chipotle Ale).  On every other front, this place falls painfully short.  1) Being classified as a brew pub should not be synonymous with some kind of congenital food disability.  Like, "hey look at me!--I'm a brew pub!  Wanna eat?  Chew on some beer!" Case in point, 21st Amendment...burgers = delicious!  Rogue, on the other hand, is only *good* (I'm being liberal here) for potato products (i.e., tater tots).  Absolutely avoid anything meaty, esp the alleged Kobe items.  C'mon Rogue: if you wanna cop out on the brew pub status, at least price accordingly ($10 hot dog??!?!).  2) Service is half-hearted and sloooow (~10 minute for drinks).  3) Drink size is curiously inconsistent, even for draft pours.  The same brew/well drink will come in different glasses with at least a 2oz spread...shady!  Stick to beers & Trivia Thursdays!

PdvSyOynbCqPToRi64_KTQ.review_text: Epic beers on tap - and there are a LOT on tap. Chill vibe, service is cool. Was warned not to get the sliders so I got a burger which was pretty tasty. However, their TV is tiny, they should really upgrade to a large flat widescreen tv.

bLJIo69bG7osEyXxCPSewA.review_text: when every time im in the northbeach....u can bet im here havin a brewsky or two or three...maybe four....on a sunny day~forget it....ill be sitting outside with a glass enjoyin the scenery....the list of brews written on the board seems endless...but for some reason the more u drink @ this hot spot....that list seems to get bigger.....been here @ different times of the day during the week...earliest ive been here was @ like 12 high noon...been here for happy hr....one thing i never tried was the appetizers tho.....

eSWFymxyDFi_J5V6sgwMyw.review_text: Went with a friend who swore that she remembered this place had amazing fish and chips... Although I trusted the yelp reviewers, and was extremely skeptical, I still went because I know Rogue beer to be quite tasty.   Wow, I couldn't have been less impressed. The fish and chips made me sick to my stomach for at least 12 hours. Plus I'm pretty sure they were bought from costco and then microwaved. Then the tab turned out to be around $30! for two beers and the worst fish and chips I've ever had.   I blame myself for not trusting yelp. But don't let my mistake be yours!! I encourage all you readers to go buy your dead guy ale from the liquor store and stay home!

tZ7guKlHjEg0ZhBHt6fCyg.review_text: If u like Rogue beers, you'll like this place.  The menu was a bit phallic....you can order Kobe Beef Balls that also come with sausage.  Dude...who write this, Beavis or Butthead?

Wes1S9aj0h_rs2DWLTtN0Q.review_text: Beer selection is decent, no complaints there.  The service however is MISERABLE.  The staff must have a handbook on how to avoid eye contact.  We had two beers, both of which we had to go to the bars ourselves to get.  Food??  Good luck getting anyone to give you a menu!  Do yourselves a favor and go get a beer elsewhere.  This place blows.

L2j8Ci1d30tDU4-kbeOr4g.review_text: Horrible service. tater tots are amazing though

t7HzYVvLK2tCAden5FktVw.review_text: This is a place to have beer.  Beer, not food, beer.  Okay, the Kobe sliders are fine, but anything else is at your own risk.  Afternoon bartenders are fun and easy going.  This is one of those places that you stop off to have one, and then move along, but end up having four.  Excellent selection of micro brews, makes this place pretty fun.  Watch out for the bathrooms, they are labeled only as Hops and Barley.  Hops=Mens, Barley=Ladies.

I-FmdvI28N7OIIt4JZOgIg.review_text: Easily overlooked spot - especially since there are so many bars competing around here in North Beach!  I like the outside Biergarten to this place!  It can be quite pleasant to take your pint of beer and drink outside!   There are TVs and a lounge setting inside to be enjoyed here!  They have bar food, such as chili, reuben, spinach and artichoke dip, tator tots and other yummy munchies!  They have their own bottled Rogue container beer!  Pretty cool that they have signature branding for beer of their own!

DBZuWXF4Virmud22fTq8tw.review_text: Awesome selection of brews on Tap! The pub has a local, unembelished, easy character to it.... you can get as intoxicated and shameless as you want, with no judgements from the bartenders (ive seen it happen!). The food is definitely not something to brag about....but hey, thats not what your there for! My top beer picks....the Hazelnut Brown Nectar, or Chocolate Stout

DVl7v-7aNaDsMMFcEyxbrA.review_text: I live a few blocks away from this place and have dropped in a couple times, though I usually stay away since its a bit pricey.  But last night my friend from out of town wanted to get some wings and beer, so Rogue seemed like an obvious choice.    We sat outside (not in the patio, just on the sidewalk) and were eventually waited on by a waitress who was unpleasant.  She seemed overly annoyed when my friend inquired about what beers were availabe, suggesting that we get up and go read the list since she can't memorize them all since they change.  Fair enough if you can't get them all, but she acted as if we should have already known that, and was resistant to even recommending a few of the over 20 beers.  So, she was lame.  We proceeded to fufill our other craving, chicken wings, and were dissappointed.  They were 11 dollars for a small order (8 wings max), and they weren't hot (temp)!  I know SF and North Beach can be expensive, but 11 bucks is particularly so, especially for totally mediocre wings.  Oh and the beers were 6 bucks each as well.    So bad service, bad wings (not sure about the other food), pricey beer, but the outdoor seating, the back patio, and the beer selection are somewhat redeeming.

OaRk-RwFEzfOtc45ff0fGA.review_text: The good (great, actually): beer selection and outdoor area  The bad: sliders (imagine public school free lunch sliders with lackluster patties and bread that sticks to the roof of your mouth).  However, because this is a place primarily for beer, I will not down grade them for their shitty sliders - who knows, maybe their other food items are better.  The ugly: the bouncer(?) or staff member who told people to leave when the bar closed.  I know he probably had a rough day and drunk people can be exhausting, but he was not friendly or courteous in the least.

Uf6bWciNqYPHdf62DOXmWA.review_text: Came here last night for my birthday with a group of 7 people total.  there was only one server trying to cover the entire restaurant from what I could see so slower service would have been acceptable had he not been a total jerk.  not only could we not get him to stick around to even finish taking our order (4 items for my part and he tried to leave after each item) but he was overall very unpleasant with an attitude that showed he would clearly rather be anywhere else.  on top of the 1 star service, I ordered the kobe beef sliders.  they may as well have been hockey pucks they were so overcooked.  i would never have been able to tell if it was good meat with how poorly they were prepared.  on top of that, they took almost a half hour to come out (15 minutes to even get our first beers)  I definitely will not be returning here, there are plenty of friendlier places with better service that also serve good beer.  would not recommend

zeLrrWmwZ_6m5cbBxCZorQ.review_text: Lots of good beers to choose from.  Get the taster.  You can get any beer currently on tap in your taster, even ciders. I've never seen cider on tap, let alone a pear cider.  For some reason I expected this place to be a little something more than just a bar, being a Rogue Brewing establishment.  It ain't.  Just a bar.  With a good selection of beer, and a fridge full of Rogue brand beers for take home.

EiAbnKerB7wn7cFMqLkW1Q.review_text: Completely Fair and Unbiased Review.  Do not be fooled by others...   Let me start off by stating that Rogue beers are definitely one of my favorites and i have both been drinking, and supporting Rogue for years, but after multiple dining let downs, it hurts me to give them the dreaded 1 star review.  This isn't easy, but here we go-I had to write after this past experience.  Please note that this review is completely about this particular brewpub restaurant, food, and service, NOT about their beers in which are verrrry tasty and i love!!  Anyways, here we go....   The Kobe Blue Balls sounds awesome, but are extremely dry and lack quality meatball moist, meaty, deliciousness.  The 1/2 lb. Bacon Cheese Kobe burgers are okkkkkkkk..... But for $15.95, Go with the regular beef bacon cheeseburger for 9.95. Totally not worth the $6 extra dollars. Trust me. *** I am also very unhappy about this because the menu says $15.95 and the bill said $17.95!!!!!!!!!! REALLY ROGUE????????  And then the waiter was completely unapologetic and could care less.  He was not even busy, but almost more annoyed that we noticed and made me get up to go get a menu to show him the real price, until he humbly mumbled... oh yeah....  But wait it gets better!! ********  My gf ordered the chicken fingers and for a BBQ dipping sauce with them.  I casually asked for BBQ sauce and Mustard for my burger.  He brings out a couple very tiny small saucer's of 2 BBQ Sauces and a Mustard.  Without any mentioning or notifying us, we come to find out that he charged us $0.50 per sauce on our bill as well!!!!! So not only were we overcharged for our burger and not even given an apology, but were also charged extra for 3 tiny sauces in which i was embarrassed to bring up, but did mention that it would have been courteous if he had notified us before ordering that mustard for a burger and BBQ sauce for chicken fingers were going to cost us extra.  The server was completely rude, standoffish, unfriendly, cold, rude, and acted like he could care less that we decided to dine-in at Rogue for our double date night.  The one positive was the Onion Rings and beer.  This is my only recommendation if you end up here or would like to check it out for yourself.    I FEEL COMPLETELY UNAPPRECIATED AS A PATRON AND CHEATED.   I am very bummed out about this because of my love for their beer.  I wish i could speak with the owner or a manager about this experience.  This definitely left a sour taste in the mouths of our table and no we were not drinking sour beer, but sour attitude.  Four of us went out for a nice evening dinner before attending a comedy show at Cobbs, but definitely had a poor start to the evening because of ROGUE.  Please feel free to message me to discuss Rogue.  I'm sorry to throw you under the bus like this, but this was such a bad experience that I had to let others know.    DO NOT RECOMMEND.  RUDE, UNFRIENDLY, UNATTENTIVE, AND CARELESS STAFF. POOR FOOD. OVERCHARGED US. TERRIBLE EXPERIENCE.  GO SOMEWHERE ELSE.

eFmMHYI869hc80BmpdYZ1Q.review_text: Beer, the final frontier.  Well, actually to be honest, it was kind of flat.  It looked like a really fun establishment.  Huge selection of brewed beers, and I did a sampler.  I got to try out 4 of them.  Issue was, its listed on a chalk board, and it doesn't identify whether its a amber, IPA, pale ale or any thing.  Would be nice if they're more organized like Pyramid Brewery, providing a description on what each one taste like.  Am I being a snob?  I know its not wine tasting, but hell, a girls gotta know what she's putting in her mouth before she swallows it, right?  LOL!  And none of them tasted really fresh.  Kind of flat and ordinary.  And the food, I had the Rogue Sosoji Sampler.  Felt like I was eating a frozen dinner of Kids Cuisine.  Sliced up half a sausage, 3 meatballs, 4 so so wings, and a dried up mini slider.  Nothing to go absolutely goo goo ga ga for, but hey. . . it was still a nice place to try out.

c8qFkI_VusWo0xZvkjfBWQ.review_text: Rogue, the makers of some pretty good beers like the Dead Guy Ale apparently create a plethora of adulterated nasty brews too.  And you can try the all in North Beach at this restaurant!  Mocha beer?  Hazlenut beer?  Orange cream bear?   *VOMIT*  Crafting good brews has taken second place to a rack of syrup it seems.  The food?  It's amazing that anyone can make bar food below par.  The kobe hamburger was pretty tasty I must say, however the gumbo was nothing more than a recipe for Louisiana stew taken from the pages of a magazine you see at the grocery store check out line.  The artichoke dip would do better to be served with toast points than pita, and the wings for $10 were incredibly uninspired.  If you go here and order a taster rack, tell them to pick you beer flavored beers lest you become sick.

EuWRgm2NGa3KLNG2zSUJ-Q.review_text: The beer was really good;  the redeeming quality for this place; 5 stars there.    The food was typical bar food but overpriced.  Nothing special or inviting about the space at all. The table was even wobbly.  -1 stars  I've sustained plenty of hearing damage over my time, but it was way too loud- not the music- the pub quiz guy over the PA. I couldnt hear myself think!  Yelling across a table sucks. -2 stars

qGLkFXVmnovZB_tMIi_ICQ.review_text: This was the 5th or 6th place we stopped by after santacon.  My liver told me it was time to stop drinking, but my group had other plans instead.... I had this chocolaty beer, which was a bit dark but tasty. We also had the fried calamaris, which tastes like most fried calamaris...nothing too special.  Our waitress was pretty attentive being the fact that  we were sitting outside.

AVlMEN7w5Z5fSO1dHUjfDQ.review_text: I give it 4 stars for the beer and as a daytime hangout. If your in the area have time off whatever it's a very chill place to have a beer. Did not try any food, but everyone I talked to there was great.

BaveUVWRiGX6Y8IFPcEb1g.review_text: Great beer and great service. We stopped by to get a couple of flights and every one of them was awesome. They have a great selection. Of guests from all over and really knowledgeable staff.

mzMfSGY2o4d48iWJrh7iaQ.review_text: Come for the beer.  The food is nothing special and the table service is leisurely at best.  We went because we had our dog with us and wanted to eat and drink beer with the dog.  Their patio was closed so they made us sit out front, which was fine, but then while we were finishing up, a couple (regulars?) came in and took their dog right into the restaurant and sat at the bar with their dog.  So their dog policy is inconsistent, and that's one of the main reasons we came here to begin with.  Still, the beer selection is awesome.

wv6Q8PiF70uySYAcvo3DhQ.review_text: Nice to see some beer on tap other than Coors Light and Miller.  Who drinks any of these beers anymore anyway?  Enjoy the atmosphere as most will in attendance were searching for the some thing - good company and good beer.

3zyBvSsgLEWYsPpnFIxV2g.review_text: Over 30 beers on tap. Go for the beer, skip the food. You're in north beach for god's sake get some italian instead.  After having samples of several brews in those very cool rogue shot glasses served by a very friendly, very cool bartender, I decided on the pilsner and was pleasantly pleased.  All their beers were tasty, foamy, good to the last drop of hops.  Hey, the 10% pilsner deserves 4 stars. oh and they were free. did i mention the cool bartender?

EGvptPOz6SDKdxvbeqQ7Vw.review_text: Double Chocolate Stout over ice cream. I'm getting drunk off dessert!

DpiMuxg2g4urzClzjykUHg.review_text: So....the first time I came in here I ordered a Budweiser. lol. The bartender's head DID explode. As did my sister's.   I like how spacious this place is. There is a full-service bar, despite this place being a beer place. There's a wide variety of Rogue Ale & guest beer to choose from.   There's a large back patio, with 10 or so picnic tables.   Great place to go with girlfriends on the weekend to catch up or have an easy-going afternoon.

VzlEYx7DjeOVnX1HJ6y-_w.review_text: Very nice selection of Rogue beers. Skip the food.

sOMhmdxxRPbolQ2hmFZJqw.review_text: Maybe it's because it's in my hood, but I really enjoy going there. The beer selection is of course their forte, and it should be enough to satisfy a vast majority of beer lovers. Ambiance is what you expect from a brewery. It gets pretty crowded on Friday and Saturday nights, definitely more mellow during weekdays. If the night is warm enough, you can get  a table outside and from there have a view of Coit Tower, which is a pretty cool thing.

SD2sefHe-r9-ssEvxPoD8g.review_text: I love this place. They have a great selection of beers on tap- Rogue beers and guest breweries. The food is good and reasonably priced. I am a vegetarian and so the options are not vast but I like the veggie burger and fries or tater tots. The staff are very friendly and the outdoor patio is great. The patio and sidewalk seating is dog-friendly.

jnVqZ_bCzotRueQSNcnq-g.review_text: Crap service.  Crap beers.  Crap atmosphere.  Fucking awesome Snake River Farms kobe burger with Neuske's bacon and Rogue blue cheese! And actually cooked medium rare, just the way I asked for it (oh stop!). So the bacon was pre-cooked and had been sitting out all day, but it was Neuske's bacon! Without a doubt the finest slice of piggy that will ever grace your pallette.  I'd definitely reccomend stepping in for a kobe burger and a pint, but that's really about it. Oh and the bar guy dissed Guinness. That's a hanging offense as far as I am concerned.

cEdyAEZMNkTG37SxseT6rQ.review_text: Fabulous beer, bad service.  It's like they are annoyed / bothered to serve you - weird.  I still come here because i love the beer, but I hope the folks that work here begin liking their jobs a bit more.

m8nQ9i-Peo5zfZqfnc7LuA.review_text: My husband and I stopped here on a whim during our California honeymoon beer trip.  We enjoyed it. The servers were really cool. They talked it up with us for a while. Both Rouge's and their visitors tap menu were excellent. Cool spot.

LEYATcNB6pQ-DNcmCI2NxA.review_text: Fun place to hang out, although to me it was nothing special. Close to North Beach, so parking is a nightmare.

J7ka23aCUNK-v_yLB4AL1Q.review_text: I love beer.  If you love beer, you'll love this place. Plain and simple, unlike they're phenomenal beer.   I don't give many places 5 stars but when you have a selection like this, I can't but help it.

z02-RBZwklc-uA_3KN-jSQ.review_text: My first visit was on a Thursday around noon, without electricity.  Only drinks were being served and the bar was cash-only.  The bartender made the best of the situation by putting his iphone in a pint glass to amplify the sound of whatever game the afternoon crowd was trying to watch, as well as by mixing me up a fantastic bloody mary and offering several beer samples.  Visit number two was around happy-hour on a Tuesday when they didn't seem terribly busy but the flustered waitress was having trouble getting around to customers.  We waited a bit for our drink orders to be taken, and the wrong drinks came back to us anyway.  Having fallen in love with the bloody mary I had days earlier, I ordered another in hopes of getting the same thing, but it's crafting included much less love and the beverage was walked over and slammed on the table by an impatient bartender.  I'm pretty sure some of the following beers that we ordered weren't the right ones, but we let it go, as things weren't going smoothly in general and we just wanted to relax.  The chorizo tacos and the bleu cheese-filled slider were satisfactory, and everyone else seemed to enjoy their burgers and chili.    Overall, the service seems to be hit-or-miss.  The food is satisfying, and the beer is of course what Rogue is known for in the first place.  Worth revisiting, one day.

9OXGWy6UWCxZFCAlezlg3A.review_text: If your website says you open at 10am for brunch...  If your homemade flyers hanging in the bar say you open at 10am...  If the SF Beer Week website has your event to start at 10am...  Well then...open at TEN A.M., RIGHT?  No it's better to lie to a paying customer and tell them you were open even though we were at the front doors at 10 *and* 10:30 and you were closed. Nice try...

XvOY_bk_KWqnqGvjwZxOxQ.review_text: Rogue Ale house rules. Always a place I'll lean on for a no bullshit kind of bar. Not really into ever ordering food here, but who orders food in a bar? Out of towners, last date, first date, it's all the same. Take your friends here and order them a glass of Yellow Snow. You'll be glad you did.  ...but I hate two things about this place. The bathroom SUCKS and they play sports.  What trumps this is that they have outdoor seating and heaters....hellooo sundays!

rtFI0_GrbF6boXFgxXCxPw.review_text: I was impressed with the beer selection at Rogue when my boyfriend and I stumbled across it while exploring the city. Upon walking in they have a large list of their own offerings as well as some guest draughts. I was happy to see that on their "guest" offerings they had Bud Light where they placed a well deserved frowning face next to it!  We placed our order at the bar as it wasn't obviously clear if they had a waitstaff in the middle of the afternoon. I went with their Oatmeal Stout which was incredibly roasty in flavor, which I enjoyed. My boyfriend also went with one of the Rogue offerings and we took our beers out into the beer garden to enjoy them.  The atmosphere was pretty low key for the middle of the afternoon on a Saturday and the patrons were in their mid 20s-30s. The bartenders and the waitstaff were friendly, so no complaints there. If I were in the area again, I'd definitely pop in for a beer or two.

y6I7waddCQUpHKelJ9sC2g.review_text: Go for the nice selection of beer, don't bother with the food.  I had a burger and fries and the fries were pretty good, but the meat was probably just one of those pre-made patties from Costco.  And for the bacon burger, if you're lucky you'll get 2 slices of bacon, many people get only 1.

zpnd-D0-ahcfrYYLvt04oA.review_text: This review has a slight correlation to the previous one - Aquatic Park. So, while I was swimming, i somehow managed to ingest a full cup and a half or two of nasty Bay water and it took every effort I could muster to keep from vomitting mid-swim.  Needless to say, I was anxious to get something strong and tasty in my tummy to stop gagging.  Beer, of course being the logical choice, Crazy lil sis and I stopped in Rogue all salt-encrusted and nasty on our way home for a beer in the sunshine.  The purpose was to thaw out and cover the polluted Bay water taste immediately.  I got a double IPA and she got a pear cider and we sat and drank in the beer garden in the back.  There were a couple of other folks out there, but we were able to take a giant table to ourselves and stretch out and enjoy the brewski.  The pear cider was deliciously and sweetly refreshing.  That's what I'm getting next time.  It was a perfect mid day stop between the water and mi casa.

soMKcJUZ4Oex-6OQ8sDccQ.review_text: This was my favorite bar out of all the ones I visited in San Francisco. I just loved their beer varieties and all of the ones I've tasted were awesome. You pay about $6 a beer on tap, which isn't bad for me.  I tried the Watermelon Hefeweizen, 200 meter IPA, Dead Guy Ale, and the Hazelnut Brown. The dead guy and Hazelnut are good and pretty much what you expect. But the Watermelon Hefeweizen was awesome. You get a strong taste of Watermelon out of any I've ever tasted. The 200 meter had a good citrus aftertaste that was very drinkable, but not as hoppy as I wanted from an IPA.  The food was OK. I had the chicken fingers and my fiancee had a burger. But if your coming here, you probably aren't coming for the food.  If I lived here I'd be here every week.

8o-P54348nQR_9PgyMM1tA.review_text: Just a great place to grab a pint or 2 or 3 or 7, haha. We stopped by here during SF beer week to try the special beer they had for the event which was called Charlie 1981ale. The beer was bitter awesomeness, I really liked this beer for its hoppiness, and its unique flavor . I was surprised that the bar was a little dead the night we came, I know it was Thursday but was expecting it to be really pack and it wasn't. They have too many beers to list on tap which is great, but makes the choice on what to drink is very difficult. I really liked that they had dogfish head on tap, I will have to come back to try more from that brewery.

Kiyui53V3hJST4btFswtlg.review_text: GREAT beer selection.  Rogue's brews are widely acclaimed, and they happen to have some nice guest beers on tap here as well.  I'd give there food 2.5-3 stars.    The bartenders working on the several occasions I've been here were very knowledgable about each of the beers, and are happy to chat and give you samples.   If you are looking for cocktails or food you'll probably want to head elsewhere.

1J3y5-1ZSkmWixZfMspzSQ.review_text: Im an IPA fan so when i read their menu i wanted to stop by. I got the sampler for idr how much but that got me going quite well. Decided to go for a couple glasses of their IPA my buddy ordered a dish of idr either. Lol sorry it was half a year ago. But the dish was not good to him and i told him to tell the bartender since we were eating at the bar. He did and she immediately said ok I'm sorry about that and walked away on the computer. She turns around and says ok its been taken care of for you. Like whaat?! Damnnn girl its that easy to get a free meal. Lol. Now really he did not like it but i will remember this place for that great satisfaction thank you i think her name was kelly.

URHf5mueYVR0vGuVPr1oUQ.review_text: Slow service, gross food-we were recommended the black bean dip which had way too many jalapenos in it, and the homemade chips were soggy, ok beer, flat root beer (my friend sent it back it was so bad).   Did not care for the crowd, and we were in a hurry, with the service being so slow we didn't even get dinner. Would not go back.

kk2oFTBSU9C2XshIVU7tXQ.review_text: We stopped in just for drinks, but the smell of the food actually whetted our appetites. We were originally going to just order an appetizer each but my friend wound up with a chili cheese dog while I got a plate of onion rings. Of course we also ordered some tasty beverages to go with our food (Crispin Cider for me, Dead Guy Ale for him).   Service was a bit on the slow side, although our drinks came out really fast. I'll give them the benefit of the doubt about service as the place was pretty busy, given it was a basketball playoff game going on and the patrons were pretty rowdy. We'd tried to get seats out in the beer garden, but nope nope nope, wasn't happening.   Our food came out and it was delicious. I went through about half of the onion rings before I was done and my friend demolished his chili cheese dog. Both were amazing and tasty and I wish I could have stolen some of that chili.  Definitely a good place to go if you're looking for some decent bar food and drinks. Be prepared for it to be busy and noisy though.

ybLqwulHnia8WzRPsdmchg.review_text: Awful service. Been there probably 10+ times. Every time I wait at the bar forever, even on days when its not crowded. The bartender would rather talk to a co-worker or a regular customer. I have left a few times after waiting for 10 minutes without even being acknowledged when its dead. I would be a regular customer if they had good service or even reasonable service because the beer selection is good.

k6y_KpWMByi8Hpodqft7Kw.review_text: **Update**  I never thought that I would be turned off by a hunk of fried potato.  However, last night I tried the fries here and they were heinous.  Love the food otherwise.  Just steer clear of the soggy, greasy, cold starchy stuff.

7BI4qysS-kdwPF7FnXf4hg.review_text: I love Rogue beers. They are very distinctive in character. They also have a great number of guest taps for trying other microbrews. The food is good as well. I recommend going during the day in order to get attentive service as this place gets slammed at night and gets that North Beach nightlife crowd that are more interested in being slimeballs than they are at trying good microbrews. The back patio is also great during the day.

54188bW_VBws3mDDrD1SDA.review_text: have you ever tasted rainbows?   im not talking about skittles, damn it, im talking about  perfectly chilled, pure, unabashed JOY being poured down your throat.  one glass of  Rogue's hazlenut brown nectar may have you singing a different tune, my friend.  i cant remember, but i think it was served to me on a cloud by two cherubs...   i got a plate of fries that were super tasty & krispy too.

Th-FhNLxLp0_eS9Bh06G_g.review_text: I really like going to Rogue.  The waitstaff and bartenders know their beers and are personable and outgoing.  It has a good, welcoming neighborhood feel.  The beer is very good, and the tap selection is often varied.  My personal favorites are the Eugene City Tracktown IPA and the St. Rogue Dry Hop Red.  In general, the food is fine, but honestly not worth a visit.  You go for the beer and eat if you're hungry.  If you have to eat, I recommend the Blue Heeler hot dog, house salad, and Brutal Reuben.  Overall, this is a slightly dingy bar with great beer, good people, and acceptable food.

ghYSbxQuYxL1Dn68iMJf6g.review_text: What a disappointment this place was.  Rogue is one of my favorite microbreweries ever.  When I came to town and saw they had a dining establishment within a mile of my hotel, I was ecstatic.  I insisted that we go there for dinner, and I learned a lesson.   The beers are, as always, phenomenal.  The Rogue Hazelnut Brown Ale is my absolute favorite.  In addition, I tried the Mocha Porter, and it was great, but it's a meal in itself.  We also tried the brown sugar beer, but it was disgusting . It was an obnoxious tug-of-war between hops and brown sugar, with nothing to smooth the transition.  Oh, well, at least I can say I tried it. What absolutely killed me was the food.  I didn't expect  a lot, yet they still managed to disappoint me.  We ordered the Bleu Balls, which are meatballs with Oregon bleu cheese cooked into them and sprinkled on top.  They were decent, though the cheese was unbelievably salty.  Then, we ordered a 1/2-lb.Kobe bacon cheeseburger, cooked medium, as well as a Kobe beef chili-cheese dog.  It was said to come with a Rogue beer-based ketchup and mustard, cheese, and Rogue-beer-based chili.  The burger was overcooked (beyond well-done) and dry.  The hot dog was just a clusterf*ck.  No ketchup, no mustard, no cheese, just a hot dog on a bun with chli, which was dry as a bone as well .
