They didn't even put the f*cking pickle spear on the plate.   Our server started out OK, checking on us from time to time, refilling our beers, etc.  Once the food was ordered, he turned into a ghost, disappearing until the food was ready, bringing it to us, then vanishing until we asked for the check.  He must have known how sucky the food is there.  He was not a particularly sharp fellow; otherwise, he likely would be working elsewhere.   I love Rogue beers so much; this restaurant was a real kick to the stones for me.  I will enjoy Rogue ales at the Yard House from now on.  Shame on you, Rogue, for half-assing such a business venture.

SqSMWBHD2Lklf_8W5MftPA.review_text: I really like the beers that Rogue makes, and I enjoy that they're available at a bar, but I can't give this place more than 3 or 3 1/2 stars.  I've been there twice, but both times it's felt a little bit too dirty for me (many of the tables clearly hadn't been wiped off) and both times they had run out of a number of beers.  We went there to try out their "Strong Beer Month" brews, and even though we were only in the middle of the month, many of the beers on the list were already gone.  Also, the beers are a little bit pricey, and the service there was only ok.  The bartenders aren't mean, but maybe just a little bit indifferent.  I'd definitely go back because the beer is good, but if the beer sucked, I might have to cross it off my list.

KS-iygmyLw66hGi5sWMpzg.review_text: On a sunny Sunday afternoon, my out-of-town guest (a fellow beer aficionado) and I were walking through the city. We went from the MOMA to Chinatown to North Beach before deciding, "ya know, a beer would be good right about now". Just as we turned the corner onto Union St, I see the marquee for the Rogue Public House.  Pretty sure the omnipresent god-light shone down and the angels sang for a minute (the chorus to "Party Hard", before you ask.)   We walked into a spacious pub which is likely packed on weekends but was inhabited today by a group of folks watching the baseball game (I'm from San Diego, so suck it Giants). If you're a fan of any kind of Rogue beer, this is the place for you - all kinds of concoctions from those crazy brewmasters await you here. One of my particular faves is the Chipotle Ale.   Yeah, you read that right. Chipotle Ale.   A clean ale that goes down with a light chipotle aftertaste. For it being more of an experiment than a mainstream offering, I really like it. Lo and behold, they have it on tap. They've also got a full bar here, so if liquor is more your thing, they can take care of ya.   The staff here are very cool. The bartender, my friend and I started shooting the breeze and cracking jokes on tourists that came in asking for directions. Yeah, I'm kind of a dick like that...what do you want? I was drinking!   Anyway, being able to stroll around the city and find a pretty awesome brewery's flagship pub at random is one of the reasons I love San Francisco.

vITUu5axrTbQEnpOO2WIRA.review_text: skip the food here.  it's horrendously overpriced and not very good.  $8 for onion rings?  are you kidding me?  for that kind of money you'd expect a huge portion, but you'd be wrong.  the calamari was soggy and disgusting, and the kobe burger was raw in the center.  i've had other kobe burgers, and this one didn't measure up.  but this is an ale house, and you don't come here for the food.  unfortunately, the beer is hit or miss.  maybe it's a problem with the taps or kegs, but sometimes the beer that tasted great out of a bottle doesn't measure up when you order it at the bar.  the imperial stout has never let me down, though.  that might have something to do with the alcohol content.

gb1wDbB3DIVKUfzcDgK6_w.review_text: Great atmosphere and friendly bar service. I enjoy visiting the public house when I'm in town to see what's new and what they have in the retail nook.

7X_NBzZrATD9gHcrDauUFw.review_text: Good beer but just too damn expensive ($6 a pint!). Extremely limited happy hour.  Nice outdoor seating area.

27wY36k_bVHmEbKoLkh1wg.review_text: Great beers, cool people, good food. Enjoyed our stop for lunch - kids (who are brewery regulars) were fine there, and we had a blast tasting everything and chatting with the knowledgeable staff. Will be back!

cCeCQxErE9ToaQQBEVFuFA.review_text: headed here on new years day for some lunch. craving a reuben and siked that they had one on the menu. and kobe burgers my bf was excited to munch on. they put wasabi mayo on it, which he didn't get, just regular mayo. just because it's kobe doesn't mean you have to try to make it asian style..seriously. and a note to the place- maybe one server is not a good choice for lunch on new years day. we waited awhile to get talked to. ordered drinks and after about 15- 20minutes a new server came in. he got us drinks right away and took our order.  we couldn't decide what our hangovers needed so besides the sandwich and burger we ordered tater tots and wings, hot.. the wings were great. crispy, coated evenly. the tater tots were lame. thought they were going to be something creative instead of just outa a box.  the reuben. my poor reuben. could have been perfect. cornbeef needs to be sliced AGAINST the grain. but since it wasnt, i could barely bite through it! correctly sliced cornbeef melts in your mouth and this was like biting through a wall. the kobe burger. my bf forgot to tell him how to cook it, and of course, the chef, for whatever crazy reason cooked it to it's death- well done. i think he should have known better that grilling a kobe beef burger above med is murder. fries were boring.  eh. ill come back for a beer and some chicken tenders though.

nd1Z0OCN5H6BaEr77HMLuA.review_text: The other day, Tom got a huge promotion at work, so we went to Rogue Brewery to celebrate. i've heard that the beer there is super good, and was excited to try a few of their different kinds. They had a ton of varieties to choose from, and i started with the Saint Rogue Red which was recommended to drink with their Kobe Beef Burger. the burger was awesome... there's nothing quite like a huge burger with blue cheese all over it! the beer on the other hand... was just ok. Next i decided to try something a little more out of the ordinary: Chipotle Ale. i *love* the flavor of Chipotle... such a good combination of sweet and spicy, but the Chipotle ale didn't taste very good. it just tasted kinda funky. and i dont mean funky in a good way. We ended the night by having a chocolate stout float. my friends liked it, but i wasn't a huge fan. i think the beer would have been good by itself, and the ice-cream good by itself, but together the beer just made the ice cream taste bitter and have a gnarly aftertaste. So, in the end i have mixed feelings about the place. i really dig their designs/logos, the food was pretty damn good, and i thought it was funny that they had frozen tv dinners on the menu along with the rest of the food. but the beer itself wasn't all that great. maybe it was just the ones i tried? (my resolution this year is to visit 50 new bars in SF.  read about it at: fiftybars.thisisvlad.com   )

qknZt5qr21xGZqGVWqqdTg.review_text: Granted, this review comes after a overly medicated North Beach Street Fair party at said establishment.  I didn't spend much time on the inside, but wasn't really impressed with what I saw.  The sunny deck is great, and may be their saving grace (ambiance-wise).

DkFR-AE68Nr0jRR8mKQmlA.review_text: This place kinda blew me away cuz I was not expecting to like it at all.  Not a fan of microbrew beer but I dove into their Shakespeare oatmeal stout and have been hooked ever since.  Cool interior and patio plus front seating available for us smokers who like a killer view of Coit Tower.  I get food every time now too, the chicken strips can't be beat and fries are delicious!! I'm raving so it's time to end this review.

yRbPlxFJ_XECPGwofCQo8Q.review_text: My girlfriend and I were wandering the streets of San Francisco near the China Town area looking for a Chinese restaurant to eat and we noticed this bar. Both of us are avid lovers of Rogue ales, so we were excited and had plans to return after lunch. The bar was rather empty with only a few gatherings of people, but they were very loud and probably drunk, and mind you this was at like 1pm on a Sunday afternoon.  We received courteous service from our bartender who was very knowledgeable of the beers on tap, however, when I asked if they sold bottles to go, he said yes, but that they had all been moved down stairs into the basement which was off limits to customers. I asked the reason why and he explained that since yesterday was St. Patrick's day that the mobs of drunks would begin stealing the bottles out of the coolers so they needed to prevent that. Understandable, but I was a sober individual who knew an extensive amount of Rogue ales, but I was still not allowed to view the bottles for my choosing to purchase and take home. I had to settle for the newest bottle release that he knew of which was Portland Sesquicentennial Ale.  I wish I had taken a picture of the bartender because he looked exactly like the Gas Lamp Killer. On tap the beers we had ordered were XS Imperial Porter and XS Imperial stout. I believe one other beer, but I can't remember what it was. Too bad I didn't have the chance to order the XS Imperial Younger's Special Bitter because I haven't been able to taste it, but I was already catching a good buzz already and we had other things to go visit and see. We didn't order any food, so the rating is based off the establishment as a bar only.

nQtyK42GHYiL8TLS6dnpZg.review_text: Good beer, good atmosphere!  Plenty of room to accommodate for groups.

u6zEFXOkxOIVpbuRpSmtCg.review_text: The only good thing about this place is their beer, which is a shame because the selection and quality are great.  The service is horrible.  It takes about the same amount of time to get a beer ordering from a waitress or from the bartender.  The waitress gets my vote since she's friendlier than the bartender.  The interior has an old, tired feel to it.  The tables are wobbly and sticky, the carpet is worn and shabby, and the place needs a good clean.  It wouldn't hurt to replace the TV's with flat screens.  This place doesn't have enough character to qualify as a dive bar.  Instead it reminds you of a once beautiful woman who has let herself go.

ZyAZbm0Di8l0ynNhxSlc7A.review_text: This review is only for the beer. I got the double (XS) dead guy ale. Delicious, high ABV for a beer, went down smooth. Sticker shock though...$8 for a DDGuy! So, this will be a once in a while thing despite it's excellent location in North Beach - on a corner, near Washington Square Park, just off the beaten path, in the shade and away from the annoying tourists.

woe_Zshe_BCL2PTKLpEvBg.review_text: Bar # 3 during SantaCon on 12/16. Bar was packed by yuppies ordering liquor drinks from an alehouse but not their fault..  Still took about ten minutes at the bar without so much as an acknowledgement from the bartender. He kept serving the one end of the bar while ignoring the side closest to the door..

Ad9CVmXNegnsfYZWBYKoxw.review_text: This place is great. Beers are always amazing and the new bartenders seem to be more nicer than the previous ones. If you like high end beer come here and grab a cold delicious one. Cheers!!!

ZJlNrE2Z_i_-6IKeciRO7g.review_text: Don't get me wrong, Rogue have some great beers, especially some of the darker stuff, and I'd like to try more of them. They also have some silly overpriced gimmicky beers, which frankly they could do without, since they could compete with any other Bay Area brewery with their regular stuff.   The place itself just felt a bit off. The waitress was kind of grumpy, and the atmosphere in general just odd. I did take a look at the menu, which looks to be slightly above average bar fare. I didn't spot any vegan options, although I didn't look very hard.   I'd probably still go back, since the beers are good.

eu19K9KfnvvubzWuv4l6Wg.review_text: Now I'm a girl who loves a bar with a patio, so when I had the opportunity to hang out at Rogue on a beautiful Sunday afternoon, I jumped at the chance.  Convince friends, check.  Walk to bar, check.  Oh wait!  I have my dog with me!  "That's OK!", says Troy McClure (who i randomly ran into at BYOBW)...its Doggie Day!  If by Doggie Day you mean 3 dogs out back hanging in the sun, drinking water, and dining on the most gourmet doggie treats I've ever seen...then Doggie Day it was.  Seriously, Giants frosted cookies, Easter eggs, ones that resembled cupcakes...they looked so good numerous humans around were eating them too.  Apparently they taste best when dipped in beer.  I've been here before, and have always been satisfied with my beers, the atmosphere, patio, and its definitely a spot i like to hit up when in North Beach.  Now i know they are doggie friendly too....BONUS.

r53WZecX0bsLBBLcXxZnrQ.review_text: We came to this bar twice on my vacation to San fran. The first time I was thirsty with a hankering for some quality brews and was not disappointing. Not only did they have just about every one of their own on tap but at least 10 others from around the area.  I can not attest to the quality of the food, only the neighborhood feel, kind and helpful service, and some kickass beers.

yfr7xoIX77mmatXrim9EZg.review_text: This is a nice spot to grab a beer in North Beach- one of the few.  A nice plus is the beer garden in the back, and also the seating outside on the sidewalk.  But I'd give the food a "meh" and the beer right around a "meh" also.  I don't love either, but for greasy pub food and a simple beer, it's not awful.  The ambiance is loud. I'd say that there are other options in the area that are better.  Try La Trappe or Churchkey.

ZnoRV0CJYbKqHlWWm_6MIA.review_text: Nothin' like a tasty cold beer and blue balls!   Get your head out of the gutter, because Rogue carries a tasty dish of blue cheese kobe beef meatballs. My last two visits have consisted of kobe beef entrees, and they weren't bad at all. Not mind blowing, but good enough to savor the flavors of the juicy meat. I'm warnin ya, the juices & grease flow from that burger! Accompanied by a variety of beers you can select from...I found a love for hazelnut beer. YUM...dark and nutty!   Service has been average, and the crowd is usually friendly there.  They have seating out front, inside, and in the back patio. Wether you're finishing off a long day with a good pal like my friend Natalie G, or spending a sunny afternoon with the better half...Rogue hits the spot for a beer craving.

oxl--iAcvMX2RWSqGZXcfQ.review_text: I come here for the chicken tenders. Seriously. I'm a bit of a snob when it comes to chicken tenders...I prefer them to be battered with big crunchy bits of batter sticking out all over the place. This place does them right. The fries are pretty decent too.   I also come here for the hidden back patio that I only found out about recently. It's a perfect place to hide out on a warm day.   I'm not a big fan of the place on Friday or Saturday nights when the douche factor can be a little overwhelming.

XYc6FmCJlEeGgdreWYHd_Q.review_text: I've been here about 10 times. I love their variety! You're sure to find a beer you'll love.  Could use a spruce up for the interior, but I love how spacious it is.

181OOpp5uOgUQM6CeYEo5g.review_text: good black and tan pour.  didnt try any rogue while i was there... i know, i know; thats like going to alaska and not having the salmon, or not throwing a shrimp on the barbie wherever such decapod crustacean throwing is the norm.  much of the night is a blur, but i do remember that the bartender had an 'easy button' he would hit whenever i ordered.

CbwS4MCR9e2zNgZAtzncDg.review_text: Mel R, you just finally moved to the Bay. What are you gonna do to celebrate?  "I'm gonna sit out on the patio, bask in the sun, offend some hipster dudes with my vulgarity and get shitty on my favorite Dead Guy Ale!"  p.s. they allow dogs on the back patio

eIxZfPbH1wVtkGaMedPbyA.review_text: Great selection of beers, so I would recommend this place for beer aficionados.  We visited Rogue's in the afternoon and received sub par service so point deducted for that. Another point (could be two but trying to be reasonable) was lost on the food. Their  "American Kobe" burgers give Kobe a bad name. Sorry, Snake River Farms, but the patty tasted and its texture was that of normal 80/20 chuck, so I definitely felt duped.

iqeWgHZY8EBen9EyKRrk2g.review_text: It's all about the beer! Think happy hour - it's a perfect spot to show up by yourself or with your buds and have a couple GREAT beers. The bar tenders know their beer and will help you choose wisely, maybe even throw in a taste or two if you haven't made up your mind. Sit outside if it's a nice day, enjoy the great bar and it's mix of interesting people, or grab a table.   Oh, the bread! Have the bread. Period. Straight up, with cheese, or as bruschetta, have the bread. The rest of the food is ok pub food - but have the bread!

R6M08jJW4VbcQd0XKeMQvg.review_text: If you are a beer conosuer (or however you spell that damn word) then I highly suggest you check out Rogue. This is one of my favorite spots for when I want beer but don't want to have to carry a six pack back from TJs. Went here tonight for beer and Buffalo Chips (which I cannot recommend highly enough!). My boyfriend and I got the Huckleberry Cider and Rogue's own Mom Hefeweizen. They were great! The best part of the night was the awesome service. Kate was our server and she was super friendly and down to earth. The service was quick, the food and drinks were awesome, and the bill came right on time. We will definitely come back again.

vTugBdYg34rX4KvGpzBrNA.review_text: Somehow my friend and I managed to come here twice in one day. Definitely weird, because I always try and switch it up, but I guess we just liked it that much. We first arrived at 12:30pm to wait for our pub crawl to begin. Since we were expecting to get super intoxicated, we decided to go for their super dark strong brew- Jolly Roger? Basically had a festive picture of a skull and crossbones with a Christmas theme. Basically anything that looked festive was going to do the trick for us that day. It was really good, and yes, really strong...but hey it was Saturday right?  The bar itself is spacious, friendly, and has lots of good beer selections on tap. Once again, I did not try the food, even though it  smelled super good! I should work on that considering my last review says the same thing haha.

oAz4s21FA2QjE0kCNIDxOg.review_text: Went here a while back with some friends and had a HORRIBLE experience. They were blasting their music so loud, I couldn't even hear myself think. We politely asked out waiter if they could turn it down. The bar manager actually turned it up even louder. Unbelievably rude. We moved to the back room...a little quieter there. The food was bland, our beer was warm,  and the lettuce on my salad was limp and disgusting. I don't think I'll ever be back.

47UrNjATawGbUybkmi8oSg.review_text: So, a few qualifications here: know what you're getting into.    For starters: this a ROGUE beer public house, so, aside from a couple of other Oregon breweries, all you're getting on the beer side is stuff made by Rogue.  That said, their beer *kicks ass* -- and they have varieties here that you'll never find at your local BevMo, so belly up. I highly recommend their stouts, porters and IPAs -- they're all well-crafted and certain to give you difficulty walking after you slide off that barstool.   On the food, avoid anything that isn't made with Kobe beef ... the burgers and the "Kobe Bleu Balls" are both reasonably priced AND excellent.  Everything else, questionable.  Having seen the chef argue drunkenly with the bartender for a good chunk of a Monday afternoon, I understand why.     On the service: for best results grab a stool at the bar. While the wait staff definitely makes you WAIT, the bartenders are kind and nurturing.  Express a mild curiosity about one of their brews, and you'll find a tasting glass full of it in front of you before you can mumble "hops shortage."  As with all bars, service is better on sleepy afternoons.

CII7ZpjbiSM_m_C62QkfAA.review_text: Kobe beef burgers are pretty good.  I really like how they make the fries here.  Beer is also good but I recommend going here in the day.  Not a place to go at night since the bar flies and/or sports bar crowd comes out to watch the game.  NOT A DATE SPOT but maybe a AFTER SEX LET'S EAT spot.

hgWo925CNfZ_JKlFXEuOGw.review_text: Rogue Ales Public House was the first place I went to on my last trip to San Fran.  Although, I'm not a beer person at all, I was really looking forward to giving it a try.   I had the beer sampler with four different beers. I'd say, the best ones were the Chocolate Stout and the Mocha Porter. I was a little disappointed that they didn't have the Voodoo Chocolate Peanut Butter which sounded super delicious.  The burger and fries were perfection, in my opinion, but it could be the beer talking.   Overall, my party and I liked the place. Will definitely come back when I go back to San Fran.  The only downside is that you have to pay for public parking. But if you are a visitor, you can walk around North Beach. I wish I would have still been hungry for some Italian food, which is all you see in North Beach.

DH7ABAMHvl6IQfJ_yK7x5Q.review_text: Good ol' Rogue... it is what it is:  a bar with good beer, decent food so you don't fall off your barstool because of the good beer, and stumbling distance to many other bars when you're buzzed enough not to care that they don't have good beer.  I've stopped in here a few times and it always starts the evening off well.  The service is a little hit or miss but the beer never disappoints.

4JbYscM9v-8BFst5nBBV4A.review_text: Ok. I really really never leave bad reviews.   So on here it says you open at 3...how could you possibly be out of the beer that i want to try, plus two parts of the same dish that I want  by 430? Really? There were maybe 12 people in there? A "brewery" should never run out of a beer that THEY make at their own place. I can understand being out of some import or what not...but really? A home brew? wow. And I really wouldn't have left such a shitty review had the beers I did get tasted better then the tap water I get at home.  Service was kinda shit too. The staff wasn't rude, but kind of laggy. It took quite a while for them to get back to the table just to tell us that the 1 thing ordered was going to be something completely different because the 2 main ingredients were out.   I was mad when I found out my girlfriend left a tip after we left. Thanks for saving the day Kennedy's.

ngUrWJ2_-KVqBmfr-OapDQ.review_text: I love Rogue beer. I drink Rogue beer at restaurants and bars when they have it. I buy Rogue beer from BevMo.  So... 5 stars. lol

XXrjLUfUnnsSWGIuPMtimA.review_text: This place is cozy, with a full bar featuring most if not all the brews Rogue has under their belt. The bar tender was educated on his beers and reccommended me a 200 meter ale which was light and very refreshing after walking around all afternoon.   The back area has a beer garden with picnic tables, which is where i met  a local who was assisting a brewmaster with a fresh batch of brew. Next time i would like to try their bacon vodka bloody-mary.   Definitely mingling here longer next time around.

733JIG2y94lTbQeqQYMlwA.review_text: So many great beers! The bartender was super friendly and let me try as many beers as I wanted. The locals were friendly and we chatted it up like I was an old friend. It was so much fun that I hardly wanted to leave for dinner.

TH5rFAvJqz69X7cCnu6RjQ.review_text: Beer! Come here for the BEER! Service was good and our waitress was very friendly. We had  a few snacks along with our beers, but honestly, you're here for the beer and that's ok.

dZclswnuCC3xomr8-Wk3Zw.review_text: I'm a fan for their beer selection mainly. The food was decent, but not really the main reason to go here.  There were a few characters in the place and some cute dogs wandering around (health code violation probably, but it didn't bother me). If you like Rogue's beers, go here.

BQ03Gm1tRzNX7u-pCzOeQQ.review_text: All I can say is American Kobe Beef Burger.....I kind of agree you can forgo the "award winning" white cheddar. Either way finding a delicious, juicy burger that is not over cooked, (and doesn't cost $20) is not as easy as you would think! The beer garden out back is absolutely wonderful on sunny weekends and the crowd is pleasantly neutral. I don't have to worry about my jeans not being skinny enough or my D & G glasses not being big enough.....  Its also kind of awesome that they charge $5 for domestic beers to encourage patrons to venture out from their regular Budlight and try one of their microbrews such as thier "Dead Guy Ale".    p.s. Don't try anything else on the food menu, you will be disappointed. Stick with burgers and beer, can't go wrong.

YtIufq9YUwv8b2sNkxBhiw.review_text: This place is great! The burgers and sampler beer platter are where its at!! It has a great feel in here but since its all the way over in North Beach its harder for me to get over there. My boyfriend is crazy about this place and there beer!! They also have sour beer which is my absolute favorite type of beer!!!! I also love how you can sit inside and see the park across the way it beautiful rain, shine or fog!

70WzR6h6CrGVx5Oc6jpsfw.review_text: How can you be a bar with NO description of your brews? I mean, if you're familiar with ALL of their brews that is one thing, but why not break it down for your peeps? Educate me.  Anywho, it's great beer at a decent price for the area and it's a chill place for big or small groups.

RXOX3MAXQjOPGdMpZv-2xA.review_text: I'd give this place 2.5 if I could, but I wouldn't call it A-OK.  It's pretty meh.  Good brews -- especially liked the soba ale -- but the food was below-average (we had the kobe tacos, a burger and and a french dip).   OK atmosphere, fine service.  And, yes, the chalkboard at the bar thing is stupid.

yqHko4dqtMYbYxKx2NQiNw.review_text: Visited on a recent trip to S.F. with my husband and our best traveling buddies.  Beer is good... food...not so much.  Between us, we had chili, black bean dip, and the rueben.  Chili was good, though I thought it was salty.  Black Bean dip was good, but a little dry, perhaps overheated.  The reuben...well....there's no need for you to try it. Consistency of jerky and the sauerkraut was tasteless.  All this would have been ok had the bartender not just recently undergone a complete personality bypass.  Surly was the word that got tossed around at our table.  We are beer connoisseurs...we know our stuff...but clearly, the bartender did not like being asked about the different styles.  Or being asked for a taster. Or, even just chatting.  Perhaps he was just having an off day.  Regardless, we'll keep drinking their beer at beerfests, and at the pubs here at home when they are on tap, but I'm not sure we'll return to this pubhouse on any subsequent visits to S.F.

A3tEi-379Vq0e9z-SOytwQ.review_text: I've only been here twice but both times sat outside in the sun at big picnic tables, drank cold beer and met cool people. Something about that whole scene inspires a camaraderie among the sun-drenched beer drinkers. The people here just seemed very chill, it wasn't a "scene," it didn't seem like people were trying to impress each other.   Some of the types of beer are a little odd, not something I would try. I'm more of a traditionalist when it comes to beer. But there really is something for everyone here. Apparently they serve food here. That's news to me, which pretty much tells you all you need to know about the condition I was in when I arrived and when I left.   Four stars for great beer and a kick-ass outside patio in the back. On a sunny day this is one of the best places in the city to be.

e5LYGM8k8iQtRgdWrd5uww.review_text: Guys Guys Guys...  I LOVE Rogue beers.  I LOVE the selection here.  However this place is in serious need of a renovation.  It is disgusting inside.  There are fruit flies everywhere and it is just not clean.  Definitely has potential to be one of the best beer bars in SF but get your act together management.

YOIorhfo8hHhilRyam2c4w.review_text: Let me start out by admitting I didn't eat here.If you like beer you already know about Rogue.I find it interesting that this place exists given Rogues home is in Oregon.Anyway I liked it .Good  selection of beers  and they have the Rogue line of spirits including the very interesting spruce gin.This strikes me as a pleasant place to have a few good beers.

iZpUe9cfZX4p_JpKK60psQ.review_text: -5 for food, 5 for backyard patio, 4 for beer selection and 0 for service - i lost my math in there somewhere but the result is a stunningly average place to plunker down and beer up.   what's so stunning about their mediocrity is that they have so much potential.   home to an impressively *full* line of microbrew products, in a great location in the heart of a fine fine city.   if you ask me, they should get rid of their food altogether.  it is way overpriced - not just for me - i don't care who you are but those prices are ridiculous for what they're serving.  just wrong wrong wrong. "soseji" platter?? with oscar mayer hot dogs cut up. now, i love me some oscar mayer. but not when its masquerading as gourmet meat.  "bleu balls" sound good, right?  not when it's all bleu cheese stink and no bleu cheese goodness.   oh, the chicken wings.  where to start, really?  if hairy starved squirrels had wings and they were harvested, left out to turn rancid, and then cooked in a yellow non-spicy, strangely fishy sauce, you'd get Rogue's signature buffalo wings. all i can say for food here was the ketchup was good.   the killer patio out back is what keeps them in business i think even though the servers are always annoyed and some of them can't - they don't know anything - and the others just won't -  talk to you about the beer.  and the beer.  oh the beer.   everyone will be happy cause their list runs the gamut.  but they run out of guest brews quite frequently, or I should say, they run out of many guest brews on any given night. maybe that's meant to be just eye candy on the beer list.  someone with a brain and a dream should buy these guys out. and turn this pub into something really special.

an8CO22sgu9tp8viXMdoAw.review_text: You know its a bad experience when the party you are with is discussing if it is ever ok to leave no tip, or if you must leave a few dollars.  The beer was excellent but the service scared me it was so atrocious. It was as if we walked back in time to 1940s East-Berlin and asked for the democracy special from the Politbüro itself.  We were forgotten, left alone.  In sum, two apps and two beers took two hours -- this was not intentional. We cancelled our last drink order, which the waiter was not surprised by because he had conveniently forgotten we ordered the drinks.  Yet the beer was great with a large selection. The trick is to not ever sit at a table and just belly up to the bar.

HHSfDwS1IWufKQZTtmh_hA.review_text: Awesome place to taste what Rouge has to offer. They have the full selection of Rouge beers on tap and bottled to go.  Love the Mapple Bacon Ale.

30Pch18LE63MyRYOC34-8g.review_text: Choosing between the Hazelnut Brown Ale and the Shakespeare Stout is like asking a parent to pick their favorite child ... only a lot harder.   Rogue is out of Ashland Oregon and one of my all time favorite breweries. They have a diverse and innovative mix of different beers to choose from and the quality is outstanding. No matter what style of beer you like, Rogue will take it to the next level. They even distill their own liquor.   The ambience is nothing special, just your typical bar feel. The nice thing is they have tons of seating, including an outdoor beer garden.   Rogue even makes their own liquor, what more could you ask for from a divey brewery in the heart of North Beach? If you are looking for a good change of pace on your North Beach bar crawl then head to Rogue and grab a beer that is guaranteed not to disappoint.

4ujDwiek_48n2Q4NzJb6zA.review_text: I love Rogue beers. There are very few beers here I don't find to be exceptional brews. It's a really great bar, seat yourself with lots of seating inside and some seating outside. (there's also a patio that's on the back that I haven't actually made it too but I've seen the signs pointing towards it.   They even have a vegan burger, which is pretty delicious. Their fries are also quite tasty.   If your looking for a bar with seating and a decent crowd this is the bar for you. Its chill and relaxed but a little too nice to be a dive bar.

sYtO-WgBz9oShCaezw2UwQ.review_text: Not a fan. My family dragged me here for dinner (really guys, you come to San Francisco for one night and you want to go where?!?)  It looked like it might be a fun place to drink-- we were eating dinner at about 8pm on a Saturday and when my brother went to use the restroom, someone had just thrown up in it...  However, I would not recommend eating here at all. I didn't see anything too appealing on the menu, just typical bar food, so I went with the burger that the waiter recommended. I barely made it through a few bites. No seasoning, not well cooked at all.. just overall really not good. My fries were cold... honestly I don't think you could pay me to come back and eat here.

4D2n7fkc79jFG9f3CHZueA.review_text: When looking for a great variety of craft brews, this is the spot I head to.  I am a sucker for the Shakespeare Stout and Chocolate Stout.  It doesn't matter the day, the weather or my mood, these two beers put a smile on my face and belly.  The sampler is also a great way to enjoy many of the beers until you find your smile maker.  The food is normal pub fare, nothing special, but a nice addition to fantastic beers.   If the weather permits it's fun to sit outside, although getting hit up for change kind of sucks...  Also, service can take a long time to reach your table, so if you are in a hurry, sit at the bar.  And it is true, you need to be within viewing distance of the chalkboard to select your drink as there are no menus.  Fixing those issues would make it a five in my book.

hNzYBmZJEmcOGX_RnWnLEQ.review_text: 4 Stars for beer, 2.5 stars for food and 3.5 for atmosphere/setting.  Rogue makes some interesting brews - Brutal Bitter IPA, Orgasmic, Juniper Pale Ale, 7-hop IPA, Chipotle Ale are all worth checking out. It may not be an A-list brewery but they do provide range and options and I've enjoyed their beers often.  The guest beer list is sometimes excellent, sometimes not.   The servers here are well informed, and will offer advice and tastings based on what you're after. They've also provided me useful tips on where else to go in the city to drink.  The food is pretty average and you kind of feel they do it because they have to. It'll help sober you up if you're on a session.  The outside space is rare in SF and nice for those few warm evenings each year. The rest of the place is no-frills and functional.

J33uckf092i8QGMFfJhWlQ.review_text: Really good beer, but a crowded bar and parking is really difficult (it is North Beach after all).  Pub quiz is solid.

BCbPFrcdfvPEnnNoWPCdPg.review_text: Burgers are great at Rogue.....thats the only reason I go there.  Brews are pretty good as well.  I wish they had more TVs so you could watch a game there.    I also dig that little outdoor area...

qxR11D9q0u0VV-CbEz4SUQ.review_text: Chill bar.  Great beers.  Delicious chicken tenders and TOTS.    There's really not much more you can ask for at a local bar.  I've been here a couple times and while it can get busy at night, it you are going on a leisurely weekend afternoon, it's not crowded at all and seems to be a good spot to watch some football.  They do have a lot of beers to choose from but I choose to load up on the Hazelnut Brown nectar.  It's SOOO good!  The waitress made some great recommendations and deterred us from make some bad beer choices which I really appreciated.  They serve bar food, which is as you would expect, bar food caliber.  But I do have to say that their chicken tenders were perfectly seasoned and fantastically crispy.  When I come back to SF I'll be sure to stop in again!  Quick tip: don't order an entire bottle of that Voodoo doughnut stuff for yourself.  Just don't do it.

mlnqX6MzQ0FxUbcVY782ww.review_text: ROGUE HAZELNUT BROWN FTW!!!!!!  I love Rogue beers and the Hazelnut is my absolute favorite. We were up in San Francisco for the weekend and me and 10 of my friends ran across this place out of sheer luck and were so excited! We stopped in and had the beer samples which they give you on a wooden plank and you can choose 4 tasters to try for $6.50.  I was digging the cask beer they had and the rogue irish ale as well as my fav Hazelnut Brown.   This restaurant/bar is pretty crappy inside. Dirty with sub par service as noted by other patrons in the bar as well. The beer is awesome! The facility and service need work! Glad i got to check this out.

YDdRdL98frNBT7DOiicf5Q.review_text: Rogue beers are some of the best on offer in our country. Their traditional ales are solid with sometimes a bit of an edge, but their real originality comes through in more creative beers, from chocolate stouts to spicy pepper-infused (?) ales.  The best, of course, are the IPAs and double IPAs. Call me Pacific Northwestern-ish, but they're just so good.  Food is a bit overpriced but good--but why are you coming for the food? It's the beer that matters!

1cHjb13jnKv6h0USRSQS-Q.review_text: I was in town visiting for a couple days and, as a beer lover, I had to drag my parents there.   It's basically a dive-sports bar with two separate rooms. I noticed lots of Giants fans (there was a game on) and 20-30 somethings. There was a party going on in the back room. We sat in the front room, near the bar. The sound level was average. We ordered a hummus appetizer, three meals (fish tacos and burgers), and several beers.   Unfortunately the appetizer came out late and incorrectly (spinach and artichoke dip). However, the food was altogether above average for a bar, and the prices were reasonable.   Perhaps importantly, the beer selection was fantastic! Our waiter was informative in helping select from the roughly 20 beers on tap. My father ended up drinking more then usual. I sampled four or five beers. The imperial pilsner and hazelnut brown ale were my favorite.   We had a great time. I would definitely suggest this as a good cultural stop in San Francisco.

5WHeZOnIQZqbdD27oJSsRg.review_text: Had a great time on a Sunday afternoon. I recommend Definitely doing the taster trays!

x5vEK3FPbuDyNjaROq6Gyw.review_text: The beer is spectacular.  If you're a fan of New Castle or any brown ale, make sure to try the Rogue Hazelnut Brown - this is one of my favorite beers of all time!  Overall, the food is disappointing except for the Kobe burgers.  So, if you're there to eat as well as drink, split a burger with a friend or stick with something totally standard and be prepared for standard.  The Chocolate Stout Float is good if you're in the right mood, but the ice cream they used seemed more like soft-serve than real ice cream.  It is really easy to walk in at almost anytime of day and sit down without a wait.

yNmJpWHLW5eE9Xyo4f5irQ.review_text: HORRIBLE SERVICE.  Skinny little hipster kid who thinks he is too cool to be working there really but a sour taste in our mouth.  Attitude will get you no where kid...  We walked up, sat outisde, mind you this is at 3pm on a Saturday with plenty of tables...not busy.  After waiting about 10 minutes he finally comes out, tells us that if we want a menu we will need to go back inside and look at the chalk board.    Done with that place, on to the next!

Q_8qAEFkzrzTVAJhLsxmBg.review_text: Who doesn't like Rogue beer?  Well, I'm yet to meet that person... so come hither to North Beach in San Francisco.  Not only is North Beach in my top 3 favorite SF neighborhoods, but Rogue is one of my favorite beer spots in the city. Here's why...  *Brainstormer trivia Thursdays (starts at 8, but is packed by 7:30. Get there early) *Outside patio, beer-garden style... yep, it's a mess during North Beach Bar Crawl, Cal games, and warm weekends... I avoid Rogue at these times. *Right around the corner from Coit Liquor, my favorite higher-end liquor/wine store *A hop, skip, and a jump from the gorgeous Washington Square Park *A few curbside tables, perfect for people watching *Decent food menu- beer cheese soup (delish), bean dip, and pulled pork.  Thanks for being here, Rouge Ales Public House.

HWL3aKSFdDQLsxGWys2GBg.review_text: Every time I go to North Beach I either start or end my night here.   I used to go surfing on the Oregon Coast and would always stop at the Rogue Brewery in Newport. When I moved to SF and found this outpost of the Rogue Nation I was ecstatic.   Awesome Beer. Dead Guy Ale is great try it if you have not.  Thursday Trivia Night is AWESOME.... The announcer guy looks like Pete Carrol...

SEoAIVVZvnCK2igoKK1XLQ.review_text: OK they are losing a star because there aren't enough seats at the bar or it is just too spliced up - poor layout/lighting.  I admit this is unfair of me since it is North Beach and space is limited but there you go...  I haven't eaten here but I thought the food looked tasty.  I tried 3 or 4 beers and loved them all.  The bartender was super friendly (despite the fact that they were beginning to get busy) and he made a lot of great suggestions and took his time to make sure my glass was never empty.

GqJRlbga27rUpolN-SP9Ig.review_text: The wife and I dropped by the Rogue Ales Public House after we had lunch at the Swan Oyster Depot on 6/14/12.  We had been here before and enjoyed beers and drinks the last time.  We were disappointed that they no longer had their special bacon infused vodka for the bacon bloody mary, but we moved on to some beers.  Very good selection of Rogue and non-Rogue beers with emphasis on local/regional beers.  About 40 beers on draft and not sure about bottle selection.  Also, they do have the Rogue house spirits, which include gin, rum, vodka and scotch.  Service at the bar was friendly and attentive.  Great place for an afternoon drink

nqb5kKa4nHQtVq6zQZtnxg.review_text: Nasty food and weird atmosphere like a T.G.I.Fridays was here before. Bland.

4ibQ-piLVFJaUgbipYRtkA.review_text: I like. I come again. I tell friends.

YuIxTyfsCMrAMI7jrxfWsw.review_text: Recently spent an evening there with friends visiting SF from Chicago. Great fun was had. Service was great and the food... perfect.  If BART ran later, I would have stayed longer...  curse the walk to the BART station and the ride to Fremont BART.  Subtract BART from the equation, and the night at Rogue was perfect.

ZbOK_2m4kifew3lzTep1yQ.review_text: It seems that every single time I step foot in here, I'm getting stared down by some fucking assholes. PLURAL.  I walked in here because my friends told me that I could get food here, and all I wanted was some damn fried artichoke from the festival! *gag, but edible* The moment I get in, some fucking guy looks at me and goes "WHAT ARE YOU DOING", I think because I was still wearing my sunglasses. WHATEVER DOUCHE, would have been my response, but I was too busy trying not to slip on the beer ground. By beer ground I mean it was FLOODED.   And it was CROWDED. With popped collared chodes and slutty short-skirted bishes. While in line for the bathroom, one of my friends told us about the beer garden outside.   Now, when I've been drinking and around people who are fairly shy, I get mean. I mean, really, super mean. Like, example:   ::pushes girl with my purse:: Get out of my way, bitch friend that doesn't know me very well: Did you just push her? Me: Don't forget I called her a bitch friend that doesn't know me very well: You're crazy! Me: You...don't come here often, do you?  Beergarden: Not so much.   As I left and passed the patio from the sidewalk, I flipped off their customers and told them to shove it up their ass.  And promptly downed two bottles of Veuve on the rooftop of my friend's apartment looking over North Beach. I hope those rocks I threw in a drunken stupor managed to make their way over to your heads.

xW54GTfLUtxmfbPpf11oDA.review_text: Love it. And for less than $5 a beer. If I lived in SF, this would be my local bar. The service was great and it has a nice wood bar.

cqf8dqO5_QUxjfo6WiM7yg.review_text: Went in on a Tuesday night and sat at the bar. The bartender wasn't my favorite, but she'd probably been dealing with a lot of crap for the day, so I let it go.  I eyed the Voodoo Bacon Maple Ale all night (sold only in 750 mL bottles), but I had a pint of the Somer Orange Honey Ale (light, tasty), and tried the Hazelnut Brown Nectar (if you like hazelnut, this is SERIOUSLY amazing).  I'm highly considering mixing the Hazelnut Brown Nectar with the Chocolate Stout next time to make a Nutella beer. If you try it, let me know how it goes.

JoBmWW62xDOkXr2anyxfag.review_text: Stopped in for a beer while waiting for a table at Tony's. It was pretty mellow and not crowded given that it was 12 on a Saturday.   I started with a ginger beer which was delicious. After that we did a little sampler mostly for my boyfriend. But he let me sneak in a sample of the apple beer which was SO tasty.  The bartender was super nice and helpful when I asked her to recommend something.   I walk by this place every day on my walk home and it does get really crowded, so for maximum enjoyment try to go in the middle of the day when it is less rowdy. Unless that's your scene in which case Thursday night they do trivia and it is packed.

TS2j_gt5qugbmQ1R_fq6TA.review_text: Good bar and obviously great beer selection. I would never get sick of the beer selection in this joint. So easy to overlook. Definintely will come here again. and again.

zDltf7SGyDANcA6ndZkF7A.review_text: Stopped in here for a final cocktail on our North Beach bar hop. One of the great things about this place is that there is LOTS of seating which was great at the end of a long night of drinking. Sometimes I just don't feel like standing, ya know?  Good laid back crowd...would love to check this place out on a more sober note.

POE-8YwzR1OTEQBcENP1IA.review_text: i love rogue beer! once i saw this existed in SF, i went out of my way to come and get a drink. i was going to stop at 1 but the guy i was sitting next to was very nice and i ended up staying a lot longer than planned. my first drink was a dead guy ale (had to do it as it is a go-to for me)...it was pretty good but no major difference from the bottle, to me :( my neighbor then ordered the voodoo donut lemon "something" and gave me some, it was shockingly really good! the bartender recommended it, i could def see myself getting this for an afternoon drink in the summer time. after that i was able to try an IPA, i think ti was called the 7-hop? it was good! i also learned rogue is starting to distill spirits, we got whiskey shots, good, a little pricey but i'd buy a bottle in the future. the bartenders were friendly and knowledgeable, def worth a visit!

nZIyGutiTAERTCfXqfeDDQ.review_text: Great beers, sure.... but slow service and poorly done food. My american kobe burger came dry and disappointing, despite the med-rare I ordered. Blah.

lBaoq2G8xXrSX_esMQXM-A.review_text: Rogue was a happy surprise as we were wandering around North Beach looking for a new bar to check out. Just be sure to not order a Hanger One vodka, stick with the beer. My Hanger One vodka drink was $9.50 which is over the top, even for SF. My bacon bloody Mary was less but it was a bit too smokey. On average I can get a Stolie soda for around $6-7. If I wouldn't have been surprised by the $9.50 vodka I would have given them a 4 star.  The atmosphere was very nice, friendly bartender, engaging patrons, a huge selection of beers many flavors you probably haven't seen before and some good Irish Potato Nachos. The beers and food was priced well and if we go back I want to try the beer cheese soup. It looked yummy. I would recommend this place to all my beer drinking friends.

EciENvrm8vV-zrV0FxahkQ.review_text: My first night in SanFranciso this is one of the spots I hit.  I love good craft beer. After sampling 8 (had 2 flights) they were mostly bad.  The room filled up fast and the bartenders were so slow and in attentive that patrons were leaning up on me (I was sitting at the bar) to try to order.  Then, I ordered food. I tried the sampler wanting to try a few house specialties. It was horrible. The slider was a hockey puck on a rock hard bun. The sausages were oscar meryer-esque. Just bad food all arround.  I will not return.

qS3vXc7nirB28WzYyVvRBQ.review_text: This place is awesome, I love their Chipotle Ale!! It's a must try

HUpvWcERhiqk7wU_a0MShA.review_text: My bf loves Rogue beer! *  The bartender let my bf try their new Rogue Whiskey.  He said its got potential.  The 2 beers he really wanted to try - they didn't have.  But that didn't stop my honey.  Oh! No!  He just tried 2 more.  Then 2 more.  Then. . . well I think you know where this is going.      Be careful when using the women's bathroom, the lock doesn't work.  I walked in on some girl.  She didn't seem to mind.  Said she does it all the time, but I don't know, cuz later she came up behind my bf, put her hands on his hips and started to snuggle!!  Heh, we laughed cuz when she realized she was holding the wrong man, she turned bright red and ran in the other direction.   We were there on a Monday night, so there were not a lot of people, actually it was really dead after 9pm, but the music was still playing, so my baby kept on drinkin.  There are 2 pretty good sized rooms inside and a few small tables outside under heat lamps.    Bottomline:  Rogue makes good tasting beers.

kRhDpqTn11bTsv9B37rrVQ.review_text: I love the beer selection here. My favorite is the Issaquah White Frog. It has a hint of nutmeg in a weiss beer but is not over powering with sweetness like blue moon can be. I also like the voodoo cherry trippel and the chipotle flavored beer. Irish Nachos are addictive, the corn beef was cooked perfectly when I had them. All around its a cool environment to watch sports or just chill on the patio and catch some rays.

F9tOE0d09SLkCIZwt8I-0g.review_text: I dropped by this place with a group on New Years Eve. Nice place, didn't try the food, but every time I walk or drive by, I keep thinking, "is this place in the right neighborhood?"  It has a Marina feel to it, but is in North Beach. Not quite a fit.  Sure, there's a great beer list, but there's a lot of places in the neighborhood with a great beer list (read: Church Key). If the food is just average, then it has to run up against some of the other bars with better options in the bar, or just outside of the bar (read: Gino and Carlo's, or Columbus Cafe).   Maybe a location move would be in order?

ksLEtpBAdVGaEramRXYYSQ.review_text: Just went to write my review and saw the health score is a 65 out of 100.... sketchy! That being said this place has good beers. I met a friend here and the bartender was friendly, helping us navigate which beers to get. I had a burger which was good but nothing too special. I would come back here to get beers again. I don't know if I would come for dinner.

1652MDlbA0pOtsq7U1Ygow.review_text: Rogue Ales Public house is nestled nicely near North Beach and the water, 40 rotating taps, tasters, and a patio give it a great charm and a great place to share a pint. Big group? No problem the picnic benches out back have plenty of seating on the open air patio.  Rogue produces some unique beers, including one with yeast harvested from the brew master's long growth beard, dubbed simply "Beard Beer". San Francisco has lots of choices for beer, and Rogue happily takes its place as one of the top spots for great west coast ales.

CiYRhDyFbsDbWR45uv822w.review_text: Service = worse than the last time I went.  And no hot chick. :(  It was a Monday evening.....so, how could they have been *that* busy? Maybe they were busy plying the guys at the bar with beers......   Seating = bar style, and then where there are tables without the noise, it's surrounded by boxes of beer.......  Beers = still excellent selection.    Food = okay.  Bruschetta, worst one ever.  It's like they took canned tomatoes, and put it on some soft bread.....WTH!  Ew.    On the flip side, my Dachshund was good though...delicious dog with sauerkraut, mustard and ketchup on the side with crispy fries.  ($1.50 more for fries, instead of potato chips.)   Prices are a bit high for pub food.  But, it is North Beach........

dC0HyiVrnjXT3B8WCphWdg.review_text: The stars are for the beer. They have a wonderful selection.  The food on the other hand is pretty awful.  We ordered the Irish nachos, black bean dip and Kobe tacos.  All the food came out room temp. The Irish nachos were the worst of the batch.  Hardly any topping on the room temp waffle fries and the cheese (what there was of it) wasn't melted. It was just put on top of the cold fries.  The black bean dip reminds me of the retried black beans you get in a can at trader joes.  Very thick. Good thing they give you a spoon with it.  The Kobe tacos were ok, would've been great if the meat had been warm.  The come out as a mini taco bar on a plate so you can put what you want on each one.  We'll come back for the beer.

5qWqxEQNKEvnILseRufiBw.review_text: This place has a friendly, fun atmosphere and an awesome selection of beer!

xW9FffwEjfeO1-1ciyFLNg.review_text: What's not to like about a place that goes big on the beer selection but spares you the attitude? The beers here are amazing, and the ability to order flights is a cool offering that most pubs don't have. If you want to refine your palate and explore the micro-brews of the world, this is your place.  I was a little shocked to hear that the kitchen was closed when we got there... at 8:00pm. If you're not going to server food at 8:00pm, why have a menu? Nonetheless, it was a Wednesday and could have been a one time occurrence.

AFoR1tIsuRE-D5GnFCS2nA.review_text: Plenty of awesome house and guest beers on tap.  There are some interesting burgers on the menu worth checking out over regular beef.

e5fO2oe1_NBx_vq9_pJ9fA.review_text: Rogue makes some of the best ales on the planet. That's not my opinion; it's a fact. Anyone who says otherwise, either didn't try enough styles, or shouldn't be in an Ale House in the first place. In fact, to those who criticize Rogue Ale, please don't go here. You're crowding the bar. It's true the food is overpriced. Most of it's pretty good though. Better than most bars. There's a patio out back where you can have a cigarette while you drink or just get some air. As for the people who complain about having the wind blow smoke in their general direction while they eat on the patio; maybe you should try sitting at one of the DOZENS of tables they have inside.  Now, there is a douchebag factor involved here. I'm not going to knock Rogue's rating, though, because it's not their fault. I mean, it's North Beach, come on. Anyone with half a brain knows not to go there on a Friday or Saturday night. 'Lest you're into getting either beat up or date-raped by a bronzed gorilla in a polo shirt and flip flops, that is. Go to Rogue on a sunny afternoon or after work.  It comes down to this:  If someone says, "beer," and the letters that pop into your head are I, P, and A...go to Rogue. If those letters are something more along the lines of B, U, and D...go to hell.

tx407EtvKoXXEZqYQFQVJA.review_text: First off, Rogue has so many beers here that even if you hate some of them, you're bound to find one you like.  And even if you manage to hate all of Rogue's offerings, you can try one of the many guest brews they have (a practice that should be much more prevalent than it is).  Don't miss the fridge by the door where you can pick up beer to go and some other stuff (Rosemary Stout Cheddar?!).  First time I came here, I was alone & wanting to get food before BYOBW, the bartender was very cool and friendly, and she really knew her shit despite only being there about a month.  Had a few great beers and some great food.  Since then, the service and food have definitely declined.  Better pub grub is available at Magnolia & Ct Yankee, to name a couple.  The beers are still fantastic though, and those you can order & receive quickly enough, and that's enough to keep me coming back, but you may consider getting food elsewhere.

t5AFrfee1pFSgVQ8Bb05Ug.review_text: Pub quiz is definitely a fun time! I enjoy getting together with my peeps to try to out-smart other oddly named teams on a Thursday evening.  The good: - Quiz night, fun crowd, good beer, easy-going atmosphere where you can just chill with friends, about as close to my place as it could be.  The bad: -Limited seating on quiz night, the food is less than stellar (try to eat before you go if you're in for the quiz!)...the wait-staff seems overwhelmed on those nights too-- um...I think by now they should know to schedule more help on a Thursday, no?! I'd probably check this place out more often if the food was better. I mean, even the kobe blue balls were nothing special. I couldn't even taste the virgins!

Szg--2wonu3BEdIav_vbCw.review_text: A good selection of beer, kinda slow service sometimes, and decent food. I would recommend the irish Nachos as a delectable treat.

dxY_LsvkDj-sw6KRY1D6fA.review_text: Our bartender Bryce was not only extremely attractive, but he was helpful, attentive, kind, nurturing and attractive. (that was intentionally redundant) he let me try a lovely stout and some red thing. I would come here any day for the fantastic beer and Bryce's pretty face.

A7YvpaBWM2WlG0BiGh2eZw.review_text: Came here one Thursday night for trivia. The place was packed with people ready to start drinking and triviaing. Although after the night was over I felt as if i had the IQ of a 6 year old, I was not completely disappointed. I tried a couple fruity beers, watermelon and raspberry, both delicious. I hear the Rogue beers are pretty good too. Oh if you do go for trivia night, be prepared. People there are hardcore. Don't pull out your cell phone even if it doesn't have capabilities beyond a rotary phone. You'll be reported for cheating.

s3XmVL8UT5duKjPaQp43cg.review_text: I've been a fan of Rogue's ales for some time now, and recently had the opportunity to visit their public house in North Beach. I have to say I wasn't thoroughly impressed.  The inside of the building is cool, looks like some kind of old New England pub. The outside patio is nice, I'm sure it's great during a sunny day. The beer is great of course, but that's about it. There wasn't really any 'wow' factor here.  The bartender didn't cool the glasses off after they came out of the hot dishwasher, giving many people warm beer.  There were some loud, irritating Marina people screaming really, really stupid anecdotes.  Rogue has great beer, but I just can't say that I was really excited to be at the SF pub. I don't know why, but my buddy and I both agreed that the place just didn't click with us.

x_bpi_SRk-UNQ6-gfNJqnA.review_text: Came here on a Wednesday night with the Roble Fam and Anushri to chill and have some beers. It was the perfect amount of crowd.  Drinks: -Tried the Hazelenut Rum shot- DISGUSTING!! do not order this at $8/shot, this place is expensive for hard liquors. -Pineapple shot and the beers were good  Service: The bartender we had did not have the same taste as us and ordered us Jaegar shots- WHY? WHY WOULD you pick that shot? It's the worst.  Ambience: Lively for a wednesday night  -Hungry Hungry Pongy

cPwB9IY8bjdD0fukJr5mjg.review_text: Fun place.  Burgers are a tad small for the price but that's what you get for going to a tourist heavy location.   Friendly staff. I recommend getting a sample of the beer you want cuz nothing worse then getting a beer you won't enjoy.

CujsS1G2os9H1CN5-YDYlw.review_text: For a sunny day in North Beach or Nice night this place is great when the beer garden in the back is open.  After North Beach festival this place was solid to chill at and listen to music outside with the wind being blocked.  Great place to have a beer.

FtVuSS1D0rdeMtr_nf2hrw.review_text: Sat outside on a rare 'warm' day during my visit to SF. Unfortunately they still had the heaters on overhead so it was a bit hot sitting outside after a long walk and the sun out. Beer was of course good and the service was adequate. The bathroom was fairly nasty for a place like this at 5pm. Smelled of urine and was rather dirty. I'd perhaps expect this at 1am, but not at 5pm. Overall, a fine experience, just not impressive.

v3Aeeo4vjAIPrjqFpYKTpw.review_text: I was very glad when the cab we took to North Beach dropped us off outside this Pub. We were pleasantly surprised to find seating at a table on a busy Saturday afternoon. They beer list on the large board on the wall was intimidatingly long - but a good excuse to fire up my "Beer Cloud" app on the phone. I enjoyed the Chatoe Single Malt Ale (even if the name made me expect a more caramelly than hoppy flavor - my bad) and really enjoyed the Morimoto Soba Ale. I'm excited to try more of the beers crafted in collaboration with Chef Morimoto. Unfortunately the quality of the pub didn't match the beers on offer. I went back to check out the beer garden, and it was a pretty small and unremarkable patio. The bathroom situation was also pretty dire, with one single-person bathroom to serve both genders for the entire beer garden and back room. Expect a line for each visit. The waitress did her best to keep us happy, but she didn't get much help. She came by twice to ask if everything was okay *after* I'd ordered my second and was sitting with an empty glass. She was obviously a bit pissed off at the bartender for taking so long, and was gracious enough to buy me the Soba - for that she got a good tip. I'd come back if it was quiet and I could grab an outside table on the street. Otherwise I'll just keep buying their beers at the liquor store.

yBkPu1ixpZt8lM4YhHC1lg.review_text: Brew sampler was awesome. Better yet, the tatter tots that were spewing over the plate.  Those things were delicious.

--4q8EyqThydQm-eKZpS-A.review_text: BAH!  I've gone to Rogue at least 3 times over the past year and I don't foresee myself going back anytime soon. Why?  1. the wait service sucks. one time my husband and i walked in, sat down and weren't acknowledged for about 10 minutes. We left and went to Kennedy's down the road. This week the service was in and out. At one point the waitress chatted with someone for awhile before we could get her attention.  2. The food sucks. Last Thursday we stopped in for food and drinks. The buffalo wings are about as original as the Trader Joe's frozen kind but were overcooked. The Mac n Cheese is $5 but is clearly and distinctly Kraft mac n cheese from the blue box. No joke. There is no attempt to disguise it as anything but. The mac n cheese came with chips that were definitely of the Ruffles variety. Most were crumbly and broken. I guess from the bottom of the bag. My husbands Kobe beef burger was decent but dry.   3. The place is a little sticky in terms of cleanliness.  4. The beer that I wanted was out. Most of the selections had been wiped off. And really if you specialize in beer, most of your menu should be available. (They had some issues with the menu too - 3 items not available that night...)  One highlight - They have the cheapest Lambic Framboise in an SF resto/pub house/bar (that I've seen) at $7. It cost slightly less at Bevmo which means that they aren't really marking it up all that much. I can appreciate that.  With so many "specialty beer microbrew lala" places in SF, Rogue should try a bit harder. At least have decent bar bites or bring those prices down. $5 for Kraft mac n cheese? C'mon now.

X8EaFdIcMn3hYdlH0hJQ7w.review_text: I love rogue beer but realistically I couldn't give this place more than 3 stars because it's nothing special.  It's just your standard pub that serves mediocre pub food.    It's worth a visit if you are a fan or if you are looking for a specific Rogue brew that isn't available elsewhere....but besides that it's just standard fare

s68gS-VemqPh8cOrMpvl-w.review_text: What can I say?  I MISS THIS PLACE!!!  I used to live about a block and a half away, and I would frequent this place at least three times a month.  I usually get the bacon cheese kobe burger medium well.  My favorite brew?  It's a toss up between the hazelnut brown nectar, or the Morimoto imperial pilsner.  The fries were good as well, especially with the malt vinegar.  I really miss going here...

3xIp5NtPZJwsreyrktCjPw.review_text: I really wanted to like this place.  It's a nice looking bar, and while Rogue isn't my favorite brewery, they do make some tasty brews.  The big problem I had there was the beer lines aren't maintained.  I mean, it tasted like it hadn't been clean in several months.  That really ruins the taste, and I found much random debris floating in my beer.  I would think a brewery would want the best possible taste for all their beers for consistency. And the service at the bar is horrendous.  The two times I've been, the bartenders were more interested with what was on TV or playing with their iPhones.

RaSq7WPbxH7Dm5yfVBAgYw.review_text: I like that you can seat yourself here. At 10pm on a Saturday night, there was still a table open which we grabbed immediately. There is a waiter too, so we soon got our drinks on. All of the rogue beers are listed on the chalkboard at the front of the bar and we just went through the list getting things we thought sounded good.  The hazelnut one .... DESSERT in a cup. The reason why dessert has 2 s's because you want another. That's the same with this drink. The juniper one is also good.... anyways, just come here and go down the list. It's great with friends, so you can take sips of each other's drink.

3aur17CDgFoedYmmAl-3lQ.review_text: Given, it was North Beach Festival, and we have already been "hanging out" on the lawn, illegally drinking out of God-knows-what, but Rogue Alehouse was so much fun! It felt like tailgating (I mean, granted it was 3 PM during the North Beach Festival), and there was a massive outside area with a bar to bask in the sunlight. With mini-plastic cups that stated "ROGUE" all over them!  One awful part, which is a given, was the bathrooms-- the line seriously took half an hour, guys and girls had to share the same one, AND it was in the tiny hallway you have to go through in order to cut to the back open area! However, we shotgunned a beer, so we liked the tiny, cramped bathroom (which, btw, fits three) in the end. And I guess you can meet a lot of people in line. Besides that, I like Rogue and I will visit again!

5pDWRml60HXhuwGx9lEhiw.review_text: We had a lovely experience here! Ordered two different flights of beer and got to sample lots of Rogue ales (didn't realize there were so many). Good thing we checked Yelp first so we knew to have lunch elsewhere.  It's a great place for beer. Sit at the bar and talk beer talk with the bartender and you'll do juuuuust fine at Rogue.

VOYvD-kerR204k0WrR0J3A.review_text: Solid beers... actually.. very solid... really good...  Didn't try any food.  The one big negative was the price... $7 bucks per pint... Seems really pricey for me....  That might be the reason we don't go back...

xpRAjmgL-pIcIY_9iOpcQw.review_text:
I used to spend quite a bit of time there as my ex lived directly above it.  As a result I've spent several months being "persona non grata" in North Beach.  But apparently there are no longer any hard feelings so I can revisit my favorite neighborhood again.  Yay!
  So I ate there last night.  The menu has changed drastically.  Used to be burgers, club sandwiches, reubens etc.  Now it's a 4-page monster of a list with entrees, mussels, Cioppino,roasted chicken etc.  Really very impressive.  But I still had a burger because I know they're tasty and wasn't in a mood for experimentation.
  I really want to give them 1 star and here's why.  Not feeling like beer I ordered a Beefeater Tonic.  Waitress brings me a Beefeater Soda.  I point this out to her and she says:
  "I told the bartender Tonic and Soda weren't the same thing."
  Duh.
  She comes back 5 minutes later and says that they don't have any tonic.  I ask how they can run out of tonic at 6PM, and she clarifies:
  "We're not out of it...we don't stock it."
  Disbelieving I go in and check with the bartender....the guy who thought Tonic and Soda were the same thing.  He assures me that there's no tonic in the house.
  Now I understand that they're a microbrew house and specialize in beer.  But they do offer a full bar.  But no tonic.  It's been 18 hours and I'm still baffled and confused.  How can a bar not have tonic water?  That's kind of like not having ice.
  So as much as I want to give them 1 star, they do let me bring my pup onto the patio so they get an extra 1... grudgingly.
  No tonic?
  Baffled.

79z384FdfV4b9gemrClKgA.review_text: Had the beer taster - really nice because you can taste any beer on the menu.  Kobe beef tacos were great.  Rogue Whisky was also really good.   They have Trivia night that I would like to check out!

crJ7BrS-0qBZanKOgFXTRA.review_text: Was very happy to find Rogue open on Chritmas Eve, since I had to work.  The place was pretty empty due to the holiday but the bartender was great, helping us with beer selections and even honored our request for some football on the TV.  My co-worker doesn't like beer and the bartender was great helping her find some ciders and crap like that for her to get her buzz on.  I gonna have to disagree with most, I think there burgers aren't that great (not including the Kobe), nothing really that special about them. This time I went with the chicken strips and that killed my beer munchies just fine!!

WALNtcSZlONK4Yj-o3pzKA.review_text: Remember when M Night Himalayan came out with "I see dead people" and everyone was like awwwww snap but then he steadily degraded to the point of the un-homage that was Avatar: The Last Airbender and everybody was like "wth was that"?  Bacon Maple Doughnut Ale was Bruce Willis x the kid from A.I.; Chocolate Peanut Butter Banana Ale is something that should not surface in discussion. Unless it's during a round of Cards Against Humanity.  I understand craft brews are about subtle complexity. I get that. But if you were looking for subtle, you wouldn't be reaching for a big, bright pink bottle with loud illustrations and the word "voodoo" on it in the first place. CPBBA had every opportunity to stick the peanut butter in the chocolate and vice versa, phone home with Reese's pieces & cups, and throw in Donkey Kong for good measure, all of which it needed to do. But it didn't. You could accidentally spill some coffee in your Tecate and end up with a comparable swig. Plus more hipster points. Tecoffee. Coffate.

1B6_nsdtF7ogQtOTho4U5Q.review_text: Now having been to Rogue a few times, I've realized how much of a dent it makes in my wallet. I'm happy to pay $5 to $6 for their pints of original and good quality brew, but not all the time and with no happy hour options, time is limited. Also, the prices for food are a little too high for the proportions you get. Prices are also inconsistent with the service-- although wait staff and bartenders have always been easy going, if it's busy, which it usually is, they have a tendency to not really look at you when you're trying to order something or blow off requests.  So I'm knocking a star off of a five-star rating, which is what Rogue would deserve if judged on quality of beers and food alone, because a.) lack of happy hour b.) high prices for sub-par service.  Perfect place for the occasional special beer, or to bring people who like beer, but not somewhere you could go regularly unless you've got a special budget for microbrews.  Favorites: Imperial stout, bruschetta on home-made beer bread

FyFJr-KZ9j3CVruMfu1Ukw.review_text: Great northwest beer on tap. Some people commented on the lack of service, which is in correct. Lack or cleanliness they also commented on but hey it's a stinkin hippie bar. What do you expect?! Great beer. Decent service.

GtQuA0QRg3NPWul5XF6b3w.review_text: If you are a beer lover, or if your significant other wants to work on their beer belly, than there is no better stop in San Francisco than the Rogue Ales Public House in North Beach to get your fill of delicious Oregon beer. Try the Shakespeare Stout, Double Dead Guy Ale, or Imperial Porter when ready to drink some complex, delicious, multifaceted tasty small-brew. The look of the brew house was born out of a local watering from days of old when the SF locals would hit this spot for after work relax'n from the docks. Take note of the worn old bar, and delicious smell of burgers wafting in from the kitchen. This may not be a first date spot, but it will for sure 'hit the spot,' when you are ready to get down and dirty with some real food and tasty Oregon small batch brew.

RQR-bncvVssevK_WIPWvCA.review_text: Stopped in here before dinner at WashBAG. Lots of beers they don't sell at the store, and nice old-timey feel. This building has seen a lot.

YBJP6HgzMfOB0lBt3FmKzQ.review_text: Listen up.  I come here once a week on Thursdays for Brainstormer Trivia.  If this place didn't have Rick Tosh hosting trivia and a totally kick ass location smack dab on Washington Square, I don't know how it would stay afloat.  If Elephant and Castle's Thursday night trivia didn't begin at the ungodly time of 6:30, I would DEFINITELY be there instead.  I consider myself to be a serious beer aficianado.  That said, I haven't found even many out of the FOURTY FOUR beers on tap brewed by Rogue that I actually enjoy including: Mocha Porter, Shakespeare Stout, BullFrog Ale, Morimoto (all of them), Dead Guy Ale, Half-e-Weizen, Chocolate Stout, Brutal Bitter, Imperial Porter, HazelNut Brown Nectar, et cetera.  Drinking their brews can be compared to drinking a cheap wine: good beginning, with a miniscule hint of taste in between, and absolutely no finish.  None.  You're like "did I just drink warm water?"  EVERY beer there is like that.  Dark in color but more flavorless than Busch Light.  Service on Thursdays is just about as bad as you can get.  Granted, the place is packed with crazy trivia goers who employ every last folding chair stacked against the wall but ugh.  It's like the waitstaff doesn't want you to ask for a beer or order the food because you'll find out how bad they are.  That's the only rationale that makes sense to me!  Food sucks.  Portions are always tons smaller than you'd expect for the price and this is bar food.  Like more than 5 fries would be appreciated to accompany the water...errr I mean beer...that I am drinking.    That said- anyone wanna go to Trivia at Rogue on Thursday night?

CkA-VbqMwhcuWokg5Txf6g.review_text: Nice guys at the bar all the time.  The beer list is relatively small compared to some places I've been to but perfectly chosen to fulfill most people's wants.  They always have a new and exciting beer coming up on tap.  The food that I've had here is solid but not mind blowing.  I recommend the Rogue Dip.

SSf1Imy7J_u1IMIPEO_DMg.review_text: I recommend that blue balls sandwhich (kobe meatballs with marinara on a hoagie) and the soba ale (golden ale, slightly sweet) to go with it.  good service, fairly priced food for the portions, pricy beer (but it's home brewed so that's that).  Love the open floor plan and the fact that the ceilings are high enough where there isn't the usual restaurant din--you can actually hear people talk here even if there's a game on and the bar's packed.

MFmpgDOynM8R9xGG-71i4Q.review_text: The good: cheap, quality beer. The bad: service. Came in around noon on a Saturday. Fairly empty in here. Not that they were rude or negative or anything, but good granny, it took an act of GOD to get another beer. Finally, we just kind of gave up. By the time you got your next beer, your buzz was so far gone, you'd think you walked in on your grandmother on the toilet. Anyway, it was probably a fluke. They had about 20 or 30 kinds of beer on tap. What a great selection. Rogue makes some of the best beers too. The prices were very reasonable. They also did 4 small samplers at a low price. But you get to choose the beers (most places won't let you do that.) It was a great looking bar, as well. I like the old warehouse feel of it. Anyway, I'd go back, but with a cautious eye as to the service. I think the next trip would warrant a solid 4 stars, instead of the 3.5 I am honestly feeling at the moment. Yay beer!

cdlfQYOmHapnIb1YTb8x2Q.review_text: Rogue has really delicious beers. I recommend the flights in particular, so you can sample several of them. I stupidly left my backpack on their front seating sidewalk area and Rogue was nice enough to hold it for me. Much obliged.

Y3u-FdtcM86GtsWA6mrnuw.review_text: I've been coming here nearly every week for a while now. Monday-Thursday this is a great spot for locals. They have some of the best beer in the City. Its a great place to watch the Giants games. Their bar food is expansive and pretty darn good, although you can't fool me with that Kobe beef (there isn't any in the US). Find out when Crystal is working the tables, she will take good care of you. The bartenders are all spot on and the regulars make for great conversation.  This is my new favorite watering hole. I wish parking didn't suck so bad, but hey, that's North Beach for you.

Byo0hbnRlg0pRTUpZDYJfQ.review_text: Beer. Lots of Beer.  We went here after already getting pre-sloshed at Boss of the Sauce. Given that I had a lunch consisting of pasta sauce and skinny breadsticks, and had already pre-gamed slightly at Toronado, I was a little concerned about repeating my Halloween night run-for-the-toilet marathon. All the same, the allure of "more beer" always makes me forget about the consequences, and continue to live in the now. Thus, I went.  I had some tasty pints (though I was expecting this since I've had a fair amount of Rogue out of bottles before). Thankfully, I also got to fill my stomach with some pretty basic and OK bar food (wings, fries, black bean dip). Nothing awesome, and the bean dip was not really good at all, but it did add some much needed ballast to prevent me from punting.  Our waiter was a total pimp for giving one of the guys we went with the end of the keg (which was nearly a full pint) for free! Waiter-dude, you ROCK!  Place wasn't too packed, but then again, its tough to find alcoholics on a Sunday afternoon (excluding Irish priests and bums of course). Decor was um...nominal? Nothing spectacular, but nothing cheezy or tacky either. Prices were reasonable - good place to grab a pint if you are in the area.

Wrx6al6Q5rO5E9FMP6a4ZQ.review_text: Walking into Rouge Alehouse you know that you are not in a fine drinkery.  The haggard wooden bar and jaded floor make for a homely drinking experience.
