Every time I've stopped by the crowd has been vexatious.  That being said, I always go back because I do like a few Rouge beers.    The beer list is divided into Rouge and non-Rouge offerings. All the non-Rouge offerings can be gotten elsewhere for less. Even Budweiser, advertised as the "King of Beers" is on the list. Be forwarded,  Rouge uses Pacman yeast in every beer they make, therefore, all the beers have a similar taste. There are a few gems like the Juniper pale ale. The beer has a light body with a slightly floral hop character. The dead guy ale is another classic, however, the heavy malt makes it difficult to drink more than one.  Rouge also distills a Hazelnut rum based on the brown ale that is dangerously good, sip a shot.   One of the huge pluses of this place is Rouge nation, the beer club you join if you tour the brewery in Newport, Oregon. Present your card while wearing a Hawaiian shirt  any Tuesday and get a free beer, that's right a free beer, every Tuesday. On your birthday you get a free liter. You get discounts on pints and merchandise as well. Cool spot to stop by once in a while, but not a regular destination.

UvRUygcyvpJuHh1BiZrrbQ.review_text: Rouge is awesome. Has great beers and on Thursday's they have Trivia night which is seriously the most fun ever! It gets crowded those nights so get there at 7 PM.

N1X8FAfX0fTI2K4z9EQo6w.review_text: Hello, my name is Joel and I'm a beer snob. And since I spent my formative beer drinking years in Oregon with several microbreweries a stone's throw from my place/student apartment/squat/hovel, Rogue beers have always been kind of my poison.   The Mocha Porter is to beer what The Great Gatsby is to literature. It's a classic, and if you feel a little more enlightened and inspired after partaking in it. Even the worst Rogue (Dead Guy Ale) would be among the better offerings at other brewpubs.  The dinner menu, much like the Lakers, is all about Kobe. Yes, I know techincally it's Wagyu beef, but that's sort of like saying that champagne made in Napa is techincally California Sparkling wine. If you're not a beef eater, then this probably isn't the place you want to have dinner at but it shouldn't deter you from coming for a drink or two. I had the Kobe Beef Cheeseburger, which was approximately the size of the actual city of Kobe, Japan, and left overstuffed. My girlfriend had the fish tacos, and received a portion of fish slightly larger than a postage stamp. It was a real intersting juxtaposition. Another friend of mine ordered the Bleu Ball Sandwich, and the waiter had a "Oh like I haven't heard that 500,000 times" look on his face as we laughed for five minutes like 4th graders. For the record, the Bleu Balls were surprisingly dry.  All in all, this place is a rareity a brewpub with decent food. I'd go more often, if I lived closer.

e1FuiYSV1v29q2OTR9ojBA.review_text: Thirty-two beers on tap!  Did you hear me?    THIRTY-TWO BEERS ON TAP!!  (Which basically makes Rogue Ales Public House the Baskin Robbins of hops & barley brews.)    My friend, who I hadn't seen in about six years, and I caught up over some beers here at Rogue, which was somewhat empty (it was a weekday) but had a very friendly bartender gal manning the taps.  She started us off with a tasting of a chipotle ale.  I ended up having this really delicious Morimoto Soba Ale (brewed with buckwheat, hence the "soba" part), tasted some of the Chocolate Stout, and had some Raspberry Lambic (I love, love, LOVE this stuff).    About $5.50 per glass, they sell bottles too and also carry Budweiser, Corona, and Miller Light for those of you who think microbrews are too high-falutin.

tviRa0oeyDx0-LmKwsHJnw.review_text: this place has great beer, come for the beer and stay for the... well beer. ate at this spot once, and it was standard bar fare, but overpriced.  but you are in north beach, why would you even think about eating at a brew pub anyway.  one word here...BEER!

sIRCHraUB3GREUlIr2A4xQ.review_text: exactly right: no frills, straight bar atmosphere - a great place to begin your beer-loving needs and try everything on their menu - their descriptions were very helpful on the chalkboard on what was bitter, what went well with what, and what to expect. the bartender didn't seem too interested in talking to us, which was fine since we were in a group anyway.

M1kcAY9SvMVpr1yvo2zqww.review_text: First off, the beer here is some of the best in city. I have probably been 6 or 7 times and will continue to come back for the beer and the decent food (specifically Irish Nachos).  That said...I have never had a good service experience at Rogue. The bartenders are almost always stand-offish, not matter how busy they are. I dropped $100 on beers here, with a good tip, and not so much of a thank you from the guy. If you sit down at a table, its very hit or miss whether or not you are going to get a server. I hate ordering from the bar when sitting at a table because I feel that I am screwing the server out of tips, but I do it more often than not here because the service is so hit or miss.

540VuKzC16ma4eaY936B5A.review_text: Went here for the first time to sample the Thursday trivia night and a few pints. The atmosphere is like a TGI Friday's...generically open space not conducive to mingling with anyone else. Add to that the over-amped music and mic, the lame old guy behind the mic, and the slowness of the whole process, and you got yourself a wasted Thursday night.  If you want to go someplace that would be right at home in a Wyoming witness protection program, look no further. If you want a good place to go to chill with your friends and talk up the other patrons, this ain't gonna do ya.  Think I'll take my trivia game elsewhere next time.

8ilYdOcteBu4Hoa0veVNpA.review_text: Meh.  came here with a big group. tried everyones beer, didn't like any except for their dead guy ale.   I had some cocktail that tasted like water.   Place seems really old and dingy.

iIwao3SEc-cXuyKogRgXlw.review_text: Last Saturday was my first time at this place. I'd say the decor was fine like other bars. But there are so many kind of beers for you to select.  Sadly, i have to give this place only 2 stars.  First, Service was slowww...We sat ourself and waited for someone to come to our table up to 10 mintues, Is this kind of service will you get from the bar? if you want to keep customer happy, "friendly and fast" will meet  the need of customer.  Beers : there is no drink menu only you have to look from the chalkboard which we didn't seat in the bar, and our table was away from it, hardly for me to select. However, we decided to try beers sample. I couldn't remember all but i did like Juniper Pale Ale,very smooth and easy for me to drink ( i am not a Beer fan btw. ) second drink was Mocha Porter, a bittersweet balance which i did enjoy.   Prices are a bit high but well, it is North Beach area so it isn't surprise me.

cB5NqNNdfJwAUcuR0Jdnmw.review_text: Rogue is a nice local pub with it's own unique creations of Ales, Lagers, and stouts. I can only describe the decor as if it was designed by the love child of a movie loving Irish man and his Hawaiian wife. I was a bit excited to try out the food here, especially since they boasted an assortment of Kobe beef burgers on the menu.      I don't know about you silly San Francisco people, but "in Sacramento, when you are asked how you want your meat cooked, and you say medium rare, you get medium rare." I especially like how the server asks us if it being pink in the middle is OK?... *pause* ...wait for it. .....waaaaaaait for it. .....waaaaaaaaaaaaait for it. ***nothing***       What the.... really?      I was disappointed to get a delicious chunk of Kobe beef turned into  a gray, ash colored slab of disappointment. I do admit the nice thick slices of bacon was absolutely delicious. The mushrooms were a nice compliment, and the bun was soft and in good taste. It was 30 minutes of anticipation that left my put away wet and yearning.      So back to the love child. Typical local pub that brews it's own stuff. They have their specials in chalk listed behind the bar wall. They offered a large assortment of favorites with wacky names. The patio, aka beer garden, had tiki torches while the back room leading to it had like a floral type print near the television. The rustic wooden tables and chairs sorta had an Irish feel to it... like that of a cat eating you while the devil eats the cat... or perhaps like a an Asian restaurant strategically positioned next to a veterinarian hospital.       The top shelf of the bar is filled with Oscar trophies, while the bathroom is a small rectangular room with as much class as a card board box.        The service was a bit slow. The food, the drinks, the order taking took longer that it should. It even took forever just to give them my money so we can leave. The selection of beers and friendly atmosphere makes me want to give Rogue a 4 star rating... but the poor service, the food, and questionable decor brings down my review.

ijN0HvimGAjbo7qNjmS1yg.review_text: I will compliment them because a couple of their beers are just amazing. The White Pig and Morimoto imperial pilsner are world class beers. Unfortunately they don't always have them and they charge 6.50 for a 12 oz glass of them.  That's the best I have to say about this place. They simply charge way too much and oversell their supposedly high grade ground kobe beef. I tried one of these "amazing" 13 dollar burgers to find that it was slightly overcooked and dry. The flavor was ok but I would probably charge no more than 7 dollars with it, including fries.  The place is in a prime location so they probably survive on foot traffic which is also why they get away with being SEVERELY understaffed. They have one server during dinner time for the whole place and EVERYTHING TOOK FOREVER!  I don't blame the waiter who was working his ass off, I blame a likely cheap ass management not wanting to have more staff and charging too much for their less than stellar menu.

Job-gw1qrbWNDdvrJVBQAQ.review_text: On a rare, warm SF night, the outdoor beer garden is a great meeting spot for a group of friends. The patio can accomodate a party of 40+ people and the wait staff is happy to split tabs so you don't end up paying for the wasted guys bar bill.  If it's not warm, and you can't sit outside, don't bother.

NkVYcoaThHjOfTTgq6OdHQ.review_text: i remember when this little brewery first came into north beach. i didn't have a desire to try it out at first, but finally went inside recently for a birthday party. i agree with the other Yelpers, the atmosphere definitely could be warmer (or something) but i really loved their beers. there were a few i sampled and they were all pretty good. we didn't try the food so i can't comment on that, but if anything i say go for the beers.

HWlw6tmDA3qDhHatR_9zfw.review_text: Let's be honest... If you go here and order anything other than a simple sandwich, burger, fries, wings, you're a retard. It's a brewery. The food won't be good. Also, if you go here and order a mixed drink... Sorta foolish. It's obvious from the reviews that there are a lot of people who don't get it. It's also pretty obvious that there are a lot of people who don't like microbrews.  Now, if you're here to drink beer, and maybe have a nice burger and some fries, you're at the right place. Great selection of Rogue's beers at decent prices. Tasty burgers. Kobe beef burger is very good, but probably not worth the price. Standard burger is almost as good, and definitely worth the price. When I went, the service was pretty good. My server offered a bunch of small taster cups of the beers I was interested in without being prompted, and was very friendly and low-key. Awesome digital jukebox with tons of less common songs. Atmosphere isn't great, but then again I wasn't there to meet people, just to drink good beer with friends.  This place is perfect for a walk from BART to whet the appetite, and a walk back to BART to sober one's self. 4/5 stars, given that you know to NOT order anything classy off the menu, and to drink beers. Ask for a taste of any beer before you buy a pint (grown up baskin robbins), and you can't go wrong.

4Fyf9qPOqjpYofVqNVQfgA.review_text: Beer good. Food not so good. I had the Kobe burger with some "award winning" cheese...on what tasted like a soggy Wonder Bread bun. Way to ruin the world's best beef, guys. But did I mention the beer was good? If they only served beer I'd give it four stars.

wKErPjLewQi_dOVs4YxDgw.review_text: A great beer bar in North Beach. Awesome knowledgeable bartenders who can help talk you to just the right beer for you. We went on a weeknight so the bar was pretty quiet and low key, but I can definitely see this place getting super packed with beer snob hipsters on weekends.

gtOvKs1uu45JovYulLXpDA.review_text: Having a bunch of Rogues that aren't easily available is great!  The crowd was...not so great.  I guess it sort of is redundant to complain about the techfrat community in SF, but we ended up leaving because my companions couldn't stand being there with them.  So.

C7h0hiVKMFmnmDi9z4Ik9w.review_text: A haiku* about Rogue  The food here is shit Except for the beer cheese soup The beer is damn good  *I think haikus are 5/7/5  ******edited 11/11/07****** Hadn't been to the North Beach Rogue in awhile and went yesterday.  Apparently they have changed their beer cheese soup recipe.  My review should now read ALL THEIR FOOD IS CRAP (really, really bad, and I'm not that picky), but they do have some mighty fine beers.  Only one star though as I expect more and their food is bad enough to justify negative stars even if their beer is 5 star!

nM1Ldn0n4zdv8kl0K8sXDQ.review_text: I've been to Rogue a few times now and the place has always been mediocre, but Saturday night hit a new low.  They were a bit busy because there was a Beer Week event going on where they had special beers to taste, but it wasn't too crazy.    When I arrived my friends had been there for an hour or so, ordering drinks only.  The girl who originally had come up and asked for their order had apparently told them that "they could just order drinks from the bar if they wanted."  A little rude, but okay, they were busy.    After I arrived, my boyfriend and I decided to order some food.  I finally got the attention of the girl who my friends had said originally tried to take our order and referred us to the bar.  She stared at me blankly and said, "Well, I'm not your server."  I asked if she could send us our server.  About 20 minutes or so later with no servers in sight, my boyfriend grabbed the same girl again and said, "So... you're not our server. Can you send us our server?"  She replied, clearly irritated: "She'll be right out.  We're really busy."  And walked away.  Another 15 minutes or so went by, and we grabbed a different server, a guy, and told him that we weren't sure who our server was, but were trying to order food.  He disappeared and sent yet another guy to help us.  Finally, our food order was in!  When the food arrived, it tasted okay... a little bland, and too pricey, but okay.  My boyfriend's $14 Kobe cheeseburger was the real culprit.  He was up all night sick with food poisoning.  Do yourself a favor and check out one of the many other wonderful bars and microbreweries in SF.  This one isn't worth your time.

1CGs6cm50HMdLvOSxxznwQ.review_text: I'm on the fence. Three stars seems too little, yet four stars seems like too many. Let me first discuss the beer. Rogue makes some good beers. In my opinion, their darker beers far surpass their other ale varieties. I got the sampler which allows you to choose 4 of their extensive list of beers. My sampler ($8) included the Hazelnut Brown Ale, Mocha Porter, a Hefeweizen, and the Hop Red. By far, my favorite was the Mocha Porter. Not only do they have a lot of their own beers, but they have some guest beers on tap as well.   You can't really beat the location either. North Beach is lovely and a beer place like this suits it well. This place is a nice way to conclude a day at Coit Tower or in the park.   So, why 3.5 stars and not higher? The bartenders were a bit inattentive. One was even complaining about one of the other local brewers. I know many of the local brewers and thought this was in poor taste to be on the clock talking trash about one of them. The bathroom situation is also a little frustrating. One stall for men and one for women. This means you should plan to wait in line or hold it if it is a busy day such as the weekend. I will come back and would suggest it to others who are in the area.

lAT-tukjZxMm8WDcUkAlTQ.review_text: I went here purely for the beer. I passed it about a week ago, and noted it for a Saturday spot I should visit. Last night, saturday, I checked it out. There a big history for the beer here. They have a book that explains every beer they make, the story behind it, the history of the type of beer in general, and the season that it usually comes out. I read through the whole book last night mainly because it had funny quotes of beer relation.  I started off with a sampler. Short and sweet to the point. I tried the top list of Rouge beers. I must say that I was happy with all of them. Their bitter and stout were top nouch. The amber could have been a little more less sucky. I also tried a sample of their barley wine -- think beer with a higher alcohol content. Oh barley wine, how do I love you, let me count the ways. This is the highlight of the tastings.   The beer is brewed out of a breweries in Oregon. This is a satellite bar/restaurant. The crowd appears to be a range of family, beer drinkers, and friends pregaming. I ordered the Pull Porn sandwich. It was ok, what I would expect from bar food.  Go for the beer! Enjoy the beer!

_4bAXtcwUkU9Fw_fU4ojgg.review_text: the bf bought their hazelnut brown ale from bevmo a few weeks ago and we absolutely loved it.  he was pretty happy when he found out it was local.  we were in north beach last night for sketch fest at cobbs so we stopped by rogue for some beer before heading over to the show  the selection is awesome.  we had the hazelnut brown ale, mocha stout, dogfish chicory stout and sampled the morimoto soba ale.  YUMMY. :) i'm usually not a big beer drinker but doghouse has some quality brews.  the price is not bad either.   it wasn't crazy loud in there which makes hanging out nice.  the decor is casual not  fancy. you could also sit outside and enjoy your beer as well.  the only downside from our visit last night was the annoying drunks sitting next to us.    5 stars for the beer :) we didn't try the food but i'm sure we'll be back.  Update: Finally tried their food - hazelnut brown ale bread and mozzarella cheese and the kobe blue balls sandwich.  Blah... not good.  food wise i could probably give it a 2 maybe 3 stars.  maybe just stick with appetizers or sides - fries, tatar tots, etc... we did come across their garage sale and bought a case of double mocha stout for $30!  scored!   beer is still great!

w_la0a-F1GCgQgh3qzm_9w.review_text: There is nothing too special about this place.  They were out of a lot of their signature beers but they had pear cider, which is always good with me.  The food menu is pretty standard but a little overpriced.  Our server was very friendly.

cFQDeYUQXXx2iUfyOvO6ig.review_text: This was a nice stop after a long day of walking around the city on a grand tour for a friend who was visiting.  I was hoping to get some satisfying Italian food in North Beach but everything was either full or out of our price range- Rogue Brewery to the rescue!    The service was SO SLOW but it seemed like there was only one server for the Saturday night dinner shift- so maybe not the server's fault, but very bad planning for the restaurant.  The beer was good- huge selection- but I was merely satisfied, not impressed, by the rest of the place....average setting, average food (a little overpriced, felt like they were taking advantage of their spot in North Beach without providing the extra effort to make it worth it), but a good crowd pleaser if you're looking for an easy drinking spot.

vCUoCI-EEzQll46217kvFA.review_text: Beer = 5 stars. Tons of Rogue beers and other microbrews on tap. Awesome.  Food = 1 star. They have a bunch of Kobe beef items on the menu. I ordered a Kobe burger, medium rare. It came out well done. What the f@$k's the point of serving Kobe beef if you don't know how to cook it properly? What a waste.

sOhv5LHFsyf8t1JpgnocMQ.review_text: Interesting bar/restaurant in North Beach. They have an interesting American food menu that is decently priced and also expensive. I had a blue cheese hamburger and lemonade. Nice atmosphere. I went to SF Nerd Nite there where we played board games.

hsvqj_apa0xEi9gUoH8TKw.review_text: I was ready to love this place.  I love Rogue brews and we were starving when we got to the Public House.  Unfortunately, across the street in the park was a jazz concert.  We weren't alerted when we were planning our trip and we found that Rogue was only serving 4 or 5 menu items.  I felt like Clark Griswold when confronted with the Wally World moose.  Here we were completely hungry in a strange city with no transportation options except our feet (or a cab, I guess, we hadn't figured out the buses yet).  We were stuck with Rogue unless we wanted to take our chances finding something to eat (not fast food) in the next 30 minutes.  We were stuck with Rogue and their appetizer menu.  We decided on a couple of Kobe sliders and a basket of fries.  Not exactly the experience or meal we were looking for when we decided upon Rogue.  The sliders were alright, nothing special, kind of a waste of Kobe beef.  The fries came with a garlic cream sauce that was pretty good, but the fries weren't anything special.  Now the beer selection was very good as one would expect.  But the beer was served in plastic cups which, if it's not, should be a crime.  Who wants to drink a good beer in a little collapsible clear plastic cup.  That plastic cup cost them a star and really makes me question eating a $20 entree  from Rogue.  I'd be willing to give the Public House another shot when an event wasn't happening across the street.  But, I'm a little wary because even after compensating for larger crowds, they still didn't do a good job serving us quality food and drink.

WSaXBx-Zei0Nq-9_8U6juQ.review_text: Rouge...you have some delicious delicious brews on tap!  I just moved here from the Northwest and was familiar with Rogue up there so I was pleased to see you had a location in SF as well. Awesome. Staff is friendly, knowledgeable about beer, and the location is great. Prices are appropriate for a brewery and I liked how much space there was inside. Great place to enjoy some drinks with friends and catch a game on one of their several TV's. Their bathroom is very small though and there is only just one unisex one. I do have some different ratings on this place though:  5 stars- for their beer quality and options (massive menu!)  4 stars - for service (sometimes can be a bit slow and we were missing silverware and were not given extra plates for our appetizer)  2 stars - for food. It's a bit overpriced for the quality. Sounds tasty on the menu, but honestly, it's mediocre. My group and I decided we will not be getting food here again, just not worth it. Beer is amazing, we'll stick to that. I do not recommend their Irish Style Nachos. They are dry, barely any sauce/sour cream drizzle or cheese on them, meat is flavorless and chewy, and potatoes were dry and chewy as well.   We'll be back again for sure since their beer is amazing though! :)

yOVPUXpcFgkQSwCyf7KKkA.review_text: What can I say, I'm a sucker for micro brews.  I'm from North Carolina and while working in San Francisco a co-worker told me about this place so I gave it a shot.  I was pleasantly surprised.  It started a little shaky though as when I walked in no one greeted me and I wasn't sure whether to sit down myself or wait for someone.  I finally asked and was just told to sit anywhere I liked.  I was greeted by a nice waiter and just asked for a flight of 4 beers and asked him to pick for me.  The beers arrived and while I didn't like all 4 I certainly found one I did like, they had dozens more on tap if I wanted to try more.  The one I settled on was the St. Rogue dry hop red and it was good! For food I went with exactly what my co-worker recommended.  I had the cup of Chili and three slider kobe burgers, one with blue cheese.  The food came quickly and was well presented and most of all absolutely delicious!  I enjoyed every bite and secret tip, dunking the sliders into the chili sauce at the bottom of your cup is a good way to get at the final drops.  I will probably pick something up on the way out of here, some souvenir to remind me of this place and will most certainly come back should I ever return to the city.  Thanks Rogue Ale House!

m6Fnq2xZoDlcktVIWn33zQ.review_text: The reason I give it 2 stars is because the Trivia on Thursday night is legit.  The beers are good and that's where it ends.  The bartender was a dick.  We decided to do some shots and asked to make a mind eraser.  A very simple shot that he messed up.  Fine, we tipped well and explained that you have to putt ice in a rocks glass, pour kahlua, then vodka, and finish it off with soda.  We didn't care how much we just wanted it and were tipping at least $1 per.  The bartender told us that they don't make shots. I'm sure the owner would like to profit from a 7-8 dollar drink that take seconds of man power and less in liquor costs.  Plus the drinks were WEAK.  My gf doesn't even like strong drinks and she asked me to order a shot on the side.  If all you want is beer than this is a decent spot, if you're looking for a good time this is not your place.

Uqg8zgMw-JYJNpjVtFXqng.review_text: I lived in North Beach for a year before checking this place out. My girlfriend and I wanted to try somewhere new for drinks. Well, Rogue is a fine place and all. I don't know..the atmosphere isn't the greatest. No cool decor to speak of. But then again, it is a place to DRINK and the beers are good.   Mediocre bar.

9alMH8JqU_T_VuNQ58mJJQ.review_text: The Beer is Good The food is ok But go for the beer not the food. I think you can probably get a meal beer flavor here.

vDxLhMtTBD23QZCNIqByXg.review_text: For the longest time, I had trouble finding a proper selection of Rogue brand beers at bars/taprooms in the city, that was until I discovered this North Beach gem. I've been a regular here for about 4 years and each time I come here, it's like falling in love all over again. First off, this place is strategically located on a busy street corner, with an excellent view of the park and access to multiple transit lines, so there is definitely no excuse for not being able to get to this spot. The whole set up of this place is great, they have plenty of seating throughout the establishment, a full bar area with 20+ taps, great Rogue decor, a merchandise area, and some of the friendliest staff members around. I love that this place is fully stocked with all the current rogue craft beers and many of the Rogue spirits. If you make your way to this part of North Beach, stop by and grab a Double Dead Guy XS and a shot of Dead Guy Whiskey; just make sure you clear your afternoon schedule :)

s16-BUo-orUsELvMu5ocKg.review_text: Looking to entertain a beer lover? Bring 'em here. There's also plenty of non-beer alcoholic concoctions for those who don't enjoy the brew (*raises hand*). The bar has most standard liquors, liqueurs and mixers, and the bartenders are happy to mix anything you ask. I got a sweet tea vodka tonic because...why not? It was pretty good, though perhaps a tad too sweet. Service is fast and efficient. I only sampled the fries, which seemed pretty good, so I can't say much about the food. Lots of interesting merchandise for you to browse too, should you get bored with the conversation.

ixkowXi7lBYN0oy9Nkm2oA.review_text: Came here when it was slow in the middle of the day. Bar was wide open. The bartender was super friendly. I ordered two flights and liked almost every single beer I tried. For food, I ordered the ham Cuban sandwich. Nothing to write home about but it was pretty good. The chips that came with it were just alright. You come to this place for beer anyway.   I would definitely go back - good beers and good bartenders.

eYEniw97acNxP3-fH8HJYA.review_text: This was such a let-down. I have had several beers by Rogue, so I was excited to visit this spot, now that I'm living in San Francisco. We came here on Saturday evening. I expected a much better atmosphere. Truthfully, I felt like I was in a Knights of Columbus hall (we sat in the back room). It was oddly decorated, and the crowd was incredibly random. Anyway, my boyfriend and I each got a flight of 4 beers we hadn't tried yet. Neither of us were blown away. The chocolate stout was great, but aside from that, everything else was "meh". Additionally, the spaces in the wooden-paddle in which the beer glasses sat.. were filled with beer. So every time you grabbed a glass, it would drip all over you. An easy fix would have been to soak up the spilled beer with napkins, but our waitress was nowhere to be found. We received the check, waited over 15 minutes for her to come back, so we eventually walked to the bar and asked the bartender if he could close us out. Unfortunately, he told us snootily "I'm not your server". Oh.. I.. wasn't aware? I thought you were? Hmm..  Sarcasm.  We looked around, still no sight of our waitress, sat back down, waited several more minutes. Our waitress pops in and says "you guys are so quiet back here" as if that is a valid excuse to not check up on us. Perhaps if we had shouted "WAITRESS" we would have received better service?  I'm so confused by this establishment. Likely will not be returning.

kpwuR1gDG_RpLDLhciuA3g.review_text: Awesome, was so glad to stop by here.  Didn't get food only drinks.  The beer flights (samples) were great because you are able to choose which ones you want to try.  Found a Double Dead Guy here for purchase! Woot! Hadn't been able to find any in Michigan.

zIZVrlmMktTuJdENb40DPw.review_text: Rogue and guest tap beer selections are really good. Consistently meh service though. Server Tim today made me feel like I was bothering him every time I ordered something.

d8z9uG3SHTgkCNj5iVcG8w.review_text: A swinging 2- to 4-star experience, depending on who you're with, when you come, and what you're coming for. I've been to Rogue in the past to grab a quick beer on an evening bar crawl, but came and stayed for the first time last night with a group of friends for Wednesday trivia.   In short, the beers are pretty good, the food is an easy pass, and the service is hit or miss.   Literally. Our server remembered ~75% of the things we ordered (a notepad would have helped greatly), delaying the time we received those beers/food even further past the half hour it already took to run things out of the kitchen. Fancy, intricate dishes, like, you know, fries. Boo on being out of most of our first-choice beers, although I know those aren't the easiest things to control. :,-(   The trivia night (Wednesdays at 8 pm) are a lot of fun, and very-well run and organized. Make sure you get their up to an hour early to grab a table if you have a large party. There are about 6 rounds, and people get pretty intense. There are prizes for the 1st-3rd place finishers. It takes a couple hours if you're staying the whole time, and please, keep the smart phones in your pocket!   The food - all of it - I'll pass on in the future. My Hamburger & Fries ($9) were akin to an elementary school cafeteria lunch. The meat seemed off, way too much mayo, wilted lettuce. The lettuce they use in the salads is very thinly shredded romaine, that also seemed tired and old. Maybe after a few beers, but definitely not for dinner out.   The beers are tap (that are readily available) are fairly good. They've got a wide spread of beers along each end of the hoppiness scale, and while the pumpkin ale I initially wanted was out, the other pumpkin-something beer I got was great ($7).   I'll return for the trivia, the beers, and the friends.

fkawweeCwxO7cWq8EgEkFw.review_text: If you are visiting SF and like beer tasting, then this is an easy stop in North Beach.  The place is pretty large, so you can chill at the bar or sit at one of many tables.  The barkeep(s) are knowledgeable about their brews and can help you through the tasting process until you find the one(s) you like.    I came here after work, and it wasn't crowded, and I enjoyed several of the brews including the Dead Guy varieties

3bPPhMoWH6AD5A5Im5u3WA.review_text: went with my roomie here to meet up with her friends - we had two groups here...one at the bar and one at the table.  i found it strange that i've been out in north beach a ton this past year and never saw the place...pretty big place too.  most were watching the game.  there's a back room with a big projection of the game.    beers were decent - didn't try much but the juniper IPA. nice. was in a jim & ginger mood though.   if i still smoked, i would have enjoyed the large back patio with tables. but it started raining so that was blah too.   will likely be back in the next escapade in north beach..

E_1rVCWq4NgbXhEjMC651Q.review_text: I was here a year ago and enjoyed the experience so much I try to get back here whenever I'm in SF.   The love affair continues.  Came in on a weekday night and had a bunch of beers of different types that I mostly enjoyed. The bartender, Hannah, was great. She was talkative and was quick to refill beers and provide menu suggestions.  I had a Kurobuta Ham Sandwich that was awesome. Crispy on the outside and sweet and cheesy on the inside. Recommended highly.  I'll see you in 2011.

rI_ETKjRhH6yJtUTNHpJdQ.review_text: I typically like Rogue Ales when I buy them off the shelf, but this place was a great disappointment.  The afternoon we went in they were out of many of their beers (we tried to order a half a dozen of them until we hit on one that was in), the place was dirty (there were literally tons of little flies buzzing around our tables and this was inside, mind you), and the food was mediocre.    I would avoid this place, but I'll still buy Rogue Beer from time to time because they do make some tasty brews.  Too bad that this place doesn't live up to the taste and quality of their beers.

oKE0RLbreFv1zr5zkM3ddA.review_text: 3.5 stars based on one visit.  My food sucked, but everyone else's was good. Beers were good, but ambiance leaves something to be desired.

NDbtki1BO62uoS8Hbjgnxg.review_text: I am a beer snob I guess you could say since I work at a brewery and I was disappointed with this place. Especially since I was looking forward to going to Rogue so much. We walk in and the bartender wasn't even worried about saying hello. We asked him for our beers and they were barely cold. Now I know that some brewpubs serve their beers not as cold since you can taste the flavor better but this was borderline warm. We moved to a table when our friends showed up and our server was nice but didn't have the answer to any question we had. She obviously didn't have any beer knowledge and wasn't trained properly. We ordered food and the plates had lots of chips in them they should have been thrown away. Food wasn't bad we had the hummus, cheese bread, irish nachos, and chicken strips. Irish Nachos and cheese bread were the best. As for the retail section they had a great beer selection. For clothing they had like 5o wire hangers on a rack with like 15 random shirts. Maybe 2 of the same shirt all different all random sizes some not even from Rogue it was really weird. I kinda seemed like this location was forgot about and left to fend for itself. Overall very underwhelmed.

l7xatkBieP2okLKfqOrjww.review_text: Rachel C. had been raving about the Kobe Burgers and Chocolate Stout and boy was she right.  We went there on a Thursday, which happened to be during the Red Sox run at the World Series and Trivia night.  To say the least the place was packed.  The Kobe burger was cooked to perfection and the beer was excellent well worth the wait.  A great place to go for a casual meal with friends.  Not sure that I would order anything else.  The burger was that good.  Parking is bit of nightmare in that area...  Check this place out...

twhotuS7I63ockaEw3uzKw.review_text: After storming out of Iluna Basque restaurant across the street due to bad service, we were pleasantly surprised with our experience here.  The place is laid back with friendly waitstaff. The food is pretty good for pub food -- I mean, bacon is one of the appetizers. Awesome.   Good place to grab a beer, some food, and watch the game.

PCMwR2hEJFisU65D6ojGBw.review_text: Don't waste your money on the food - tried it 2-3 times and left unimpressed each time...even when simply expecting 'bar food.'  Stick with their Rogue brand beers and you should come out okay .

YDkC5VVT8s9NlIZtAr8NUA.review_text: So, ever stumble onto greatness by accident?  Well, upon my second day vacationing in San Francisco, I went venturing to the bars and restaurants surrounding Washington Square at about 11pm (prime time for debauchery). BUT I happened to be hungry and stumbled in to Rogue Ale House without even seeing the signage.  Now here's the kicker, I've been a fan of Dead Guy Ale for at least 5 years. I thought I walked into heaven as I found all the Rogue Nation beers on tap...then asked, idiotically at that, "hey what's the name of this place" -10 cool points  Anyhow, fresh Dead Guy Ale is amazing, the flavor notes are much stronger. Deep, almost hearty flavor with a mid colored honey. Also, I ordered a Bacon/Bleu cheese burger...probably the best I've ever had. THICK cut bacon had a slight brown sugar sweetness, Bleu cheese was sharply savory, the bun had a thin crust, soft, almost pillow-y. Other notables include Shakespeare Oak ale, Irish nachos, and Kobe taco salad.  It's been since July but I've compared every other beer and burger combo to this same one...none have come close in 5 months. Rogue Ale House serious has my heart...or...another reason why "I Left My Heart in San Francisco"

XG-JynrbKiiNaqT4ffdI_w.review_text: Good bar food, great beer. Decore is kinda ugly and boring, and there is too large of a Rouge merchandise display which makes you wonder if its a bar or a retail store. They also have an outdoor "beer garden" with palm tree shaped heaters which is kinda cool. But again, great beer. Go here for the beer and maybe a kobe beef burger. Yummy.

5hHGHTb_8mlsI3On6WiCjg.review_text: Chocolate beer! Need I say more? Drinks are affordable and there's a ton of appetizers and dishes to choose from. Haven't tried their food either :P But they have good cheap beer and Happy Hour twice a day M-F. Service was good, but I don't need much service to be happy. They leave you alone so you can just sit drink a beer and chat. And they have a digital jukebox if you want music. This place is simple and good. I'll be back again soon :)

AqwTAjoyG5HfhQi2-ab4cw.review_text: I got the cobb salad and the boyfriend the burger. Everything here is simple, classic. My friend noticed that they incorporate beer in many of their food items (beer bread and beer marinated chicken). All in all, the atmosphere is good and the no-fuss fare solid. A good hangout spot.

cqzB4EbxLx2WJDEBf_keIw.review_text: Great beer selection and ambiance!  I would go back for drinks and hanging out any day.  Food..bleh..menu had lots of "hot" words and beer flavored/simmered/soaked ingredients.  I had the Reuben and my friend had the Chicken Pita..both lacked strong flavor, quantity, and presentation.  Maybe I should've had a kobe beef burger which they seem to push with a full page dedication, but why have stuff on the menu that you're going to half-ass?  Again I'd  happily go again for drinks with friends but I'd make sure to eat dinner before getting there!

BI_PXSF5M61S8O9bqR7VVA.review_text: Wide range of beers in a dive bar environment. I'm not the type of person to drink beer, let alone, dark beer. So the bartender was kind enough to recommend me Great White (or some Shark named beer) and it was light and refreshing. Super good! Great for all you ladies : ) Bonus: They'll let you taste a beer before buying!  FYI: ATM in their bar charges $2.50 surcharge.

VaK27H1hooye5Jw-xC9uYA.review_text: Intimidatingly good beer selection. Outdoor seating with heaters, so you can bring you pup. Food is only ok, but the beer and people watching will bring you back.

IQWLt0OrZfZQYgB-FJxZWg.review_text: The beer at Rogue is great.  They have a extensive list of beers from around the area on top of their beers brewed at their main facility.  I had the 21 Ale, the Chipotle  Ale, and the Brutal IPA.  Each of these beers was worth the price.  I recommend buying them in the store, or even at the Ale House.  But....  Twice the people I went with were wronged.  One ordered the same beer as I did and was served in a smaller glass.  Another friend ordered two vodka tonics and the second was served in a smaller glass!    The food was the worst.  Frozen tatortots.  A french dip that had some rancid flavored meat between to old buns. But the truly terrible menu item was the sampler.    Listed as made from Kobe beef were some meat balls, a slider, some sausages, and chips.  The kobe beef slider was not kobe beef, it was a frozen slider.  The meat ball was rock hard and had to be cut with a knife.   We sent it back and got it removed from the bill.  When the waiter came to clear the table, he grabed the sampler plate and said "let me get this pile of shit out of here for you."    Don't eat here.  Drink here.  nuff said

G11NhJgHEM1TKMwpgl5A9w.review_text: Great vibe outside.  They had plenty of board games for us to play and a huge selection of beers.  Bathrooms were dirty and always a line. Overall, fun time.

VgtcRwMPiAEeuPsayXB4kA.review_text: Good taps, good service, lame french fries (no garlic fries!!!).

0kSXMbNFo7mdwTPj4iQv9A.review_text: Rogue is a pretty decent pub. It offers an awesome (and extensive) beer selection, tasty (but slightly overpriced) food, and decent service (that gets the job done with minimal smiles).   For my meal, I had the kobe beef cheeseburger with a side of french fries and a Shakespeare stout. All in all, a pretty solid meal.   If you looked up "A-OK" in the dictionary, I think a there would be a picture of Rogue Ales Public House listed right after a picture of my body, circa 2002 or so.   I need to get back to that size. But first, I need to stop having a kobe beef cheeseburger, fries, and a beer as a meal.  But who wants sit around and review Subway all day on Yelp?

pEkGlFWNIU8XkPwcJ1jOgQ.review_text: Order the 1/4 cheeseburger if you're in the mood to sit on the toilet all night.  I'm literally sitting on the toilet right now as I write this! I'm soooo F-ing pissed off! I'm on vacation and this is what I get for eating your shitty food.....PUN INtended! I missed my Cirque De Soleil Kurios show cuz I'm too busy sitting in the bathroom! $110 a ticket! Learn how to cook and rotate food properly!

jOZheuOkUGKp4htT0xHIlA.review_text: Lots of pluses, a few minuses. But GREAT beer so I'm giving it 4 stars.   I love that they have about 15 different Rogue beers on tap on any given night & about as many "guest" beers (one of them being Bud Light...seriously??). Of course I wanted to try them all, but I started with their American Amber & hubby got the hefeweizen. The Amber was delicious, it reminded me of Alaskan Amber. The hefe was a tad sweet & slightly citrusy. I loved their outdoor beer garden with long picnic tables & umbrellas. We were here on a Sunday night so it wasn't crowded at all & the weather was unseasonably warm so we could enjoy the outdoors without freezing our buns off.   I was ravenous when we arrived so I ordered the Kobe burger with cheese & bacon. I'm not really into burgers but that night I just needed a heavy meal. Plus I only hear great things about Kobe beef. My burger was good, but it tasted like a regular ol' burger to me. Maybe someone can tell me why Kobe beef is so great? No biggie, I did enjoy my burger with wasabi mayo, toasted Kaiser roll, shoestring fries, & a big pickle on the side. Hubby got the Rogue Dip, a roast beef sandwich with swiss & au jus on the side. Looked too beefy for me but he really liked it. Unfortunately after wolfing down my burger I couldn't manage another beer so I had some of hubby's Hazelnut Brown. Yum! It was rich & caramely. Too bad I was so full.   This seems like a nice spot to meet friends & hang out. The inside is a bit run down & dark so get a table outside if you can. The service was a bit off since we were on the patio but I think it was because it was a slow night & they didn't have many servers on staff.

CIT2QNZ_i4DGjTVz_SUieg.review_text: After tasting at the Portland, Oregon location I had anticipated better. I appreciate Rogue's range on the heavy, smokey, earthy flavor profiles. The Hazelnut Brown Ale is my favorite and the Voodoo doughnut Maple Bacon Ale the craziest! I've been to the institution of Voodoo Doughnuts in Portland, and I get that it is a huge favorite in that city, but doughnut flavored beer.... I give. Service is also lacking at this location. Moving on...

yCBeVvKt0M7o57sSRqp4xg.review_text: Double Chocolate Stout plus Game 1 of the World Series are a winner.  Service was very proficient and they did hire more staff and added two new televisions/flat screens for the game.  Well Done!

AWYMmXq1EvuXeE_9YUfRtQ.review_text:
I have never seen Rogue crowded and after several bad experiences, I understand why: HORRENDOUS SERVICE! When a server FINALLY came over, I ordered a bloody mary and when she returned she said that they were out of their "usual mix" but gave me another type... it was disgusting- warm and thick with bacon in it. I realize beer is their specialty, but they DO offer a full bar as well. During another visit to Rogue,  a server told me they cannot make ANY adjustments to the food or they "get in trouble." If you're hoping to add avocado to your sandwich or skip the mayo, this is not the place to go... they simply don't care to make their patrons happy. This is the type of service that is semi understandable if they're slammed, but if they can't take care of the 7 people in the bar, they'll never earn enough customers to be that busy!
  On a sunny day the back patio is hard to resist but after the experiences I've had at Rogue, I will never go back.

64ni_KeQRBXixeg9V90t_g.review_text: This is my go-to place when I have people visiting from out of town. Wander around the downtown shopping, then through China Town and buy some fortune cookies still hot off the press, and then make my way through North Beach to hang out and a grab a beer. Well I don't think it has ever just been a beer, singular.... It would be impossible to only choose one beer with the myriad of beers to choose from! Their variety is amazing and I definitely suggest getting some sort of sampler- the best way to go.

OMoBzr4FhDkk7yV8zYtmiw.review_text: I was parched.  It was nice to mix it up since there are so many beers on offer.  I went from the Chocolate Stout, to the Black Lager and finished with a Cappuccino something or other before moving on to their spirits.  Dead Guy Whiskey - Yuck Oregon Single Malt Whiskey - Yum

q02KHjBcWLwemlKHIUQHNA.review_text: Great beer menu. There is a hidden beer garden in the back which is one of the only outdoor patios in North Beach.

qXpEaTxiOoKtibjZoj9DPQ.review_text: Went here for some drinks while we waited for our dinner reservation. Great, chill atmosphere. The staff were really friendly too. I had the Hazelnut Brown Nectar based on other Yelpers. It was delicious! We did order an app which was just meh. I don't know how there other food is but I did see some interesting food specials that I would like to come back and try.

0sidDfoTIHle5vvHEBvF0w.review_text: The sunny enclosed beer garden and awesome beers make Rogue Ale a perfect spot to enjoy a sunny afternoon.  This one of only a few bars in the city with a great outdoor patio, and I really recommend it.  The Kobe burgers are amazing and their beers have won more awards than any other micro-brewery.

jVaiCNmWOjoI0led5LZuyA.review_text: Avoid the fish and chips. For $14, you get 4 small fragments of fish and a small plate of fries.There's no lemon or tartar sauce to accompany it either, so I did my best with a splash of vinegar and smatterings of ketchup and mustard (it didn't work well). Also, the Mom Hefenweizen should be avoided as well. It has no floral/fruity finish or flavor like a hef should. It just sort of tastes like a less carbonated Bud Light. That's not exactly what I expect from a brewery.

nY9eEoPx62SxTwj1JbPrSg.review_text: I liked this place. It was close to where we were eating dinner and we were early for our reservation so headed here to get one quick drink. The bartenders are really cool and the patrons are funny. We sat next to some guys who were definitely regulars and they were fun to chat with. Bf had a rogue pale ale and I had a gimlet, less than $10, so it seems pretty cheap for a place in North Beach in my opinion and there aren't really douchey people in this bar, which I like.

hsVTd09F1ZuVl-UQgfYj-Q.review_text: When I first discovered craft beer  almost a decade ago, Rogue was already a well established name on the scene. Along with Stone's  Arrogant Bastard, Rogue Dead Guy Ale was one of the first brews that swerved my interest from lagers to ales and macros toward good beer in general.  It really is cool that a brewery from Oregon has a taproom in California, right in the heart of San Francisco. Being in the City, I could not resist the urge to relive the memories and try some fresh Oregon legendary beer off the tap.   The interior has a very laid back, almost warehouse atmosphere to it with Rogue insignia spread all over and around. The taproom is not extremely large but they have plenty of seating. You can sit where you like and the server comes over to the table and takes your order. We did not get to try any food and went right to beer tasters.   They only do flights of their standard taps and no XS series, thought they have more than several on draft. This was slightly disappointing because I tried most of the standard Rogue brews and was looking forward to trying some of the beers that are harder to find or/and too expensive in bottles. No luck there. So we decided to go with two flights, each consisting of four 4oz sample glasses. While none of the beers were foul, there was not a single one that I loved so much that I would immediately repeat and get a pint of. Even good ol Dead Guy didn't taste as good as the first time.For a brewery out of Oregon with a taproom in California, one would think their main goal would be to present most of their beers to the widest possible audience. Not serving any of the XS series in flights does not go toward that goal at all. I am sure Rogue won't go out of business because of this, but it would certainly be nice to cater towards beer folks, not just casual beer drinkers or lost tourists.  All put together, I wouldn't mind coming to Rogue again and get a pint of one of the special brews, as they don't come in flights. However, that and the pricing might be a bit too much to give Rogue Public House more than a 3 star ranking. Even two flights we had came to $18 which is not cheap for the quantity given. Considering all the beer options in SF, Rogue fits right in the middle...you can have better but also much worse.

5_gbaJzM9w_oAvLf7ARBWA.review_text: Environment- clean, casual gastropub vibe, tons of taps, an underutilized beer garden space, and a decent view of North Beach.   People- everyone seemed nice and minded their own business. Unpretentious crowd, casual beer drinkers,  Beer- pretty amazing. Getting Rogue on draft is wonderful, they keep their beer menu updated and fresh. If for some reason you got dragged to this beer bar but wanted a cocktail, they do those too, and well. Their Moscow Mule rivals any other I've had in town.

E3CmcQiN8YeQbfsCnNv_cQ.review_text: I love Rogue!  Great Beer Selection and if you join "Rogue Nation" you get like 25cents or 75 cents off any Rogue Pint!  I have never eaten there and by the previous posts I am kinda glad!    It is my neighborhood bar with no frills!  Go there to start or end the night, they also have trivia night! Which I am dying to try, I just have to remember what night it is on...!

umte1cjoM-Bnh2gOR3GQCg.review_text: I have a really hard time giving a bar with a great tap selection anything less than 4 stars, and despite the fact that I still frequent Rogue, the place could use some improvements. I've ordered food here a few times, and never been super impressed. It's standard, nothing horrible, but I would definitely only order here again in a drunken munchies state. The staff here ranges from sassy to rude. I have more often than not gotten a snooty comment or glare while ordering at the bar, and twice have been served the wrong beer (or a beer i just hadn't ordered) which i was pressured into paying for. But, again, I love Rogue ales, and their guest beer list includes some great names, so alas I shall be back.

W2hm3o_S0lSyPtWYa-lgAQ.review_text: The beer is amazing and the bartender knew his stuff.  My brother, husband, and I all enjoyed the atmosphere - we went on July 25 and Christmas in July was being celebrated - snowman outside, christmas carols sung and candy canes were passed out.  My brother is a homebrewer and asked a bizzilion and one questions - none of them took the bartender off guard.

GHWOoXB0LwA1-aykczpJIg.review_text: A great pub.  The atmosphere was wonderful, ambient noise was low enough that it was easy to converse with others.  The food was good, though a bit salty.  Staff was incredible, very knowledgeable about the menu and the libations.

aN3bpfDLsMjQloJ_4-P13Q.review_text: It's Rogue, you've got to love Rogue, I love Rogue even though I don't really drink beer anymore. I had some vague notion once that the brewery itself was worker owned or something, I may have just been tricked by the red stars on most of the bottles.   Anyhow what you get here is tons of Rouge beers on tap, as well as various beers from guest breweries all at $6 a pint. There's also hard liquor, and a $6 sweet tea cocktail, which I wish I had noticed before I ordered the pomegranate cider.   2pm on a Tuesday is a great time to sit at the bar, ask the slightest question about any of the beers and receive a free sample in a large shot glass.   What you don't want to do at Rogue is eat. I required a snack today so I went with a cup of the Beer Cheese Soup, and while it fixed my crashing blood sugar, it was terribly over-salted, reminding me of the time I sampled the "Brewers Platter" (cheese plate) at the location in PDX and they gave me mushrooms. Mushrooms? On a cheese plate? WTF?  I may be lying about not wanting to eat here though, as I am seriously tempted to return for the oyster stew, only available after 5pm. Yes, I see oyster stew with a few beverages and a board game in my future.

Lu8y2ayxVlAzuJEVfVcH4w.review_text: One day, my guy and I stopped into Beer Revolution in Oakland. We saw this pink bottle of Rogue Voo Doo Dougnut Maple Bacon beer and just had to have it. It became his favorite beer, which he calls the Holy Grail. Lol.  So then we went to Portland to visit Rogue and were smitten with more of thier tasty brews, the Hazelnut Brown Nectar, the Chocolate Stout, the Chipotle Ale, Morimotos and the Organics line....the flavors never cease to inspire fun beer tastings and recipes made from these wonderful brews.   So after a date night in North Beach, we decided to stop over at the Rogue Public House. That's when we saw it,  THE PINK BOTTLE. It's a whole new Voo Doo Doughnut Peanut Butter Banana Ale! Get it while it lasts!!!   We had a couple beers there and bought two bottles of the new Voo Doo and a Chiptole Ale. This made for a fun beer tasting party over the Holidays and I might have to go back to get more.

dx1Itg9lWj385k7wo7KH6g.review_text: Rogue is the best brewery there is. The service here is awesome. The guys really know what they're talking about.

_D25AL2bbVQNOJLOrdk0uQ.review_text: Great place to get a flight of beer to try out and your normal pub food.

olMA-PsdkA9d6bDnlYJz0g.review_text: We stumbled upon quiz-night on Thursday and the place had a nice atmosphere going. We got good service, and the beer selection is really good. The food is fairly low quality though. The pork sliders were dry, the coleslaw had onions in it and the portion was tiny. The chicken strips were really plain and a bit dry too. So don't expect good food, but do expect good beer. Dry-hopped Red Ale was a particular stand-out for me.

2MPTbMgbVCwUClgCKP75MA.review_text: Amazing place in North Beach. Came here with my roommate with no expectations and ended up having a great day that I wont be forgetting anytime soon. Great patio that on a sunny day is essential to be at in North Beach. They have games like jenga that you can use while you drink beers with friends and others. I had 2 flights of beer for $8 each which was a great deal. Food is good as well, great drinking food that compliments the beer. Awesome beer of all varieties, my favorite was the dead guy which I ended up getting a growler of. I will be coming back again very soon, highly recommend it and bring as many friends as you can.

me12xQhNiGNnau9rHus3HQ.review_text: Excellent beers and wild crowd. Great host in James
